The veggies turn out great... similar to roasting but it takes a lot less time. Just toss your what you’re cooking lightly in olive oil and the machine does the rest.It’s also very easy to clean.  The only thing I would improve is the release button on the basket... it’s a little tricky at first to get the hang of... but after a few surprise drops, I’m now trained to make sure it’s resting a counter before releasing the basket. We’re having fun with it so far.This would be a good appliance for very small apartments, motor homes, or boats because it can actually function as your main oven.

CommentsTitle: We didn't even know we would love this, but we do
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I added this product onto our wedding registry because I was running out of items we needed.  We didn't even know we needed this, but we love using it nearly every day.  Actually, the one we were gifted was broken and Cosori sent us a brand new replacement immediately so high praise for their customer service. We love the larger 5.8 quart size and is non-stick and cleans *super* easily which is great for someone like me who hates to wash dishes.A few tips to convince anyone on the fence about getting an air fryer:  - Costco pre-cooked bacon tastes AMAZING in this.  - Leftover pizza tastes even better than fresh pizza in 5 minutes, no preheat needed.  - Tons of Trader Joe's frozen foods cook perfectly and really easily in this like their cauliflower gnocchi, chicken tenders, corn, and turning fresh asparagus and butternut squash zigzags into alternative fries.  - Leftover veggies reheat well in this with a nice char which makes it better than the fresh dishOur so-called "instant" pot is never coming up from under the counter again while this Cosori air fryer is the only table-top appliance we don't store away between uses because we use it so often.

CommentsTitle: Unresponsive Buttons poor quality I'll be looking for a new fryer.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I love using the air fryer! It cooks almost as fast as a microwave, but with way better results. That saidThe reason I'm giving it 2 start is the "touch" screen. It's not responsive and sometimes takes several pushes to start working. It's terrible and if I didn't throw the box away it would be returned.Update:After using this fryer for a few months it gets 1 star. It cooks fine, when I can use the buttons... However the basket has screws that need to be tightened regularly or the basket will not lock together and the base will fall off. This has happened twice while loaded with food, which ended up on the floor.Lastly the 3rd party app that they use to control the Wifi, which I only use because the buttons don't function properly, tracks your location. I find that completely unacceptable. When I spoke with the app company they say it so they can set the clock. (seriously..... )

CommentsTitle: Loved this machine for its entire 1 week life.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I was a huge fan of this machine.  Used it daily for the first week i had it.  Then while using it on day 8 it stopped running in the middle of cooking.  Thought it may have over heated so turned it ofd and let it cool for an hour and I even tuned on a fan to help cool it down.  It started again but would not stay on.  The lights would flash on then off and then back on.  I  cleaned it up and put it away for the week and decided I wpuld give it one more try before returning and no luck.  Started and the turned off.  Went through it twice and then it would not turn on again.  Returning tomorrow

CommentsTitle: Great fryer but accessories had issues
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2019
CommentsContent: Ordered model CP158-AF, which is nice matte deep red, on Oct. 14, 2019 with delivery window of the 15th by 9 p.m. It arrived before 5 p.m. It was packed nicely and the manufacturers box has a handle so it was easy to lift from packing box. There is a user manual which you should take the time to read and a recipe book about 110 pages of recipes. was starving but I went over it and over the manual.As my pictures show it was larger than I thought as I live in an apt. Make sure you have counter space to have 5" from your wall as steam escapes from the rear.*** There is a plastic cover over the basket release button.  Please make sure it's in place so it won't be pushed by accident. It will release the inner basket which is holding the outer basket and also have a solid surface to place it on before you release. I put mine on the large burner on my stove as there wasn't enough room on counter. It was enough room to pull it out so I could flip the scallops.I didn't release it until I was ready to wash it. I had to give a slight tug to remove basket from fryer because it is new. It should slid out easier with more use. The manual is very informative and the display is easy to use with pictures of preset food items.I will purchase additional accessories such as ramakens, cake and pie pan as some recipes call for them. I do have some small glass containers I can use. You can use Pyrex or anything you can use in an oven. Also a sprayer for oil.My first use was for jumbo scallops. I didn't have a sprayer so I used paper towels to dab olive oil lightly and Old Bay seasoning. There wasn't a recipe or temp and cook time so I did a search online. I did preheat of 390 and cooked at 390 for 2 mins each side. Checked and did another minute. I should of used the preset fish instead of shrimp but I'm learning.They came out delicious. They don't get brown like searing them in butter but the Old Bay added some color to them. I have Alaskan Pollack fillets I am trying next and pork chops. So far I love it and look forward to using it daily.I will do an update.***Update*** Love cooking with this! issue is the cookbook fell apart and I had only browsed through it once and a metal prong seperated from the skewer rack so I went down a star.

CommentsTitle: After 3 months of use it started to crack (Exterior)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2019
CommentsContent: We love our Cosori Air fryer, it’s working and has worked as it is supposed to be working, however after 3 months of use we started to notice that the exterior of the air fryer (is made of cheap plastic) has started to crack.I will still recommend the Cosori however youhave to be aware that the exterior is made of cheap plastic.I will update my review on a few months.

CommentsTitle: Faster than an Oven, Easy to Clean, Needs Less Time than Recommended
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 3, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my first air fryer.  It is basically a small convection oven that needs 3 - 5 minutes to pre-heat.  Cooking is about 20-40% faster than a normal oven.  Get the bigger size. We need to make a meal for 2 - 4 people and you want you food to lie flat for the best roasting. Temperature max is 400 degrees.Pros:- Preset - Buttons are easy to use.  French fried, carrot (root vegetables), meat, etc.- The cooking book and recipe manual are very helpful.- Clean-up is super easy - the metal is very non-stick as is the bottom pan that catches the drips- You can use a preset button to get an idea of recommended temperature and time but use the Time/Temp button to adjust it down- On the presets, it beeps half way through for you to "shake" the food which is helpful to see how cooked they are- I finally was able to make roasted brussel sprouts with a maple glaze that have not worked out in my normal oven- There was a plastic smell the first time I used it and a faint hint in the food, but now I do not notice it. The cooking area where your food is is metal.Cons:- Big and high so it does not fit in my pan cabinet- French fry preset was way too long.  Need about 12 minute instead, total.Tips:- Adjust the time to less than what is recommended or else they may be dry and overcooked- Spray the vegetables with olive oil and I use tongs to "toss" them around at the mid-point alarmI was worried about buying this brand since I had never heard of it before.  I have made complete meals, cooking the veggies separate from the cut chicken in the air fryer, and I am very happy with the purchase.  I have been using for about 3 weeks.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: It's almost twice the size of my other one.  If they made a bigger one I'd get it.  I own a smoker and would cook ribs in it for 6 hours.  I've cooked ribs in my oven.  But, 30 minutes in this air fryer makes the best ribs I've eaten.  I don't even use sauce.  Just seasoning.Bacon just 15 minutes for crispy just right.  Fries are great.  Steaks come out like they were on a grill.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2019
CommentsContent: stopped working after 2 uses and I left a bad review.  Customer service contacted me immediately and sent me a new one.  Hopefully this one will work longer.  It does an awesome job of cooking food and easy to clean.  Good customer service.  Would recommend

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2019
CommentsContent: I adore this machine. My mom and I have been wanting an air fryer for years now and shopped around EVERYWHERE for the very best one. Of course, Amazon had the best deal but was it the right one? For us? My mom’s not good at computers yet I am, what can I find that will work for us both? She needs something that she can easily figure out to use on her own while I want something that isn’t archaic looking with knobs and a CVS receipt-like list of instructions. Well, this was the answer to our prayers!It’s modern, easy to use (functions operate like a regular oven), easy to clean and figure out. Also, everything you put in it comes out instantly more delicious!We bought the accessories and the recipe book, as well, and I’m planning on cooking up a storm for Mother’s Day 2019 using just this air fryer and the recipe book! I don’t even like to cook!Forget that foods are 85% healthier because of less oil, this is so much fun! From breakfast to dessert, I’ve never been so happy to eat!P.S. My one complaint is that it is noisy to me, nothing above annoying level but it does make a consistent sound when powered on. Dependent on your kitchen layout, it could be annoying. If I’m in the kitchen with it, it’s annoying; if I’m not, it’s fine. My mom doesn’t mind it because she says you need to know when it’s on, depends on the person, I guess.

CommentsTitle: Super powerful, and VERY easy to use!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2019
CommentsContent: Works amazingly well! I've had another air fryer, but it's nothing compared to this one. Cooked my fries within 25 min, crispy, and tasty. My only complaint is the basket is difficult to dislodge from the pan itself, and I've almost dropped it as a result (why I gave 4 stars instead 5). They need to work on a better means of releasing the basket so we can wash it, and retrieve the food from it. Other than that, I'm very happy with my purchase. I've already registered for the warranty to get the extra year. Very satisfied customer.

CommentsTitle: Horrible burnt plastic smell just awful
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2019
CommentsContent: The thing  reeks of burrning plastic and the food tastes like plastic. It's horrible I was really looking forward to this but now I am totally put off of any air fryer. I may keep trying but today was WORSE than yesterday.  It did cook frozen fries and onion rings well bit I could have the same result from my oven. It's too bad they tasted like burnt plastic. I will never consider this product again

CommentsTitle: Delivered Jan. 29, 2019 heat element quit May 24, 2019
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm sorry to say I'll have to change my review from 5 Stars to One Star.  I had learned to cook many different foods in my Cosori Air Fryer.  I have bragged to my cooking friends and relatives about how good the food was when cooked in the Cosori.  My daughter from TN visited us today and I was showing off demonstrating how to use the Cosori when the heating element in the Cosori quit.  The fan started blowing cold air.  My husband and I were cooking with this Air Fryer almost everyday.  I loved the foods I had learned to cook in my Cosori.  I am extremely disappointed that it only worked for four months.  I'll have to try another brand of Air Fryer.

CommentsTitle: Buy this only for the Smart/wifi feature. Everything else is just Okay, but the smell kills it!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Review COSORI Smart WiFi Air Fryer 5.8QTPro:-Good size not to big and tall, inside is wide.-Fast Cooker!-Simple to use-Have Good Wifi rang-Smart Feature can notify me on the phone when the food is done! Also custom your meal setting.-Easy to clean!Con:-Inside might be wide, but  the basket is wasting some space when the pan under it is so much larger.-Poor height, this might be wide, but also short, can't or have hard time fitting a whole  large chicken. Small 3lb is good. I did got a 5lb fit, but need to push flat as possible for it to fit. It had about 1cm clearance from the heating element, which is not ideal and it came out dry. The 3lb was still juicy due to more clearance and space for the air to heat it.-So much plastic on the front cover, as it trap water inside after wash.-Because it traps water, after rinsing, when you cook again, there will be steam comes out under or inside the basket (some people have noted this as smoke, but is just steam).-Nasty smell, I don't know what it is, but after 10min of cooking there is a nasty smell, like plastic or non-stick coating. I really don't know what it is, but I would guess is the thick plastic from the front cover. It's still there after weeks of use! ( I also did washed before using it the first time!)-Pre-set options are awful! They always over cook and burn my food. (Unless you are cooking very large or fill whole basket full, don't use the pre-setting!)-The key/touch pad buttons as one of the worst I have use. It either reads your touch to much or don't at all, as other have stated. Mine so falr haven't fail yet.-No dehydrator option, even though it can do it. But since COSORI sells a dehydrator oven they left this option out, other Fryer in the market have this option handy. Final Thought:I only pick this cause it was on sale under $100, and it has smart wifi. The App is handy as it can control the unit if the touch pad does fail one day. Cooking food is great as long you don't use the pre-setting, like cooking frys and pre-cook chicken wings from the freezer does not need 25min, rather a 12min is done! and that's fast. My conventional counter oven would take 15-20min. Food comes out not as crunchy/crispy as some other Fryer I had used.I wish the height of the basket would be taller as another brand I had that was a 6qt was just enough to fit a whole small chicken even though it was only a little less wide as this.Finally the weird smell really kills this review. I just don't know why, I had used my friend's fryer another brand which doesn't have this issue, I really think they over used the cheap plastic cover that's causing it after it heats up, or I could be wrong. This Fryer is, really a "heat dryer" as it doesn't fry anything nor it will replace my counter Oven, because it just can't do large item or frozen bun, which best to steam. However, it does cook fast and can keep the juice in the meat, plus reducing the fat. Again it's great with meat and that's about it, everything else is just okay. It's also a bit pricey for something with so many cons, you can find way cheaper Air Fryer this size on sale if not for the smart wifi feature.  Even COSORI's other lower model which is the same size cheaper by 30%.Update 11/2020After months of use, the smell is still there, it has to do with the plastic, the smell is from the top of the unit, anytime I cook over 10min I can start to smell it. Won't find this toxic smell from my counter top oven. I have my windows open and fan on to escape the smell, if not I would of trashed this. Now I'm just waiting for this fryer to fail one day so I can get something else. Otherwise, it still cooks not to bad. They have so far a second firmware update,  don't know what they tried to improve on the unit, wish they would have a history log from app.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2019
CommentsContent: This air fryer is the best kitchen supplies I bought this year!Air fryer with WIFI is awesome!I don't have to go to kitchen to control it!This is not just fried,I can make a dessert too! I am glad they gave me the recipes book so  it makes much more easy to cook.And this size is totally enough for 2-4 people.Pretty incredible!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2019
CommentsContent: Deserves zero stars. The air fryer sent to me has not only been used, but was not even washed. Very disgusting. I will never purchase from Cosori again. I’m very surprised that it came directly from the brand manufacturer itself, not a third party. It was sold as “new”. Thankfully it can be easily returned but it was needed for the holiday weekend.

CommentsTitle: Died 2 weeks after return window, but amazing customer service saved the day!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I guess that it didn't "die", it just decided be lazy. My guess is a faulty temp sensor or some such malfunction, as it will run for 5 minutes or so, and then shut off until the whole thing cools off again. It literally behaves as it's unplugged.  If I set it to a low temp, like 200 or so, it will work for longer, but what good is that? Unfortunately, it's just out of the return window by a couple of weeks or so, and I had just discarded the original packaging thinking that it was good to go after using it every weekend for a month. I figured that I was out of luck.Cosori Customer service contacted me (see comments) and after sending an email as requested, they shipped me a new one right away. I'm typing this as delicious corn on the cob is frying in it. Yum! They shipped out the new unit quickly via FedEx and it got to me fast! I am very, very satisfied with Cosori.There's going to be a failure rate with everything, even if it's a very small percentage, and great customer service can make up for it. It did with me.

CommentsTitle: Way better than my Cuisinart TOA-60 Convection Toaster Air Fryer !!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2019
CommentsContent: When the air fry craze first hit I thought a multi-task unit was for me.  I used the Cuisinart for a year before I decided to buy a dedicated air fryer.  The Cuisinart gave me a great learning experience but it was an awful chore to clean.  Also the heating element consisted of 3 ceramic rods at the top which didn't air fry the whole basket evenly.  I settled on the Cosori after a week of You Tube videos and internet research.  In the 2 days of owning the Cosori I've only been able to fry 2 items:, ie:  chicken wings and this morning - breakfast sausages.  I can tell you that I do not miss the Cuisinart at all.  Reasons for my liking the Cosori are:  Very easy to clean.  The exposed heating element seems to burn off any grease splatter before it hots the fan grid work.  The square pan allows more food in a single layer than a round pan.  The large heating element eliminates any hot/cold spots in the fry basket.  Much smaller footprint than the Cuisinart.  There is a learning curve.  The 2 items I fried were a little too well done for my liking.  The Cosori cooks much faster than the Cuisinart so I will adjust my recipes accordingly.  I am glad that I had a year's air fry experience.  I know how to correct recipe instructions for my liking.  The experience is sufficient to allow me to review the Cosori without prejudice.  Between the Cosori and my Instant Pot I can use my range's oven for storage.

CommentsTitle: 4 Stars But Its Just Not For Me
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2020
CommentsContent: I don’t usually do reviews so I’ll keep it short.First off..this air fryer for the most part was great.  A few coworkers talked me into it so I decided to give it a shot.What I liked:I don’t think there’s anything prepared I did not like. Some of the best fresh fish I’ve ever had. This by far is the one thing that I can say may be worth the purchase alone.... Phenomenal! Potatoes, chicken, the crunch in asparagus and broccoli that I’ve never had before but could definitely get used to. Just a spritz of olive oil and seasoning. Just set and forget. Cook time is short and clean up is easy. Basket capacity is good enough to cook multiple items at a time.What I didn’t like:1.)Some may not consider this an issue but I can’t get over the smell. It’s overwhelming and can last for days.  It’s not a plastic smell that some complain about. That goes away in time. It’s a deep fryer smell that permeates through the house and lingers for days. An issue that others I’ve talked to don’t seem to have with their air fryers. Maybe better air filtration would benefit.2.) I found 2 of the screws in the bottom of the basket after a few uses. This actually didn’t bother me as much as #1.  Just a small phillips head and problem solved.3.)This contradicts one of the reasons I liked this model but...  It’s big. Make sure you have counter space to accommodate. Likely fine for most. Just takes up too much space for me personally.So in summary..I liked it , recommend it and most probably would agree.. but I have to return this one.

CommentsTitle: Getting used to correct cooking times
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve used it twice...so still getting used to it. Last night I made chicken thighs and they took much longer to reach the proper temp than the recipe had called for and I had brought them close to room temp. Not quite sure how to get the crispness on veggies like broccoli and Brussels sprouts. Have to adjust to learning curve. Appreciate your interest.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 24, 2019
CommentsContent: Just ordered this last week.  I have used it at least 10 times already.  As much as I love how it cooks food and everything comes out crispy,  the burning plastic smell has not dissipated.  It makes my whole house smell terrible and makes me nauseous! I really wanted to love this air fryer fromHow good the reviews were, but the smell is terrible!!!

CommentsTitle: Review updated after my defective unit was replaced for free.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 17, 2020
CommentsContent: PROBLEMS FIXED!!!  PLEASE SEE END OF REVIEW FOR UPDATE.I want to love my Cosori air fryer.  I saw it used on a Youtube cooking channel, and so I figured, this must be a pretty mainstream product.  I got it seven months ago and it has become a mainstay in the kitchen, and all but replaced the toaster oven, the frying pan, and even the grill.The one problem I have is that the buttons, or whatever you call those little circles on the front panel, are very difficult to press, especially with damp fingers.  It just doesn't work. What's more, when I press them, they don't activate the function immediately; they seem to work only after my finger is lifted.  A kind of delayed reaction, in other words. I can't understand why they couldn't have used an old fashioned set of push buttons, or even a mechanical dial switch.  These technologies have been around for at least 100 years and are pretty well understood.I have tried and tried to figure out how to use the buttons but they are just persnickety and only work part of the time.  Extremely frustrating and that's why I knocked the rating down from 5 stars to 2.  I'm planning to finally contact them and ask whether I have a defective unit, and if they can somehow fix the problem, I'll be happy to alter this rating.Apart from that, Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?As a cooking appliance, if you can get past the awful user interface, it's a great cooker.  It can cook 6-8 chicken drumsticks in 24 minutes and they come out absolutely delicious, juicy and tender, not raw in the middle, not burned on the outside.It makes toast reasonably well (though we don't make a lot of toast in this house).  It is great for reheating things.  It is wonderful for vegetables; one of our favorites is broccoli florets sprinkled with hoisin sauce and garlic -- just don't over cook or you get these nasty black bitter bits that are quite unappetizing.There are hundreds of videos out there demonstrating how to make just about anything in these gizmos.  I was an air fryer skeptic until I watched a few, then decided to take the plunge and get one, and now I'm sold... albeit, I wish I'd gotten one that was easier to use.They do make an app that allows you to control the air fryer from your phone.  It's what I would call a work in progress. The name of the app is "VeSync".  You run the app and it detects the Cosori as one of the appliances it can control.  That's fine for them, I suppose, but from the user's perspective, it would be so much better to have an app called "Cosori".  I have so many apps and it's impossible to remember that vesync means cosori.  Come on, who decided this was a great idea?Anyway, more on the app:  it sort of works well.  I say "sort of", because it promises more than it delivers.  There's a "cooking history" section (but no search function).  You can tap on a history item and it will start the Cosori for you, remotely; you can also alter the temp and cooking time.  Right now I can see last night's chicken, but it doesn't list this morning's pop tart from 15 minutes ago. WHY??? Maybe it takes a while to retrieve the data... I have no idea.  Just another annoyance.  The app does send you notifications when the cooker is done, if you choose to use that feature.I do like that you can add your own recipes to the app.  The thing is, it's not rocket science to use this fryer; just set time and temperature and go.  The saved recipe thing is mainly to help you not overcook or undercook, and that's a matter of trial and error.As far as cleaning and maintenance, it's pretty simple.  You pull out the basket and wash in warm soapy water.  If you're doing dry stuff like toast or reheating a bowl of soup, there's little or no cleaning.  If you're doing meat or wet veggies, you may need to do some cleaning.  I use a soft scratch sponge, but a brush also works well. It helps to soak the whole basket in warm soapy water for 20 minutes, and my wife has run the inner basket through the dishwasher a couple of times; that makes me nervous that it could damage the teflon coating, but so far it seems okay.The inner/outer basket design has plusses and minuses; you can lift the inner basket out, but if you're doing it one-handed (as one tends to do in kitchens) you need a surface under the outer basket or it will fall to the floor.  Not ideal; it would be nice if the outer basket could be retained in the machine somehow, maybe with a hook, so you don't have to position the air fryer 12" in from the edge of the counter.Liquid seems to accumulate sometimes in the space under the outer basket, maybe just condensation.  It's probably not a bad idea to wipe that up from time to time, just to prevent rusting or messing up the heat cycle.In my opinion, this appliance is still a work-in-progress. They have some issues to solve regarding the buttons and basket design.  Air fryers in general are still a new thing, but they've become very popular for good reason; they work very well for what they do.  With a few tweaks, this can be an excellent product worthy of 5 stars.UPDATE June 25 2020After I wrote to Cosori, they generously shipped me a new unit.  I'm happy to report that the buttons work much better.  As a test, I wet my finger and it still works.  I will say, the buttons still have a kind of delayed reaction -- they don't really engage until you lift your finger, which is odd, but I have gotten used to it.  Most importantly, the buttons all respond immediately now, and I don't need to repeatedly press the time/temp button to activate it.  Thanks to Cosori for properly handling this issue and I've boosted my rating accordingly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: The screws that fasten the inner basket and the handle are loose and lost. I am going to buy some in Home Depot but I don’t know the specification of the screws.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2018
CommentsContent: So, I've only cooked one thing in this so far, but it was steak and steak was what I bought this cooker for specifically. I cooked a decent sized ribeye and it was FANTASTIC! Well equal to anything I've cooked in an oven, stove top, or grill, but honestly also equal to steaks from most restaurants. The steak was tender, moist, evenly cooked and all around delicious.  Winner, winner, steak dinner!

CommentsTitle: Perfect for two, useful for four
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 29, 2020
CommentsContent: Older gent (60+) never cared for having a fryer in the house, never 'deep fried' or 'air fried,' except for attempting to make Mitford Cookbook's "Louella's Fried Chicken" in a skillet -if you know, you KNOW... [https://www.amazon.com/Karons-Mitford-Cookbook-Kitchen-Reader/dp/0670032395/ref=sr_1_1?crid=2HNF7KOIKY5CS&dchild=1&keywords=mitford+cookbook+and+kitchen+reader&qid=1590771033&s=books&sprefix=Mitford+Cook%2Cstripbooks%2C167&sr=1-1]And one equally smelly, messy but delicious attempt at making tempura, 'just because,' when the kids were little- thank you, Japanese cartoons of the late 90's! (Gotta catch 'em all.  But, after both those attempts, our common question was, "where do you put all that old oil, if you don't live in the Upper Midwest, where you can freeze it and throw it the next day or two, when the garbageman comes?")  Fast forward 15 years. The wife would never have seen the benefit of this device had we 'debated' about whether to buy it or not, except that a serious medical emergency (me) mandated some lifestyle changes on our parts (I'm ok, six months down the road, GsD).After looking at all sorts and sizes of 'air fryers' we (I) chose this model for: a) cost, b) size, c) looks, and d) functionality. Couldn't be happier. We have used it alone, (just the two of us) to make Mustard Chicken skewers (amazingly yum), 'fried' sweet potato fries, regular potato fries, and now that our kids  are home (from college/Covid) they have used it to make 'spicy carrot chips' and 'fried tofu' (daughter 'says' she's now a vegetarian, whatchagonnadoo?)- but I'll admit, those things DID taste good, and no fuss, no mess, NO OIL. Not once.This summer we plan to use it at least two to three times a week, to help free up space in a kitchen with only one stove/cooktop unit... and too many cooks! Clean-up takes all of a minute with soapy water, paper liners that absorb most of the oil; the unit itself heats up quickly, runs as it's supposed to do,  and is relatively quiet. It's effective, and looks fantastic on our counter next to our single-cup Coffee maker (Daughter is hogging that, every morning, too- LOL) and the cookbook that came with it, will give us enough recipes for months to come, as we work on our 'slow and gentle' learning curve. But I'll admit - I am kinda lusting after Urvashi Pitre's Air Fryer Revolution Cookbook...[https://www.amazon.com/Air-Fryer-Revolution-Healthy-Recipes/dp/035812087X/ref=sr_1_5?crid=1DXGN3C3YBKO&dchild=1&keywords=urvashi+pitre&qid=1590771810&s=books&sprefix=Urvashi%2Cstripbooks%2C197&sr=1-5 [Oh and wife's cholesterol has gone down- not all due to the Cosori, but due (we know) to our lifestyle/food choice changes. So, is it the greatest thing since the microwave? -maybe.  But that big/little air fryer is now definitely a part of our cooking lives. Who'd a thunk?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this air fryer after seeing the tons of review in Amazon. I was very doubtful that it might be one of those marketing tricks.Tried chicken and spicy fried peanuts.Unbelievable results. Both Cooked to perfection.1lb chicken took only 9mins to cook with 1tsp of oil at 360deg.1lb Raw peanuts + 1 tsp of oil, fried to crisp in 20 mins 320deg. Opened and Stirred every 5mins though.I couldn’t wait to try all the recipes listed in the cook book that came with the unit.I wish manufacturer provided more fixtures like other brands.Super happy with this product.These are the other factors I was worried about before buying1. Noise: I would say half of microwave. Much quieter than my hood at 1 setting.2. Plastic smell: As soon as I received the unit, washed it with soap water. Ran empty cycle for 20 mins. Smelled chemical for first 2 mins.  After that there was no smell at all3. Smoke: There was no smoke at all while cooking chicken.I was super impressed and surprised with the performance.

CommentsTitle: Preheat smoked up inside my house. Cooking fries only smoked inside the house. Not good for indoor.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I like it that it is easy to use. First, I used it for fries. It says to preheat for better and faster cooking results. The thing that I did not like was the fact that every time I preheat or just started cooking, it will always smoke up inside my house. My purpose in buying this was for easy cooking and cleaning indoor. I took it outside and tried cooking bacon and chicken eith the pre-set setting on the menu display and it cooked well. The tray is easy to clean but the air fryer itself inside wasn't easy to clean.

CommentsTitle: Major problems that are potentially dangerous!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Sooo I’ve been using my Cosori Air Fryer about two months now. One day I was using it to cook up a few turkey burgers for the kids and out of nowhere, and in the middle of cooking, the basket released itself from the fryer, slid out onto the countertop and since I have granite countertops, it kept sliding right off that surface and crashed to the floor. Very random! I was thinking I’d done something wrong. This device has to be perfect right? I mean it wasn’t exactly cheap. I’d done my homework and got one of the top rated. Maybe I didn’t lock it into place all the way. So from that point, I’d made it my business to be sure to push it in all the way until I felt it lock. All was all good for about 3 weeks and then this afternoon, I was making lunch for me and hubby. I’d put in two Burgers and was preparing us a salad when 5 minutes into the cooking process, I heard the fan stop and I turned around quickly but I was too late, the basket popped out, slid onto the countertop and then crashed to the floor. But this time, hot splatter popped onto my foot and leg...OUCH! I wasn’t badly injured but I’m baffled!!! Literally baffled! This is obviously a flaw in the design that can be potentially dangerous. Imagine if my kid was in there??? Realistically, I love this fryer! I love the design, I love ease of use and ease of cleaning and I love the way the food tastes when it comes out. But that right there, that’s BAD! One other issue...there are about 5 small screws inside that loosen on their own so I find myself tightening them at least twice a week. And lastly, don’t ever and I mean EVER hit the button that releases the basket from the tray unless you are holding it over a countertop or something. I made that mistake and the entire tray dropped out and fell on my foot. It wasn’t hot but it hurt like hell!!!Update: I contacted Cosori directly after my blackened mahi ended up all over my kitchen floor. They need to be aware of this problem. At first I was quite offended that one of the reps told me, “We will look into this issue immediately. Meanwhile, take a moment to read your Cosori Air Fryer manual!” What???!!! So you mean to tell me there is a portion of the manual that mentions this malfunction??? Because I already read the manual and it was never mentioned! Anywho....they handled the situation for me and offered to replace my current air fryer and asked me to ship them the old one so that they could investigate this. So I’m feeling that this may not be a common problem as I’ve only found a few videos of people complaining about this same malfunction (which apparently becomes progressively worse). So as of today, a new fryer has been sent and is on the way. Hoping I don’t have these problems again.

CommentsTitle: Handle falls off the basket after four months of use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2019
CommentsContent: My wife and I love this 5.8 qt air fryer. I was never much of a cook until we bought this fryer. Now I cook wings, sausages, and lots of other things in it. In fact, I cooked so much that I have now worn out the basket handle after four months of use. Two out of three screws that hold it together came out, and the handle just flops around. I managed to find one of the screws in the sink drain just after it fell out and before the disposal ruined it. However, the second one is nowhere to be found. Fortunately, the handle will kinda work with just two screws holding it together, but the whole thing feels less secure than it did with three screws. I have ordered a couple of spare baskets so I can keep using the fryer, but I am not happy with paying $25 a pop for a manufacturing issue. The screws should have been mounted so they would not back out under normal use and washing.

CommentsTitle: GREAT Air Fryer For GREAT Price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this unit, in August 2019 and have cooked with it 4 to 8 times a week since. The food turns out delicious every single time! I have NO complaints about its ability to air fry food. This is my 4th air fryer but 1st Cosori.

CommentsTitle: Owned 2 for 1.5 years, the display on one shorts out frequently
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2021
CommentsContent: These are pretty good overall, but about to replace 1 of them.  It works 80 of the time, but  the display shorts out  frequently and loses its place.The screws work themselves out after a few months on the basket.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2019
CommentsContent: This was my first experience with air-frying, and it was awful. I cooked chicken twice, and although it cooked adequately the meat smelled and tasted of melted plastic. In fact, the smell from the unit (plastic smell) permeated throughout my house. I returned the product, and this unit has deterred me from trying another. Not recommended.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2020
CommentsContent: The food that comes from this air fryer is incredible. I am in LOVE with air frying as a healthy option for quick and crispy food! BUT, DO NOT BUY THE TOUCH SCREEN MODEL!!! I have never wanted to throw something out the window so bad as this thing. It works absolutely perfectly 25% of the time, the rest it will not turn on or off! I have to unplug to turn it off almost every single time. I want to return it and buy one with a knob. So frustrating!!Edited to add: Cosori customer service is top notch! They are replacing my air fryer with a dial version (the one I wanted) and are refunding me the difference between the two models. They told me to keep the old one to use as spare parts if needed. In my opinion this is above and beyond.

CommentsTitle: Mixed feelings. Beware! Great food results though.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I am blown away with the food results. I love it's ease of use. It looks great. Holds a decent amount of food. Very fast. 99% of it I love.HOWEVER, I bought this as A Christmas gift. It's early February at the time of writing this. While handwashing the basket a week ago, i started scrubbing (with a cloth rag) what i thought was baked on food. Upon closer inspection, i realized that the nonstick coating was gelling up and easily peeling off with the lightest pressure. I'm pretty pissed. I'm actually nervous about frying food in it now due to the known risks of PTFE. Perhaps the stainless version would've been a better choice.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I had a connectivity (WiFi) issue after I moved to my new apartment.As I could not connect the Air Fryer to the same WiFi, I contacted their support to try helping me figure it out.Tia, from the support team, kept in touch for around three weeks trying to help me with this, putting a lot of effort and dedication to solve my problem. They tried everything until they decided to send me a brand new Air Fryer to make sure it was a hardware problem.When the new Air Fryer arrived, Tia notified me that their team kept investigating and they wanted me to try a different thing, which then worked! So, the problem was with my new Internet Service Provider connection, not with the Air Fryer itself.I cannot express how impressed I was with Tia's and the support team's dedication to solve a customer problem. They also sent me a prize for being patient as a customer for that long.They've got all my patience because I could see how passionate they were to have their customer's problems solved. Also, as I worked on a remote support team in the past, I know how difficult it is to troubleshoot and solve problems remotely, with no access to the customer's environment.Congratulations on the great product and great, amazing post sale support. You folks are amazing! Thank you!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I really wanted to love this airfryer! It has a large capacity, heats up well and fast, and easy to clean. It was slightly louder than the one my friend has, but that one has a smaller capacity than what I wanted for my larger family so I decided to overlook that problem. The reason I ended up returning the product is because the yucky plasticky smell just never went away. The first two times, our entire kitchen smelled like burned plastic! So disappointed. =(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2019
CommentsContent: I hate hate hate hate the look of this frier. I bought the white one which I paid extra and thought would be a shinny sleak look. It looks like some cheapest matted 3D printed parts put together except the digital window looks very nice ( I have to be fair). It’s too bulky I didn’t want to return it, so I’m using it and it’s working ok so far. Made some fast and nice fries. Unlike other comments said, It could toast bread. Get your fact right people!!! I bet it could be a dehydrator too if you set the temp low enough. Man I’m so angry giving review for this air frier I don’t know why. I guess it takes me some time to make peace with the ugly look. I will come back and give one star if it breaks on me. 😡😡

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2020
CommentsContent: Sorry, I'm not on the 5 star review bandwagon here.  It cooks well, but it's literally a burner coil with a fan that circulates air.  You're not going to find one hot fan that adds more flavor than another.  I wish I had done more research and bought something else instead.First off, it's LOUD!  We have a smaller house with an open concept kitchen/dining/living area.  When this is going it's totally disruptive to watching TV, kids doing homework, listening to music, etc...WiFi...why did I pay extra for this?  I never use it.  I can't think of a practical reason for it.  I get random notifications when I'm at work that my wife is cooking stuff in the air fryer.The buttons are hard to use.  They don't always register that I touch them more often than not.  The presets are useless.  They give you a general idea of temp and cook time, but you cannot blindly trust them.It's HUGE!  Despite it's huge size you'll find yourself limited in cooking space.  For 4 adults I have to cook fries or tots in 2 batches.Construction seems cheap.  The screws that hold the handle on are inside the basket.  One of them fell into the cooking basket and ended up in my mouth, the other two were extremely loose.If you're looking for one, look for something a little more basic.  A simple time/temp knob is all that's needed.  Look for something a little more quiet if you're cooking near your living area.  Save your money on fancy feature, you won't find yourself using them.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2019
CommentsContent: This product has excellent reviews and I would love to believe that my order is not defective. I saved money and waited for long until they discounted this air fryer but was slightly disappointed. I'm having the same issue as one of the reviews mentioned that it has a burning plastic smell while operating. It's still my first try and will keep trying it for a few times and see how it goes.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2019
CommentsContent: As a working parent, I don’t have an hour to spend in the kitchen preparing dinner, nor do I particularly enjoy cooking. Yet I want to provide a good nutritious meal for my child. I bought an instant pot thinking it’ll reduce my dinner prep times, but most of the recipes have a long list of ingredients that I don’t have time for ....so when I received this air fryer and the recipe book with super easy instructions and fewer than 10 ingredients needed, I was overjoyed. So far I have tried frozen chicken nuggets, frozen sweet potato fries, grilled cheese sandwich and teriyaki salmon. My daughter loves every dish made in it! I couldn’t be happier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 7, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I have used this air fryer a lot over the past half a year. At first, I wondered if Air Fryers were worth the hype, and I can attest to the fact that they are. I loved this thing for the first couple months, recommended it to friends who went and bought it too. Now, as much as I want to be loyal and keep the brand, find myself worried about longevity.I don't know if I would consider this air fryer to be expensive, because with as much as we use it, it is worth every penny and is about the price of a mid-range microwave. But it was a purchase I didn't have a lot of excess money for and I was bummed it hasn't lasted six months. It doesn't appear cheaply made so I wonder if I have a lemon or something.So let me jump into the issues I have after many, many uses. The worst is that the air fryer drawer pops open sometimes while cooking... almost shoots out a foot or more, clear out of the fryer itself. It had issues remaining shut previously, with steam coming out the bottom sides. I remedied that by firmly pushing it back in again and it typically "sealed" up. Now it just pops completely out of the unit onto the counter.Up until that point, the only thing I disliked is the touch screen interface it uses for programming time, temperature etc. It is finicky and doesn't always register a finger-press... sometimes pressing more than a few times to get it to register. Sometimes it will not register prints at all.So, I'm unsure if I got the lemon of the bunch, and I really want to love this air fryer. I still use it... just with caution and while I am around.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I don't typically write reviews but I love this thing. So first the disclaimer... this review is for the parents because well that's me.What I love:The wifi connection with the app- when I saw this feature my first thought was who would need this much gadgetry come on. But then there's the fact you can preheat it before u get home so it's ready or I can start it and walk away and get alerts that hey I have something cooking. You don't think it's a big thing but once you use it your like man I wish every appliance reminded me I was doing something.The basket-some reviews complained about the plastic piece and feeling flimsy or that the basket came apart too easy. That clear plastic piece covers a button. You have to slide that piece all the way up which can only be done when you have the basket out. Then you have to push the button all the way down and that releases the basket which you still have to pull out. Again that's my experience... I know things happen but that's how I worked for me. Plus the thing is huge. I easily feed my family of 3 or 4 when friends are over.The food-there is a learning curve with already prepared food like chicken nuggets or French fries from a bag. Yes I cook that stuff because I have kids and am comparable to their favorite restaurants now with this thing! I have learned to cut the cooking time in half and that's pretty accurate. The app has a ton of recipes too that are super easy for parents and not too gourmet. I do cook things that aren't in a bag and they come out amazing.I read reviews for this item and about 20 other ones. This one looked good on paper but then some of the reviews gave me concerns so I waited a month to purchase it. I'm sure there are flukes and things go wrong but for my experience it was as good as it is on paper. From a single mom point of view who has very little free time... This thing rocks!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I researched air fryers for some time before I chose the 5.8 Cosori.  It arrived and although it looked great and was packaged well, I will return it.  The problem is the drawer. It is very difficult to slide in and out and just feels very clumsy.  I will be ordering a different one.  Since I haven’t seen mention of this on reviews, I am assuming it could be defective.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   This product arrived on April 29, 2020. Today is May 19, 2020. It's only been merely two and a half weeks (ok 20 days total) and the touch screen on my air fryer is already not sensitive to touch. Refer to video. It takes several times to even try to press a button, but sometimes it works right away. It is extremely frustrating to use, especially when trying to adjust the temperature or the time because it stops letting you adjust it after being idle for a while. I cannot believe such product like this cost so much money but it couldn't even last a month. I am definitely returning this product. It's really sad because I was in love with it for the short 19 days that it shown me potential.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my first air fryer so I am totally amazed with the technology.  Instant, perfect results.  I was contemplating a new toaster oven when I got this, but one week later I unplugged the toaster oven to be replaced with my Cosori air fryer! It makes breakfast bagel sandwiches to rival Panera ... toast the bagel, fry the egg, and grill up sausage in the Cosori ... and cleanup is wiping out two baskets.  Hash browns, fries and onion rings brown to perfection ... way crispier than deep fry.  Corned beef hash cooks up great.  Turkey burgers from frozen to grilled in 12 minutes, and the bread toasts up in the same pan.  Fried chicken is wonderful with panko bread crumbs.  Hot dogs are perfectly grilled and buns are toasted to perfection.  I chose the Cosori based on customer reviews on Amazon but I checked out other brands in stores and none meet Cosori quality.  If you are new to air frying like me, an instant read thermometer is a must and something to lift dishes and pans out of the basket is good.  I use a lifter that came with a Insta Pot accessory set.  I found most of my cookware works fine .. that is, if it fits in the basket.  This air fryer has improved the way I toast, grill, bake and fry.  It's a popular cooking trend, you can Google any recioe you want online .... "How do you make a baked apple in an air fryer?"

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2021
CommentsContent: The preset buttons didn’t work well upon purchase and now only a few buttons are functional. I wish I’d done more research and bought one with a knob. It’s very frustrating cooking something when the temperature button fails to work properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2019
CommentsContent: I was excited to use this for the first time.  I turned on and then it turned off its own and that was it. Never came back up. A bit disappointed for the inconvenience I have to go through in returning it. I went on and ordered a replacement, I guess things happen. Just a bit of disappointing if it is new? the face seemed it had hairlines swirls, not sure if it was a return. All looked new. Will update once I get a working unit.********UPDATE********Ok, I received my replacement order Monday, Thank you Amazon! This is a night and day product compared to what I received before. First, the difference in delivered product. First, the external box was an "Amazon" badged box and smaller over all. 2nd, the box inside was a "Cosori" labeled box compared to what I had before (Leit or something like that). Third, the box inside the Cosori box was the actual box of the product (with all the pics of it). Lastly the big difference was the fact that the basket had tape holding the basket as many "new" products are done. All looked great, plus no Swirls on the face. A new product indeed. I have a feeling the first was a return. Not cool.Now for the product review.. Yesterday, I went crazy and cooked Battered frozen strips for kids and they were Crispy using the frozen option. Wow!  Also, cooked fresh cut fries came out awesome. I think I cut them to thin, but the bigger ones were crispy and no oil (except for olive oil per instructions). Lastly last night, a NY and it was perfectly cooked, a nice Med Rare, it was great. Today, was another test. My daughter and I, mostly her cooked the Jalapeño popper from recipe book. They were great, only think I would of added to recipe was cream cheese, but followed directions for first time. Lastly, I cooked two giant chicken breast. I cooked then at 360 per online instructions, but I think the chicken preset would of done it just fine. Flipped them twice. Perfectly cooked at about 25-30 min.at 360. The president et is for 390 for 25.Wish I took pics, but let me tell you, this Air fryer is awesome. Don't doubt yourself in purchasing. You will be happy with results. I research and went with this brand, plus you sign up for warranty they give you an extra year for free. Cant beat that deal! You have nothing to lose, except the oil much to gain with good cooking!Go for it!  The one star less was from the beginning ordeal. Enjoy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 23, 2019
CommentsContent: This thing is seriously just a convection oven but has a smaller cooking area. Buy the Nuwave or any other generic convection oven. They cook the same, have a much larger cooking area, and are far more affordable. If you have a family of 4 like I do you would have to have 3 of these air fryers to cook a full dinner. Buy a convection oven, load a whole chicken and veggies in it, hit the button and wait for an amazingly easy, and delicious, dinner is done in very little time.

CommentsTitle: Basket lasts for one year then breaks
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I have LOVED using this air fryer, until the basket has broken twice now. The handle is constantly coming loose and having to be tightened back down, and after one year the plastic that attaches the handle to the basket breaks and the entire basket itself requires replacing. I have replaced it twice and the second time the handle broke off and caused the entire basket to fall onto the ground, causing the damage seen in the third photo. Unless you want to be replacing parts once a year, I cannot recommend this air fryer to anyone

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2020
CommentsContent: **UPDATE**Stopped working after four uses.**UPDATE**I've owned other desktop / countertop ovens. Given the reviews I was expecting this to at least measure up to my previous experience.First, it smelled awful the first few times I used it even after washing it and priming it with a few pre heat cycles.Using the preset chicken option my chicken was burned, dry and tasteless. Cooking meat in it, even with marinating overnight, was a forgettable meal.I think you'd be happier with a convection oven plus a rice cooker. If I had to do it over again I would go that route and save a few $$$ and have a known better experience.

CommentsTitle: Broke after 8 months-Updated with Customer Service Response
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: While it worked, it was one of the few new small appliance/gadgets that we used all the time. Great for warming up pizza, cooking vegetables, and especially making chicken wings.The only problem is that it just stopped working in the middle of making dinner last week. So, it doesn't matter how great it was when it worked, it's broken now and junk. And it's not like it's an inexpensive appliance. If I wanted a disposable piece of garbage, I'd have bought an air fryer for $30 - not $120.UPDATE 11/20/20 - The customer service department read my review, reached out, and provided a Amazon gift card in recompense to cover the full price of the air fryer. Updated to 4 stars - even though it stopped working )and that was annoying in and of itself), the company stepped up with solid customer service.

CommentsTitle: Stopped Working after 6th use! And return window up  week ago!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2019
CommentsContent: Stopped working on me after the 6th use. Won't power on and return window was up 1 week ago! Thanks amazon!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I've had this since January and I've loved using it however now the drawer won't close on it and I'm not sure what the problem is. And I'm down to months past the return date.

CommentsTitle: Absolutely wonderful product, and great product support
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2019
CommentsContent: I just finished making the most amazing batch of buffalo-style wings in our new Cosori air fryer.  Honestly, about the best I've ever had.  It is easy to use, easy to clean, and has earned a permanent spot on our kitchen counter.  It re-heats food like it was made fresh (think pizza etc.), doesn't require an oven preheat, no oil.Now, the customer support part.  We ordered this online and used it first for some fried chicken.  it was delicious, but it behaved a little strangely - would suddenly cut out for a few seconds, and then come back on.  I thought that's weird, but maybe that's what it's supposed to do?  Anyway, it got worse and eventually stopped working after the 4th or 5th use.  By this time it was too late to return to Amazon so I contacted customer support via their website chat.Within about 10 minutes we had a new one on the way, no charge, no return required, and 4 days later we received the properly functioning we have now.  I wanted to wait until we got the new one to check out before I reviewed.THAT's how customer service is supposed to work when things go wrong.  You back up your product when something's not right.  So kudos to Cosori for a really great kitchen appliance, and triple kudos for their customer support.I would not hesitate to buy another anything from Cosori.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Definitely don’t buy a smart air fryer if you don’t need it; this is an unnecessary purchase but if you’re willing to splurge 80 bucks for something that’ll help you cook in the kitchen this is ideal.I’m not the best chef in the world, in fact, I think the worst part of cooking is how long it takes and having to sit in a hot kitchen for hours. This air fryer is so quick and easy and it notifies your phone so you don’t have to sit in the kitchen or wait on it not to burn. You can go about your day and it will let you know when your food is ready. And you’ll really have to play around with the settings. The presets are really good guideline but you’ll have to take it upon yourself to really cook certain dishes properly.Now the main setback I have is actually cleaning it. I don’t have a dishwasher so I have to hand wash it myself and if I cook with oil or anything that stains even when I use parchment paper and foil all of that gunk sticks to the slits in the side of the basket. I would let it soak in Ajax and dish soap and come back scrub it out and it would still be dried grease stuck in between the cracks. This thing is almost impossible to clean entirely after the first use without a dishwasher.Another con would be cooking fries in this is not ideal; Frankly like all air fryers all fries come out super dry and dehydrated. Since many air fryers do this I’m not faulting this brand specifically, however I couldn’t help but mention it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2019
CommentsContent: This unit continuously overheats and turns off after barely a few minutes in. Takes 6-10 minutes to restart.

CommentsTitle: Touch display not working on 2 different fryers
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2020
CommentsContent: So, ive had two of these both had touch display issues. The 1st the touch screen didnt respond unless you like wipe your hand across the display then random buttons would activate, however when u touch those buttons (lite, firm & hulk smashing) didnt respond. Power button wouldnt respond at all. However it worked via app n with Alexa. 2nd one responded to touch for most of the display, power worked but the manual temp n time touch buttons would work intermittently. Sometimes lite pressure worked, one time holding your finger for like 15sec activated it but not the follow-up attempts, hulk smash finger press worked but none of those worked consistently.  Returned both went with ninja. This was top rated n bunch of good reviews n cheaper then the ninja. After some googling found this is a known and common issue, so much so that i called the manufacture n after describing what was happened just offered to replace it, no try this or that just okay we will send u a new one but it would take upto 10business days. Returned thru amazon quick and easy. The features it has if touch display works would b a awesome machine. However if your touch display does work then setup to the app (once downloaded) was easy, setup with alexa (once skill for fryer app enabled via alexa app) was easy n part of setup process. It responded to the app n alexa no issues. I loved the features plus having the wireless abilities thats why i opted for a 2nd to see if just a bum machine which happens but 2 for 2 pretty much same issue moved on. Gave 2 stars just due to fact it semi-worked but not everyone has alexa or wants to use an app (mom hates using both). So id say buy it see if you get a working machine if not move on!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2019
CommentsContent: Purchased on March 21, 2019, COSORI Air Fryer 5.8 Qt. Electric Hot Air Fryer from Amazon.com Services, Inc with a certified, 2 year Warranty.  Quit working on May 18, 2019.  Need I say more! Worked for two months and would NOTeven come "on".  Started turning "off" and would come back "on" two weeks prior to its total failure! I contacted the manufacture on the COSORI and provided them with the information on purchased and a new COSORI arrived in a few days.  Great response on replacing failed air fryer, and great customer service!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2019
CommentsContent: SEVERE SAFETY HAZARD  During cooking the unit shot the 380 degree basket out onto my kitchen floor.  It narrowly missed me and not the basket will not stay in the unit at all.  It just keeps shooting the basket out.

CommentsTitle: Great appliance  if you have the space and understand this isn’t a true fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve had this Air Fryer for about a week, and so far it hasn’t disappointed. I like the square basket-I think it fits food better. I was able to easily fit 6 chicken tenders with room for at least 2-3 more. Cleaning the basket (and the base that the basket rests in) has been very easy, but I do use a soft-bristle kitchen brush on a long handle to get into all the openings in the basket. The air fryer is big and does take up counter space, but it’s not heavy to move around. I keep it on my rolling kitchen cart and move it to my counter to use it. I do rest it on a large, wooden cutting board when using just in case the bottom gets warm. The instructions are easy to understand, and using the control panel is fairly intuitive. I haven’t used the pre-settings. I prefer to set my own temperature and time. The vent in the back releases hot air when in use. I was able to put my hand about two inches from the vent without difficulty. Still, I give about 5” of space on all sides just to be safe. I didn’t find it too loud. I mean, it circulates hot air with a fan so there’s going to be some noise, but It didn’t annoy me.So far I’ve made French fries with russet potatoes, a chocolate cake (see photo) and chicken tenders (homemade, not frozen. See photo). All three items turned out delicious. The cake was divine-especially the second day (I have no idea why). The chicken tenders were crunchy on the outside and not the least bit dry on the inside. The fries would have been over-cooked had I left them in for the full amount of time the recipe called for. They were crisp on the outside. The cake recipe stated 30 minutes at 330 degrees. My attempt took 55 minutes at 330 degrees. I wasn’t surprised by this. I thought 30 minutes seemed too short. My advice is, check your food often at first to get a feel for the fryer. This is really no different than getting used to a new oven or other cooking appliance. You need to play around with times and temperatures a bit. Also, get a good air fryer cookbook or some highly-rated recipes online.Pros:-Easy to use, intuitive-easy clean up-keeps kitchen cool in summer-don’t have to heat up your oven for a small amount of food-1 to 2 minutes to preheat or no preheating for some recipes-Large basket, and square shape seems to fit food very well-basket has a safety feature so you won’t accidentally release it from the base it sits in-much healthier than deep fried foods, but you can still get that crispy crunchinessCons:-It’s large. You will lose counter space unless you can store it somewhere and take it out when needed.-if you are cooking for a large group, you’re going to be cooking in batches. The basket size works fine for our family of three with two light eaters, but even one more person at the table would have me cooking in batches.-If your looking for something to give you the same, exact taste as genuine fried food, this isn’t for you. It’s not an actual fryer. The name is deceiving. It’s really a countertop convection oven. The recipes use minimal oil (1 Tbsp for the fries I made and several sprays of olive oil on the chicken tenders with an olive oil spritzer).I would recommend this model so far without hesitation, but it’s only been one week and three recipes. If anything changes, I’ll update my review. I hope this helps you make a decision.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2019
CommentsContent: 5.8.2019 UPDATE to my original review:  I have referred 12 friends to the Cosori Air Fryer since I purchased in January of 2019 and all of them have purchased it and ALL of them love it!  This Air Fryer cooks everything like a dream-beef tenderloin comes out perfect from medium on the ends to medium rare throughout the middle. Pork, Beef, Chicken, Lamb, Fish, Roasted Vegetables, hard boiled eggs, frozen foods-you name it. In fact I am thinking about purchasing a 2nd Air fryer so I can do my meat and veggies at the same time.  I highly recommend this model.We received our Air Fryer a few days ago and we are really happy with it.  We've made a blooming onion (80% fewer calories than old recipe), chicken wings, chicken tenders and tonight we will make a roast chicken, with roasted corn and sweet potato fries.  This Air Fryer is very easy to use, and very easy to clean.  I purchased after doing much research on many different models-finally decided on this one based on Amazon reviews, and again-we are very happy so far.  Motivation to purchase derived from being on Weight Watchers and wanting to experience that "deep fried" goodness without all the fat--and boy this is the way to do it.  I highly recommend this unit.

CommentsTitle: Will Not Do Without An Air-fryer Now - Just Not This One
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Good capacityEasy to useAfter first use the plastic front of the unit separated/warped from the basket - interestingly after unit heats up the plastic moves back in placeFlaking of whatever material is used to make up the non-stick coatingInner basket warped after a few uses - does not interfere with cooking thoughHandle has fallen apart - have to click back in place on two sides before each useBasket has actually ejected on its own while cooking despite being latched - the unit does not operate unless it is latched so it is not operator error - one ejection actually threw the food onto the floorWill be replacing this air-fryer with another brand - really like the results of air-frying and don't want to do without

CommentsTitle: Great Airfryer in function, but not very well made.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 30, 2020
CommentsContent: We bought the Cosori airfryer seven months ago as a replacement for a cheap but sturdy one we used for 3 years (heavy users), and now we're getting a new one because it makes us nervous. Despite that, I'm still giving this fryer three stars, because it executes its core function really well despite its quirks.The good/great:Fantastic air-frying capabilities - the crispy outside to juicy inside ratio is always perfect or near to it and cooks pretty evenly even when we're too lazy to flip items. Makes beautiful fries.Great cooking area - the shape makes for a good surface to put lots of itemsVery easy to clean - cleans well in the dishwasher as well as by hand. Easy to wipe up mess.Pleasing design - I like it's square, shiny red finishEasy to operateThe bad/why we're replacing it 7 months in:It blows out of fuses. This has happened several times, and the main reason we're getting rid of it - it's blown out fuses on its own and when other appliances are on the same circuit; our wiring is pretty sturdy, so it's disturbing.It's falling apart. From the beginning the basket and the basket tray sorta rattled a bit, and what they've been doing over time is undoing the screws. We tightened it but one went missing (maybe in the dishwasher?) and there's two holding on for dear life; we're constantly having to tighten it. It seems to simply be a side effect of how its built.The tray sometimes rattles itself out of place and stops cooking - the tray sometimes rattles itself out and will stop the cooking process; probably a bit of operator error, howeverI would have definitely given this machine 5 stars when I first got it, but it unfortunately hasn't held up very well.

CommentsTitle: I love it, but there is a major design flaw that needs to be fixed.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020
CommentsContent: So, I've had this for almost four months. Overall I'm very pleased with the air fryer. I use it almost daily. I've made chicken, corn, eggplant, fries (of course), spaghetti squash, meat balls and more and everything comes out amazing, juicy on the inside, crispy on the outside. There are however a few design flaws that need to be addressed by the company. One is major. The screws in both baskets become loose after almost every use and I constantly have to tighten them. I discovered this when I found one of the screws in my food! The other issue, is that the material of the inner basket (with the holes), is different than the material of the drip basket. The drip basket is a non-stick material that is very easy to clean. The basket with the holes (roasting basket thing) does not appear to be. The first few times of use, it was easy to clean and with each subsequent  use, it becomes more and more difficult. I use a variety of cooking sprays when using the fryer and eventually the basket ends up with a sticky, oily residue that is impossible to remove unless you use an abrasive scouring tool, which would obviously ruin the basket, so I haven't done that and try to ignore the fact that I'm cooking in a pan that is less than clean. Just FYI, I clean both baskets after each use. I hope you find this helpful.

CommentsTitle: Lower quality than I expected after seeing the reviews.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2019
CommentsContent: When I opened this air fryer, the non stick coating was already coming off. The latch for the basket felt cheap and was tricky to open and close. I was disappointed and did not get to use it before it was sent back due to poor quality. I liked the smaller dimensions of this fryer but the one they sent me was a dud.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 19, 2019
CommentsContent: Product turned off withing 7 minutes of cooking. Occasially screen will flash and beep then turned off again. Power button does not even display like when first plugged in. Will be returning this unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2018
CommentsContent: I never write reviews, but in this case I will. This Cosori air fryer is a super nice fryer.  It's easy to use and the clean up is so easy.  I use it almost every day. I work long hours, this makes My time cooking so much quicker. Great Product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 8, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a pretty good air fryer. I knocked a star off because I think its a bit expensive for a brand I've never heard of. Otherwise, I've cooked pork, fish, brussel sprouts, fries, all sorts of things in it and it works well. Size-wise, I can easily fit two mackerels in it - three very crowded. Food turns out well. I was afraid it would be another kitchen gadget I would buy, use a few times, and end up cluttering the countertop, but I have used it at least once a week, for the past few months. Cooking fish (especially mackerel) can be stinky, but I just put this gadget right over the stovetop, turn on the stovetop ventilation, and it is the easiest, cleanest, least-stinky way of cooking fish.

CommentsTitle: Mine didn't work, but I hear air fryers are great when they do.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   My unit didn't work.  Took a few pieces of freshly julienned fries spaced evenly, 400 for 40 minutes then 380 for 25 minutes; setting button for fries gives 380 for 15 minutes.  pics and video upload.I posted my first review 9 days after ordering, when Amazon said they needed to get back to me about getting a replacement unit (https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/RUZ4FRYCLIAOX?ref=pf_ov_at_pdctrvw_srp) I posted my second review a few months later, after the item, linked to my purchase, disappeared from the site, and Amazon said they would get back to me (https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R1VJA7EM7BP0K2?ref=pf_ov_at_pdctrvw_srp).  I contacted Amazon just now, and they said they will get back to me.  Crossing my fingers, :).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: A reasonable air fryer, it is very easy to use and produces reasonable air fried food. It can be somewhat tough to clean, but I imagine this is a problem with just about any air fryer. The non-stick coating is wearing off in a few places because of how the machine is designed and the basket is supported, but this isn't a deal-breaker.I wish I could disable the beeps, but I understand this isn't a ubiquitous feature yet, so it's OK.The biggest problem is the durability. I used this machine moderately for 1 year -- maybe once per week. I was always gentle with it, never abused it. Really fair use. But after just over 1 year of use the handle cracked off, rendering the fryer useless. $120/yr is a lot to pay for an air fryer. I urge you to find another option.

CommentsTitle: Terrible plastic smell even after several uses
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I have had this long enough to use it almost ten times, always for frozen food. Despite running it empty a few times and these actual instances of cooking with it, there remains a very unpleasant plastic smell that really makes it unusable. The smell gets into the food and stinks up the house to the point where I feel the need to open windows and air out the house. I really wanted to like this air fryer but unless I can bake this smell off somehow I will not be able to use it anymore.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2020
CommentsContent: UPDATE:  I initially rated this 5-starts.  I am sorry that I need to update the review.  The air fryer is not consistently recognizing when the basket is inserted.  While doing a 40 minute cook, it turned off after 7 minutes thinking the basket was not present.  I have had problems with this before but this time jiggling the basket would not resolve the problem.  I had to resort to using  a kitchen knife to get the fryer to recognize that the basket was installed (see photo).I have also had issues with the touch panel not recognizing when a button is pushed but that wasn't a problem as I could use my iPhone and the WIFI connection to set the temp, time, etc.Original Review:I highly recommend the WiFi version of the Cosori 5.8 quart air fryer.  We have had ours for the less than a month and use it almost daily while we try out new recipes.The iPhone app connects with the Cosori Smart WIFi air fryer.  You can select a recipe illustrated in the app or you can manually set the time and temperature and start cooking.  The app updates you on the progress of the cooking -- how many minutes are left, when to shake, when cooking is done.If the air fryer did not have the WiFi feature, I would have returned the air fryer because the buttons for manually changing cooking time and temperature on the fryer are difficult to use.  The time and temperature buttons on  don't always register when you push them.  This is NOT a problem if you have a smart phone and purchase the WiFi enabled air fryer.I have recommended this air fryer to several family members.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I was excited when I found out that you can operate this from an app. The app itself is great. The problem was that the buttons on the fryer was not responsive.
