The power button did not work no matter how hard I pressed. So I returned it and got another one. The buttons on the second one worked but not all the time and you really had to press them hard. But I was ok with that because I still had the app to operate it. The thing that alarmed me was after soaking the inner basket and the outer basket in the sink, it was rusted underneath the edges. Look at the attached video. So I didn’t even get a chance to cook with it. I’m going to return it. That will be 2 that I have returned. I will have to try another brand.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 11, 2019
CommentsContent: I decided to start with the fried chicken. My thought was, if it can't do well with this, I don't want it. Wow! It exceeded my expectations.  Amazingly, it looked like it might be a little dry because the outside didn't have the usual fried sheen. Not only was the skin crispy and tasty, inside was some of the juiciest fried chicken I've had in recent years. The air fryer was a little intimidating, especially when removing it during the cooking process to flip it over. It was super easy to clean which also surprised me. I'm really glad I bought it. Since then, I've tried the fries and they were wonderful as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 16, 2019
CommentsContent: Works great once you figure out how long you want to cook your food for the way you like it. I mean the first steak I cooked in there I murdered it but then the next time I figured out what temperature to pull it out the way I like it and then it was actually pretty good for cooking basically in a tiny electric oven with a fan. Great for potatoes and my wife is Asian and she loves fish and cooks all kinds different fishnet and it's really good some nice moist salmon. I find stuff to cooking it at this point just because it's fun to use and it's easy but the timing and walk away. I'm seriously contemplating on getting another one if I just have the room for it. Good chicken wings too. if you get my point now I really like it you can go on rambling just like I already have but in the end it's worth buying.

CommentsTitle: Air fryers are the way of the future
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I'm super happy with the easy operation and performance from the Corsori air fryer.I think the 5.8L capacity is ideal and would encourage anyone shopping for one to stay away from the smaller capacity air fryers.  I think you get more bang for your buck with the larger capacity.Overall, I'm quite happy with it and have been cooking with it 4-5 times per week - thus replacing my oven.It's a lot faster to cook with also!Word of advice for simu-frying with this air fryer:Purchase an oil spritzer / mister and liberally spray down your food before cooking in the air fryer.  Increase your cook time by an additional 1 minute using the cooker's presets.I think you would be very happy using an air fryer.  Definitely worth one's attention.

CommentsTitle: DANGEROUS!  CHOKING HAZARD! A few MAJOR design flaws-otherwise I would love this air fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my second unit so these issues aren't with my air fryer only.  I sent my first one back thinking I must have had a defective unit.First-  The screws in the basket WILL fall out frequently.  They will fall into your food.  You will need to check and tighten them frequently or you risk choking on the screws.  I'm not sure how they can even continue to sell this like with this problem.  The screws on the outer portion (the basket holder) will come out too but not as frequently.Second-The timer resets everytime you 'shake'.  Those who have air fryers know you are to pull out the tray and shake it around while cooking to maximize air flow and crispiness.  Air fryers will continue right where you left off when you put the basket back in-that's one of air fryers biggest conveniences.  The problem with this one is it resets back to a full minute each time you do that.  For example, say you are cooking something for 15 minutes and you 'shake' 5 times.  If you pull the basket out and there's 12:02 left when you put it back in it starts back at 12:59 seconds.  After 5 times you might be adding around 4-5 minutes extra cooking time.Third-The least of the problems but still a problem.  The buttons are really weird on the front and you have to almost press through the panel to get them to work.  It was worse on my first one.Other than the big problems the air fryer is awesome.  I love the shape of the basket and the way the basket is designed to maximize air flow.

CommentsTitle: Problems with Touch Pad on WiFi Model
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2020
CommentsContent: My halogen convection air fryer finally died and after a little research I decided to purchase the Cosori 5.8 WiFi Air Fryer.Set up was a breeze and the AF worked really well. Clean-up is fast and easy. I used the WiFi connection via my phone and the Vesync App to control the AF. But when I tried to use the actual touch pad on the AF to control the cooking the Time/Temp button did not function properly. Sometimes it would work and more often than not it didn't work at all. That meant I could not adjust the cooking time or cooking temperature manually. Amazon did a quick exchange and sent me a new AF promptly. Cudos and thanks to Amazon. No down time. When I received the new unit first thing I did was check the touch pad for function and it worked fine. Fast forward to the 2nd time I used the AF and the Time/Temp button was malfunctioning again. The problem is not as bad as before but there is still a problem. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. There is a Cosori Air fryer group on FB and more than a few people have indicated that they have had the same problem with the touch pad on their WiFi models. I did not see any posts indicating problems with the non-WiFi models. So, not sure what do now: on my 2nd AF and undecided whether to keep it and use the Vesync app or exchange it for the non-WiFi model. My hope is that Cosori will find and correct the issue with a firmware update. If you are thinking about getting a Cosori AF I would definitely recommend the non-WiFi model. Also, I recommend the 5.8 size and you may want to shop for some accessories like wire racks to place inside the AF basket for multi-level cooking. All things considered I think it is still a good AF. If you want help, inspiration or cooking ideas check out the Cosori Air Fryer group on FB.Update: Received 2nd Cosori Smart Air Fryer and Temp/Time button still does not function properly. Have to use WiFi App to control cooking.

CommentsTitle: Please be aware of the burning plastic smell
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: The machine looks good and looks easy to clean.HOWEVER, the the machine makes very strong burning plastic smell in the first several runs we experienced. The smell makes the entire family headache and did not go away after tried 3 times.. the temp we run is not high.. we run 350F and 380F but all times the smell is very strong and penetrates the food.Certain reviews said that the smell will "go away" after several use but it should not be there at the very beginning because this is something processing things we put in our mouth at where we live.Not recommend.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I've been wanting an air fryer for awhile. Mostly to make crispy pork belly in half the time without heating my entire kitchen up from the oven. My brother got the Cosori a few months before me, so I figured I'd get the same so that we could try things out and make sure our temps were consistent since air fryers vary. I love this air fryer. The buttons are easy to use. I like the pre-sets. I like the shake reminders. I like the overall size as well as the size of the basket. I've made cornish hens, a whole chicken, spareribs, french fries, kabobs and yes... I've made the crispy pork belly! Customer service is great and they've got a group on Facebook with more recipes and lots of sharing from other Cosori owners.

CommentsTitle: Great Air Fryer + Appropriate Recipes = Good Food
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: We purchased the Cosori Air Fryer (the one with the App, though we don't use the App very often so far) for Christmas, mostly because we had Amazon gift cards that we haven't used in several years. We have had no problems with the air fryer so far. The touchscreen is pretty easy to figure out (the User Guide helps as well, of course) and responds from especially light touches. Cleaning is surprisingly easy: we wait until it's cool (roughly 10 minutes) then put in the sink, fill with hot water and a squirt of Dawn, wait until we've finished eating, then wipe with a soft rag or sponge and rinse. Done.Now, about recipes. You can find a stunning amount of recipes on the web, even recipes specific to the Cosori; HOWEVER, our experience is that we have to test recipes until we get results we like. This is where we think air fryers really shine. You can always adjust the temperature and/or cook for a couple of minutes longer, so we check it every 5 minutes or so. For example, we tried English Muffin Pizzas and had to cook them twice as long as the recipe called for. Same for Parmesan Red Potatoes. Chicken Tenders took 2 minutes less than the recipe called for. So it's best to assume you will have to tinker with time/temperature rather than count on the recipe being perfect first time every time.We found Fabulessly Frugal (on YouTube) to be a pretty reliable source for Air Fryer info, especially since the host has a Cosori 5.8oz and she is very good about giving clear instructions ... and because we like her sense of humor. Worth a quick search.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2020
CommentsContent: Update #2 July 2020:  I STILL HAVE NOT RECEIVED MY REFUND AS PROMISED BY COSORI.  At this point I would give zero stars if that were possible.Thank you to the Customer Support Team at Cosori for their help in diagnosing my touchpad issues.  Apparently I got a defective one, and they are issuing a refund so I can purchase another.  (I am beyond Amazon's 30 day return window.)This air fryer has a nice, large basket, so I rarely need to cook things in batches. I love the presets and wifi connection, which makes cooking easier.  I can monitor the cooking process on my smartphone.  However, I find that the "buttons" do not always respond to touch, especially when I want to increase or decrease the time/temp.  The touch pad just doesn't work!  Don't know if I am doing something wrong or if the devices is not working properly.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2019
CommentsContent: I consider myself to be a tough cookie when it comes to reviewing products but also I’m fair. I’ve had a couple of different machines similar to this one and I wasn’t happy with them. If you’re thinking of buying one of these, I HIGHLY suggest it. You won’t be disappointed. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS MACHINE!! If I could give it 10⭐️ I definitely would! I’m a happy customer. 👍🏻

CommentsTitle: It's going to be hard not to rave to much
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 14, 2019
CommentsContent: We had heard great things and read some good reviews and I decided to try an air fryer. After looking around it seemed that Cosori has a decent reputation for support and that their non-stick has a good rep for not de-laminating. Enter a good sale and I purchased one.I think we have had it a little over a month and it has been used anywhere from once to four times  a day. We cook a range of stuff from garlic bread to fried chicken,  vegetables, fish sticks, hot dogs, fish, beef, french fries etc. in it.I gave up eating fried chicken a few years ago. My digestive tract isn't as friendly to greasy foods as it once was. I grew up in the south and fried chicken was a staple at my grandmothers house and my mom made it a lot also. When I left home I made it though not as often as I get irritated cleaning the spattered grease up. Finally with the digestive change it left my menu but I really missed it. Now it is back on the menu. I cook chicken a couple times a week now at least and it is great.for better than my mom's or grandmothers breaded fried chicken I take oil of choice and rub a light layer onto a couple large chicken breasts, sprinkle with salt and pepper (or other seasoning of choice) and then sift a heavy layer of flour and pat it in. (I can no longer eat wheat so use rice or oat flour and it is absolutely wonderful.) Place the chicken in the air fryer and just use the stock setting for chicken. It is crispy on the outside and moist and tender on the inside. If you cut the chicken up into smaller portions you probably want to reduce the cooking time from 25 min to maybe 15 to 20.. you'll have to get a feel for it.French fries took a few tries get right.. fresh vs frozen are two different ways of cooking. Fresh use the recommended setting depending on how thick.. if thinner then reduce time a little maybe. frozen you need to reduce time by about a 1/3.Fish sticks such as gortons frozen I use the chicken setting but reduce it to about 20 minutes.. they are lightly crunchy on the outside and moist and tender inside. other brands with thinner fish sticks need reduced cooking time so that they dont dry out.sausage dogs I use the chicken setting with about 18 minutes to get a bit of blackening and cracking of the skin going. For just cooked but not till the skin breaks probably 13 min maybe.anyways it is up there with our rice cooker and electric pressure cooker for devices we use a lot.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This air fryer has a very large basket. I easily fit in 15 chicken wings, single layer. They are, by far, the best wings I've ever had! It does a great job with frozen french fries, too. With the frozen french fries, there is a fair amount of condensation that comes out the bottom of the air fryer. Not a big deal, but still added wiping up. Fortunately, the air fryer is super easy to clean. Nothing sticks to it! Spray and a little suds and you are done. The only complaint I have is that it still produces a "plastic" odor while being used. I am hoping that goes away over time. I am still getting used to using the air fryer and putting it into my weekly routine. I recommend this air fryer to all the skeptics out there.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I got this fryer against my wife's wishes (she wanted to wait for a sales event), so I really really wanted to like this machine (else I'm in for a continual litany of "I told you so").  The fryer was working fine for the first few days; it was easy to use with plenty of button options, the recipe book was helpful, it was a quiet machine, big enough to cook up pork chops, fries, vegetables, etc.  Unfortunately, on the 4th day, while trying to make fries again, it died.  Power was not getting to the machine.  I swapped it around to different outlets in and out of the kitchen, hoping that it was actually my home electrical system (that's how much I wanted this machine to work).  Alas, it was not my electrical system, it was the fryer.  I tried it again the next day, the same issue, it worked for a few minutes, then died.  So, I had to wrap it back up into the box and return it.  Worst yet, I'm now listening to "I told you so" from my wife - and we are not allowed to get another fryer until she sees the sale she wants.

CommentsTitle: paint peeling off on inside and I found a bolt in the basket with my potatoes! DONT BUY
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this air fryer. I LOVE it!I chose this one over a cheaper 60$ one because I know it will last me longer. The digital screen is 100% worth it and makes using it so easy.This has made dinners so much easier for myself and my hubby. It's so big that I can use it if our family gets bigger, too. This has changed my life, just like the Instant Pot did.I hope you enjoy it, too!Update:Oct 2020, I started noticing the drawer part (not the basket) is bubbling up like the nonstick paint on the inside is about to come off. I am worried it will flake off and get in my food and, much worse, ruin the cleaning process.I've only used my air dryer maybe 20 times since I got it at the very beginning of July, but for 130$, you would think it holds up better. I only hand wash it.Changing from 5 star to 2 star.This is so upsetting.I attached a pic, it looks like water droplets but that is bubbles paint.UPDATE #2: I FOUND A SCREW IN MY POTATOES ARE YOU FREAKING JOKING!??!Do NOT buy!!I've contact them SEVERAL times and have heard NOTHING. Coating coming off and now it's falling apart into my food!!COSORI MESSAGE ME BACK

CommentsTitle: Screen failure and app failure.... Keep looking.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Alright.... First the positive.... The food tastes amazing. When it works properly you'll love it. It has a large basket compared to other so you can cook a decent volume of food too. Now for the reality check.... The screen buttons work about 15% of the time... Almost useless. It forces you to use the app... Which works great until it doesn't work anymore... I bought this and I'm ready to replace it 6 months later. Look for something that is higher quality and easy to use... The malfunctioning screen and app are enough to make you pull your hair out.

CommentsTitle: Malfunctioned after only 1 year of use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2020
CommentsContent: As my first air fryer, I was very excited when I started learning the “ins” and “outs” of this thing. I am a stay at home mom of three that babysits so it’s important to have food fast when littles are hungry. This was definitely the answer! BUT...After a year of use I realized how extremely difficult it was becoming to clean. I would scrub and scrub after each use and it would still hold this terrible greasy feeling. Everyone assured me it was normal and our food still tasted great, so I considered it only a minor set back.Then one day while cooking lunch, I had put fries in the basket. I set the fries setting and had already shook the basket. (The setting gives you a warning to “shake” halfway through your desired time/temperature.)A few moments passed when I noticed the screen started malfunctioning. The back of the machine started smoking and I immediately unplugged the item from the wall as quickly as possible. After letting it cool down I opened the basket to inspect. Fries were still slightly cold inside, but it looked like a French fry had fallen out of the basket and was stuck between the inside of the machine and the basket. I’m assuming it was laying on just the right spot to fry the machine (and the fry! Because it was black!) Had I not been nearby, we may have just had a house fire! I counted my blessings and the machine went in the garbage! I upgraded to a Ninja Foodi and am so thankful their basket system is not made the same! While I miss my handle.. I use tongs to “flip” and I feel it’s much safer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2019
CommentsContent: Unfortunately this didn’t work for us. The things were either overdone or underdone. It was however very easy to clean! We tried it 5 times. The food was not crispy even with the tip of adding 2 tablespoons of oil. So we ended up returning it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2019
CommentsContent: Left overs like pizza and fries actually  taste better a day or two old once warmed up in the air fryer. Chicken thighs are more crispy in 20 minutes vs an hour in the oven. Less time and taste better, so moist. Utilize you tube videos...so helpful!Baked potatoes so yummy, asparagus awesome in like 5 minutes. My husband LOVES crispy chicken wings in the air fryer...best he has ever tasted :) Easy clean up. So many wonderful videos on youtube...for how long to cook and at what temperature. Would highly recommend the Cosori Air Fryer 5.8 qt.  We had our first one for a couple of weeks and noticed a vibration. We sent it back at no charge and ordered another one that is working perfectly. Would make a terrific gift!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve run this thing for hours now trying to get the awful plastic smell out. After using it in my kitchen for 20 minutes and getting that nasty smell all through my house I spent the day today running it outside on my porch and then cleaning it with hot soapy water. Rinse and repeat. Hours. Food still taste of plastic. And now so does my porch. I can’t see that I’ll ever be able to use it so I consider it a waste of $130. And don’t believe the manufacturer responses in here that says there’s no way the plastic smell is getting into the food. It does, and has continued to do so all day, after hours and hours.I admit that I’m a bit sensitive to smells, but from the reviews on here I’m not the only one. Before you order, if you think you might be one of those people, don’t ignore the warning reviews on here like I did. Save yourself some money and don’t bother.

CommentsTitle: I liked it so much I bought a second one for the cabin
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this unit after internet research on reviews of the best units. This one is rated by many sites as the best of the best. Now that I've had mine for a few weeks, and have used it daily, I am very pleased with my purchase. Most of today's kitchen appliances have presets that are actually quite hard to figure out. But not on this unit. The preset choices are extremely easy to use. The temp/time menu is so simple that even this old man can do it without getting confused. The basket is square, which gives it a bigger capacity for more food than a round one. It has a higher power rating than many others, so it cooks fast and thoroughly. To clean it, all I do is put the basket in the dishwasher. That's it. Nothing else. I have a cabin where I spend half my days. So after I bought my first one for the house and used it for a week, I knew I needed one at the cabin too. So I bought a second, identical one. That way I can cook in it pretty much every single day. This is the best kitchen gadget I've purchased in years.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this air fryer. We had the Power xl air fryer in the 3 qt model and the 5 qt model. We used the Power Xl on a daily basis but began to have trouble with the switch located at the bottom where you put the basket in early on. You had to put the basket in and sort of jiggle it to get it to toggle the switch on to allow the air fryer to operate. Eventually, that stopped working and the power xl would no longer turn on. So, it was time to replace it.  The Cosori Air Fryer Max XL does not have this problem. There is no switch at the bottom. The basket slides in easily without having to maneuver it to catch the switch.  I believe it does a better job air frying than the Power Xl.  The preset cooking times and temperatures are great. It is easy to change time and temperatures and it has a pause feature.  The basket handle is sturdy and locks into place easily.  It is non stick and easy to clean.  I like the design of the square basket, it can easily fit a 5 lb chicken. It is easy to use and does a better job than the power Xl.  Wish I would have bought  this one to begin with.  If you are looking for an air fryer this is the one.

CommentsTitle: Better than my last air fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I had the Airfryer XL for years and I told everyone I came in contact with that it was the best thing since microwaves and ovens, and that I would take it to my grave because I loved it so much, lol. Having said that, I have ceramic tile floors and I dropped it 20 or more times (anyone who has that type of floor knows it is rare for anything to survive such a fall, but the XL hanged on). Over time the XL became so banged up that I decided once I move I would re-purchase it. However, after moving, Amazon was having a sale and my pocketbook was tugging at me to make a change. "I could always return it if I hated it and buy the XL again," I said to myself. Well.......... I LOVE THE COSORI MORE!!!!!!! It has a square basket which fits items much better than the oval one, it's quieter, it's still a spaceship in size but it is very nice looking with the matte textured black plastic, it's truly awesome and is my addiction for life. I use it to warm up food, toast bread, make pizzas, cookies, fries, onion rings, etc., you name it. You can do almost anything with this gorgeous machine and it is super FAST (which saves you on electricity and cooking heat in your house). If you are questioning some brands, I strongly encourage you to just buy the Cosori because you will be happier sooner than later. Lastly, please be sure to take out ALL the cardboard after unpacking and before cooking anything. I washed the basket but I was so excited to try it I had blind eyes to the cardboard which was still "underneath" the basket area. Very careless of me. All is well, and I use my Cosori every day.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2019
CommentsContent: First use was to cook french fries.  Instructions followed precisely.  Some fries were overdone while others were under done.  Second use was to cook grated potatoes for use as a bed for pulled pork.  Followed an air fryer recipe.  Noted that the potatoes were becoming very brown and crisp on the outside but not cooking on the center.  Tried to stir them and continued.  Checked again before time was up – they were over done (very brown and dry).  Placed on warm cycle while pork and corn were heated (4 minutes).  Potatoes continued to cook and were just shy of being charcoal.  Third try was broccoli.  It also turned out overdone and somewhat charred.  Last attempt was an egg test.  Cooked egg in a silicon muffin cup.  Egg was overdone and uncooked, possibly according to the burner pattern.  This is unacceptable.  Returned the unit.

CommentsTitle: Nice fryer but Beeps are loud
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Great air fryer.  One thing I disliked was the super loud menu beeps.  I scoured the internet and emailed the company to no avail.  However I did take matters into my own hands and fixed the loud beep.  This was very easy to do, however, be warned and do not do this if you feel at all uncomfortable with the steps.There is no built in way to lower or disable the beeps from pressing menu buttons.  Here's what I did.  You can pop the top off which is held on with plastic clips all around. Oh btw do this at your own risk, I'm only reporting what I did which most certainly was dangerous risky voided warranty etc. And for goodness sake people, unplug it and leave it be to cool down and stuff. Anywho, pop the top and locate the round black speaker on the circuit board. You can take a pair of needle nose pliers and pull off the black cover to the speaker. You can identify the speaker by seeing the board notated as BUZR next to it. The black cover piece to speaker has a hole in center of it. After pulling it off (gentle force) there is a circular flat disc, seen in pic, appears to be possibly magnetic. Simply pick it off and replace the black speaker cover. Boom no sound. Here's the downside, there is no sound at all for anything anymore.

CommentsTitle: I love this Cosori Air Fryer!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I just had to write a review.  I have a Nuwave AF, but didn't like it as much as my Cosori.  I love the basket vs the Nuwave, so much easier to clean.  The non stick coating appears to be better as well, my Nuwave started to peal just after a few uses.  Over this past weekend, I used it all weekend.  I made chicken drums that turned out perfect and made some honey glazed carrots from the awesome Cosori cookbook that it came with.  I also, made some muffins and two Cornish hens...came out awesome as well.  Last night I made pizza's ....delish!  This AF is so easy, you won't be disappointed if you bought one for yourself!  A very satisfied customer.  I have a Cosori pressure cooker as well and love it too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this product! If you are thinking of buying an air fryer this is probably the best on the market. Here’s why you are going to love it...easy to use (not rocket science), lots of video supports on YouTube, easy clean up, lots of recipes to try, two year warranty if you register the product right away, the presets, shake reminder, large basket, 85% more heat distribution which means a faster cooking time, you can pull out the bin to check foot without having to reset the temp/time, impressive basket design that makes air flow productive, online AF community presence, smart technology (which provides a real time cooking display and tons of recipes and the ability to creat your own-❤️ this!), and great accessories to purchase. It is fun to use. It has easily become favorite go to gadget!We cooked chicken, cookies, kabobs, and so much more! This was so easy.The product exterior is not hot to the touch, only the back where the hot air comes out.We have tried several air fryers and this was the best.

CommentsTitle: steam or smoke coming out of the bottom basket is scaring me a little.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I made salmon and green beans after receiving this yesterday and i was not comfortable with the smoke/steam I cant tell which coming from the basket area, the food was not greasy frozen salmon and fresh green beans.  I know the steam is supposed to come out the back and i have another air fryer that never has steam or smoke from the basket area and so i have experience with air fryers I just wanted the larger capacity.  I will try cooking again but now i am worried how much is will smoke if i actually use oil to coat food ie potatoes etc.  I immediately took out the basket and rechecked everything to make sure there was no overlooked packaging that perhaps was left inside.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I wanted a new, larger air fryer as my OG Philips was getting old (albeit still running great!) - so I decided against my better judgment to try a cheaper brand based on the great reviews....but ended up regretting it immensely. Initial impression was that it looked great out of the box, but when using it I noticed the build of the machine was of much lower quality than my old Philips.Just some cons to note (tried it for 1 month):-The basket was really hard to pull in and out of the air fryer as well as difficult to detach from the bottom basket-Like other reviews mentioned, the touchpad is wonky and unresponsive. I had to touch buttons multiple times repeatedly for it to respond and it was really annoying-Biggest con for me... THE SMELL. Immediately when opening the basket, I noticed a very strong, unpleasant chemical/plastic smell. Based on instructions, it said to run the air fryer empty on high for 10-15min. However, the smell would not go away and seeped into my food, making it inedible (not to mention making my kitchen smell terrible). I tried washing multiple times, running with lemon/vinegar water, running on empty for MULTIPLE times, etc. This chemical smells reinforces my feeling that the materials they use are cheap and low quality.-Final straw... I finally got the smell to be bearable, but when I tried heating up some food, the machine started only blowing COLD air and wouldn't work...tldr; Smelled gross & stopped working after a month with less than 10 uses so I returned it and am going to buy a new Phillips XXL instead :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2020
CommentsContent: Plugged in. Excited to cook. Waited a few minutes. Only displayed the wifi icon and power icon. Push/hold power icon does not change state of device. Put some food in the basket, insert for operate, and waited a few minutes. Provided the same result. Instructions did not indicate wifi and app are required for operation. Was interested in newest model. Fail.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this air fryer to assist in making chicken nuggets and fries for the kids.  What I learned is it does so much more.  I have evolved in to using it daily and cooking almost anything I would normally fry or bake using my stove/oven with much less cleanup and hassle.  I have to admit, I am a sucker for new appliances.  I jumped on sous-vide, which I actually think is the most delicious way to cook cuts of meat especially when entertaining or cooking large cuts but it takes time and some preparation and some mess (mainly in that you still have to use the stove or grill to sear the meat).  Still love it but use less often than at first (it doesn't take much room so no bother).  I then jumped on the insta-pot.  Tried to use it a lot but now it has ended up mostly just being a smaller slow cooker than the one I have.  The pressure cook feature (and other features) can be convenient but not worth having a bulky extra appliance for if you already have a slow cooker.  Now comes to the air fryer.  I had big concerns because of it's size - larger than the previous two things I mentioned.  I saved all the packing material with expectation that I would ship it back.  Much to my surprise, not only does it cook the fries/nuggets (and chicken wings I might add) much better than the oven, it cooks hamburger, chicken, steak, seafood, vegetables, garlic bread . . . almost everything you could cook on the stove/oven quickly and with a really good result (once you get a handle on the temp/time requirements).  On top of that, the cooking is all contained so it doesn't make a mess of your stove, oven, countertops, or pans and it 's cooking tray is very easy to clean - imagine no grease to clean up from the stove area after frying..  I often make 2-3 different things sequentially which makes me at times wish I had two.  That way I could cook the main and side dishes (ie. nuggets/fries) at the same time (although you probably can do it with just one but I have done that yet due to capacity).  My stove/oven usage has dropped by at least 50-70%.  Because of that, I leave this unit out all the time.  It is bulky for a small kitchen (like mine) but fortunately I have a small table just off the kitchen in the breakfast area where this fits without being in the way.  Yes, in the breakfast area because this makes no mess outside of the cooker and it looks attractive enough not to be an eye sore.  Now lets talk size.  I bought the 5.8qt and am so glad I did.  One of the only two wishes I had for this unit is that it held more, although I find this to be mostly adequate for a family of four and I don't think I would want it to take up any more space.  It can cook 3 - 4 large chicken breasts or 4 hamburgers at one time and I am sure it would cook bacon very well but you may not get more than 6- 8 slices in there.  I don't think this brand is any better or worse in this regard compared to other brands of the same volume spec.  I believe there are some models that have a rack so you can increase food capacity.  I'm not sure how well this works but from simple observation of how air fying works I think it would.  Also note, the smaller volume (ie. 3qt) versions are not that much smaller on the outside but noticeably smaller in cooking capacity.Now for the fryer review.  Having not had another, I am very pleased with this model and would recommend.  As I have noted, I like the way it cooks and looks.  Food is very crispy on the outside and finished nicely on the inside and it cooks the entire contents very evenly.  It seems to be well built and the cooking pan/parts are very easy to clean.  The controls are logical and the buttons are touch sensitive.  My second minor wish is that the buttons would be more consistent in their sensitivity but I realize they were designed this way for easy cleaning - so probably a worthwhile trade-off.  In short I highly recommend this brand.  I've only been using it a month and so far no problems.  If I have any problems in quality or durability moving forward I will update this review.  Most of all, I highly recommend having an air fryer.  This is an appliance I can see myself using every day and for a long time.

CommentsTitle: Good air fryer but there is a WARNING!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2020
CommentsContent: The air fryer works great. I use it everyday and I know there’s plenty more that I can cook/bake in it. I fully recommend the product, however buyers need to be aware of the following:1) it is not the easiest to clean. The slots on the sides to allow air flow will routinely build up grease and it is not easy to get off.2) and this is a WARNING: there are a few screws that attach the handle to the basket. THESE SCREWS BECOME LOOSE AND WILL FALL OUT!! This is a common issue for other people that have purchased this air fryer. This could potentially cause the handle to fall off while carrying extremely hot food. Be sure to check and tighten them frequently!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2019
CommentsContent: No esperaba el momento en que llegara el air fryer lo estrenamos cocinando alitas de pollo y papitas fritas y quedaron deliciosamente crocantes y con un sabor espectacular y no usamos aceite por no tener en el momento pero compramos el aceite en spray de aove y solo lo usamos con un spray y todo el queda increíblemente sabroso 100% recomendado

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021
CommentsContent: I absolutely love the fryer.  After having using it daily for almost one year, a screw on the basket felt off. It is not a regular screw so I wrote to the factory for a replacement screw, they never reply.  The fryer still working great but I have to hold the bottom of the basket every time I pull it out from the unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2020
CommentsContent: Too easy, I purchased the wifi enabled model last week. It makes cooking to easy, if I find myself craving a snack and with in minutes I have a plate of fries, onion rings or jalapeno poppers. Clean up is fast and simple, hot water soapy water and a quick wipe down with a sponge  and all done. Perfect for a single person or couple. UPDATE!; I am not very pleased with this product, the control panel is defective. I can only operate it with the Wifi app. The fryer works great but I would never recommend the Wifi model. I just lowered my rating to a 0ne star. 09/29/2020 I wanted to add to this review. I just noticed that the non stick finish is coming off of the basket. I have used nothing but a sponge to clean the surface. Very disappointed. I threw the unit away not wanting to consume any of the material. Unfortunately I can't lower my rating below a one star or I would. DO NOT BUY!

CommentsTitle: If you LOVE the taste of cooked plastic, this is the perfect air fryer!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this air fryer, COSORI Air Fryer,Max XL 5.8 Quart, and used it to fry chicken drumsticks and root vegetables. I had to fry the drumsticks in 3 batches because of the quantity. There were 15 drumsticks, so I thought that this would be  a great way to quickly fry and save time without having to deep fry. As the unit cooked there was a smell of plastic but the top of the unit is plastic. I figured that the smell was coming from the top plastic - heat rises! However, the frying basket is metal and coated with a nonstick application. I did not think or believe that the smell was coming from the basket as well. Well, all the food cooked in this air fryer tasted like plastic! I had to throw it all away. Even my 16 year old grandson who will eat pretty much anything, wouldn’t eat it after tasting it. So, 3 batches of chicken drumsticks and 1 batch of root veggies was wasted. That’s 4 uses of the COSORI Air Fryer Max XL! Save your money and time and invest in a deep fryer or oven fry to save on fat consumption. I live in Arizona, so running the oven is rough in 100+ temperatures.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 24, 2020
CommentsContent: Have never been able to get the touchscreen front to respond. The app keeps making me reload and resume. It mainly just sits there and makes me wish I bought another brand.The very few times it has worked the food has been excellent- which is a shame as I cannot use it as intended (to work vs a taken up counter top space spot).

CommentsTitle: Dirty machine with very very poor touch controls
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: The touch controls on the fryer are a JOKE!! They hardly recognize touch so it’s very frustrating trying to change the cook time or temperature. Usually takes pressing 3 or 4 times hunting for the “sweet spot” that works for the button.It took me 2 hours to get the device connected to my WiFi network because the application sucks!The non-stick is starting to rub off where the basket and bottom tray touch. There is no filter or anything on the back so the wall behind the air fryer has grease and small food bits all over it. Luckily the wall has tile so I can scrub it off with harsh cleaning chemicals. If it were a painted wall it would never come off.On a positive note, the fryer cooks nicely.

CommentsTitle: This thing is amazing! And it’s RED!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2020
CommentsContent: Where have you been all my life? I guess I came late to the game because, this is my first air fryer. I’ve been suffering through the messy grease spattered stove all these years when I didn’t need to. I’m so happy I ordered this COSORI Air Fryer!This is so easy to use. You push the power button then everything illuminates. After preheating, you have buttons for whatever you are cooking. Beef, chicken, fish, veggies and more. Even a bacon button. BACON! No more oooo, ouch, making bacon or that awful clean up! I hate cleaning under the range hood!Clean up with this air fryer is a breeze. I know it says you can put it in the dishwasher but, after it cools down, I just wash it the sink with a little soap and hot water. The basket pops out easily and nothing sticks to any of the parts.  I love the texture on the outside of the air fryer. It wipes down easily and shows no fingerprints. I chose the red color. It looks great on my counter and it’s footprint is really no more than my 4 slice toaster.I’m so happy with this purchase I’ve used it every night for the last 2 weeks! My husband is very happy with the results. I’ve tried several of the recipes that came with the air fryer. I gotta say the bacon cheese turkey burgers were amazing!!!! Oh, and the fried chicken! Best thing is is I don’t think I’ve used more than a half a cup of oil in over two weeks of use and probably not even that much. Healthy fried food? Who knew?

CommentsTitle: Simple to use, gets food cooked faster than oven
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2021
CommentsContent: Had this for about a week and have been using it daily. So far it works well. I made simple food like fries, various vegetables, and some marinated chicken (not together, all were separate meals).My fries certainly cooked through but were a bit limp the first time around and I expect this was because I used too much oil when I coated them in spices. The second time I didn't use oil at all and even patted the potatoes dry before cooking, and they came out very crispy. Next time I'll try for something in the middle. All of the fried veggies were tasty but nothing that I can't get from baking them on a sheet pan in the oven. They took less time in the air fryer so that is a benefit. The chicken would have benefited from less time in the fryer but that is my own trial and error since meat cuts can vary in size. Still came out tasty and moist since they've been marinating for a few hours.Cleanup is simple; just have to wait for the whole thing to cool down, then I've been giving it a gentle wipe down but haven't made anything messy enough to warrant a full scrub yet.Overall I'm happy with the purchase. It hasn't done anything unexpected yet (I saw some reviews about it leaking steam but have not had that happen. My coffee machine makes more visible steam than this thing does). Its been a good addition to my kitchen so far.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2020
CommentsContent: AWESOME! I have never used an air fryer and did not actually know anything about them. Then my daughter described her experience and how much she liked it. She told me the brand and size she used. I started doing my own research and found this COSORI had really good ratings and the size seemed about right. I honestly do not have enough words to describe this air fryer. I have been testing it and trying different things ever since it arrived. We are making homemade bagels! Tater tots in here are awesome. The list goes on. I am extremely happy I chose this air fryer.

CommentsTitle: Cosori Air Fryer 5.8 qt Wi-Fi Is Efficient, Heart Healthy, Food Preparation Perfection!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: My Cosori Wi-Fi air fryer has immediately become an indispensable kitchen appliance.  We prepare meals a minimum of 3 times a week.  With a tiny amount of olive oil we are able to prepare an entrée or side with an average of 8 minutes.  Then we rinse and place the basket in our dishwasher for quick clean-up.  We purchased the air fryer over 3 months ago, have used it at least 40-60 times and the basket's Teflon coating remains intact with no evidence of wear or defect.  We use silicon utensils to remove food so not the scratch the basket's interior surface.  This particular Cosori air fryer has a large capacity 5.8 quarts and the outstanding Wi-Fi smartphone and Alexia interface with Cosori's smartphone software application.  This application contains a large number of recipes and permits the user the capability of inputting their own air fryer recipes.  My smartphone and Alexia bring outstanding smart technology to manage my cooking times and technique with perfection.  Without hesitation I say my family are EXTREMELY satisfied with our Cosori Wi-Fi 5.8 quart air fryer!  Imagine during the last 3 months, 40-60 uses, we have used less than a half cup of olive oil for cooking!  That's VERY heart healthy!  An outstanding choice for a top rated air fryer.  Yes choose Cosori!!!  We are a satisfied Cosori consumer!!!

CommentsTitle: I like it. But it's not life changing.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2021
CommentsContent: My first meal was two frozen veggie burger patties, and about two cups of frozen broccoli and frozen brussels sprouts.I'd rate the fryer "promising but not mind blowing". Keep in mind the meal choice, at best, is a 6 out of 10 no matter how you cook it.The fryer made the outside of the frozen veggies sorta charred and crisp, but moist in the center (frozen sprouts are always mushy in the middle so they sucked as usual). I didn't use any oil, but lightly coating them I think would improve the results.Veggie patties are essentially hockey pucks regardless of cooking method. Fryer did nothing to improve them nor make them worse.The fryer connects to Alexa, but I can't think of a scenario where I'd have to remotely tell it to cook or stop cooking.With better ingredients, I think it could be pretty decent, though I think figuring out cooking times will be key. Gonna go grocery shopping and maybe try some of the recipes it comes with.Recipes are accessible via the app, then after you prep the food, you control the fryer through the app to cook the recipe to the recommended settings. Kinda cool.Lastly I got the 5.8Q size which I think is the largest from Cosori in the "cooking bucket" format. Personally think is fine for cooking for one person, maybe 2 depending on what you're making.

CommentsTitle: It has its pros and cons, but so far so good.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I was originally going to purchase another brand since it was 10qtz in size which was much more ideal for me, however it has been out of stock for a while so I decided to get this one instead and honestly.... im not disappointed. This air fryer actually hold its own in terms of size, and functionality, for reference you can fit a whole small chicken or 5 large chicken legs with no issues, and the pre sets are on point with the cooking time. Food cooks pretty fast, within 20 minutes you can get a few things done, Such as roasted potatoes and some fried/roasted chicken. Totally time efficient.Cons, the only issue I have with this air fryer is that the heat tends to flow more on a specific side, so food that tends to settle on the "weak spot" usually end up unevenly cooked, not horribly uncooked however, ive had an easy time fixing that by just shaking the basket and setting up 5 extra minutes to cook. I do like that the air fryer will tell you on the screen at some point to "shake the basket", it will almost always tell you this, so that you can redistribute the food evenly. Especially important if you're cooking things like French fries/loose foods. Another con would be the material for the basket.... it seems to be teflon or some sort of cheap non stick material which are usually not that great for our health so id caution everyone to NEVER scrub the basket and simply just use a soft sponge to avoid the material from scraping off over time.All in all, the air fryer is doing an amazing job. I havemt used my stove in over a week because I've been roasting all my food on this. However, if you're looking for something to bake a large cake, casserole etc. Then this is not it, its simply too small for larger dishes or a big family. A 8 to 10Q air fryer or convection oven might be more ideal. The air fryer also looks nice on the kitchen and doesn't take too much space. The noise isn't too bad either. It won't replace your stove altogether, but it makes an amazing addition for smaller 'side dishes' that would otherwise take forever to make on a normal oven or stoveBelow for reference are some photos of a medium and mini loaf pans you can fit in the basket:Both Mini pan dimensions: 5²³/32 in. X3 ⁵/16 in. X 1⁷/8 in.Medium: 8 in. X 3 ⁷/8 in. x 2 ¹⁵/32 in.I will update you all in regards to the durability and functionality over time and see if anything changes.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had 4 air fryers at this point, different sizes and different brands and so far this one has been my favorite. I love how big it is and the square shape. However, what inspired me to buy it was the fact you can press a release button and the basket comes out. This makes it easy to dump the food right onto a plate or dish, my old ninja (which worked great) just had an attachment that fit snug in the bottom so I couldn’t dump the food out with out getting the crumbs, juices, and oil that had accumulated at the bottom on top of all the food. This is easy to use also. There are pre-set settings or you can change the temperature and cook time manually (just have to press a button once or twice) I have made frozen snack type food in it and food i battered or breaded myself. Both come out amazing. I bought an oil spritzer off Amazon and fill it with olive oil or coconut oil and spritz the food every 5 minutes then shake the basket and continue cooking. That really makes a difference in the final product when it comes to homemade breaded dishes. If you are thinking of buying an air fryer I highly recommend this one. This is even great to reheat leftovers. (Pizza may even be BETTER the next day if you are warm it up in the air fryer). I haven’t had any issues but I have only had it for like two weeks. With in those two weeks I have used it almost everyday. My kids love it and my 9 year old uses it by herself constantly. (Chicken nuggets, fish sticks, frozen popcorn shrimp, pizza pockets, cheese sticks all that junk) So yes I’d definitely recommend this air fryer!

CommentsTitle: The almost perfect machine. Humans vs Dogs
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 7, 2020
CommentsContent: "Turn the beeping beeps off!" cried the dogs as they huddled trembling in the farthest corner of the house. Their humans were again making tater tots marveling at how fast their food was cooked to crispy perfection. Noticing their rescue dogs' reaction every time, they looked for a volume nob an on/off switch for the beeping. Nothing. They wrote to the manufacturer asking for help. Nothing could be done. You see, the year was 2020, the year of the upside down, the year even Murphy ran out of laws to write, the year a family could not enjoy crispy taters without terrifying their dogs. The beeps will only stop when the machine is replaced.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I previously purchased one of these when they first came out; unfortunately, it was just a little too complicated for my liking. So, I gave it to my friend, and she loved it. Years passed, and then my aunt told me about this wonderful new thing she had purchased and didn't have to stand over a stove. Of course, when she told me what it was, I couldn't believe it. So, I started to research in order to find one that was just right for me, because my aunt neglected to mention the brand she had. And I still don't know to this day, and honestly I no longer care. My Corosi, however, is the best. Everything is pre-set. It comes with a recipe book and the clean up is way to easy no matter what you cook. I basically got it to cook wings for football games, but now am cooking most of everything I eat. I have read other reviews that talk about the plastic smell, and even the taste of plastic; however, I can say that once I smelled the plastic I felt defeated. I didn't want to return this possible dream come true, I had dreams of not buying stock in BWW. But low and behold, while retrieving the lot number, I noticed that parts of the styrofoam had broken off, and gotten caught up in a crease; after I removed, everything was great.  Once, I get some of the accessories or air fryer containers for other stuff I don't think I will ever use a conventional stove again. I have already purchased one for my mom. When anyone mentions their air fryer, am there to brag about what I believe is the best air fryer on the market, but don't tell my aunt.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2019
CommentsContent: Like most people, I have a very busy schedule.  When I get home, I don't feel like cooking......and, I'm just an OK cook because I really don't have the patience when I'm tired after a busy day. BUT NOW......I find myself looking forward to coming home and trying new things in my air fryer.  I am single and cooked a cornish hen in my 5.8 qt. fryer.  It came out beautiful.  I also did some chicken wings and they were DELICIOUS.  I even baked a sweet potato in my fryer and it was scrumptious.  I showed my pics to a friend and she had me order a Corsori for her right on the spot!  Thanks Corsori!  The fryer is very simple to use.  Cooks quickly.  Food tastes delicious and there is practically no clean up at all.  I couldn't ask for more. And no, I wasn't given anything to write this review.

CommentsTitle: Side of air fryer melted off
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2021
CommentsContent: I absolutely loved this air fryer until last night when I was making multiple batches of french fries.  Each batch of fries took between 25-30 minutes on 380 degrees to cook and when I was done, I was shocked to see a gaping hole in the left side of the air fryer.  I am afraid to use this anymore as this is clearly a product defect and could have started a fire.

CommentsTitle: Where has atr frying been my whole life?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: First, let me say that this machine exceeded every one of my expectations. It is easy to work, easy to clean, and makes food phenomenally!I have one single negative, and that is maybe because I am cooking for one person. When I cook according to their specifications it's usually a little overdone. If I make french fries I make them about 6 ounces at a time and I could probably make 3 pounds in one batch.Now that I've adjusted my times, everything is great.I have made french fries of course, marinated chicken breast, chicken nuggets, roasted vegetables, including frozen vegetables and frozen breaded fish, to name a few!!.I am on weight watchers, so this really adds a delicious dimension to my recipe box.My nephew who is not limiting calories says that chicken cordon bleu, empanadas, and mozzarella sticks are amazing!I was concerned having read some of the negative reviews about this product. When I got the box I was freaked out because it looked as if it had been re-taped. Whether or not it was, all I can tell you is this machine has worked flawlessly for the last 9 days!!!I will update if there is anything to update you about!Don't think twice about buying this machine, it is awesome!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Let me start by saying this is my go to for cooking lots of things. We even use it to reheat drive thru fries that have gotten cold by the time we get home which make them just like they came out of the fryer. I really enjoy is it being the wifi model and it works with Alexa.On the down side. After almost a year of use, the front panel is very hard to use. I'm glad I have the wifi model because that still works perfectly. I press on front panel buttons and sometimes have to do it hard. I often cannot adjust time or temperature. I'm afraid it fail completely soon. We wash the basket in dishwasher and found the screws holding the basket to he handle worked out. I lost two and was able to find substitutes and ended up buying another basket since I sometimes will cook different things for the same meal.There is a bit of learning curve but the included recipe book and the app are very helpful. You have to experiment because some things come out great and some do better cooking in the oven.I would have given it 5 Stars but I'm afraid it will not be a long lasting appliance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2020
CommentsContent: If I could give this piece of crap 0 stars I would. It worked ok for a while and then stopped. I came on here asking for help from the manufacturer and they kept asking stupid ridiculous questions like did you plug it in. Is there too much grease near the button. It electrocuted me. It was a piece of crap. Know that I will never, ever purchase another piece of crap Cosori junk ever again. I am so pissed off right now I need to stop  before I say something that I will regret. Don't waist your money on this crap. The manufacture won't stand behind their product. I ended up tossing this piece of junk in the garbage. And know that I will take every opportunity to trash your company and your junk products on here and social media and anywhere else I am able. Your products are junk and your company is junk! Perhaps I have gotten my point across. JUNK!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And to the manufacturer, don't contact me, ever, for anything. I don't want to discuss how much you suck. I don't want to be reimbursed. You had your opportunity to make things right and you blew it. Now I will give my money to one of your competitors.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This air fryer comes highly recommended.  It’s reviews were better than that of larger branded ones like Ninja, etc.  Perhaps this is a large brand but I had never heard of Cosori before.  Anyhow, I was excited to upgrade to this after just using a basic one for so long.  It is incredibly spacious.  It has tons of room and I love that.  You can comfortably fit 3 average chicken breasts (is that a unit of measurement????) lol.  I like the safety feature it has where if you remove the tray while it’s mid-cook, it will stop the cook automatically.  Once you re-insert it will resume.  It’s relatively easy to clean, I personally don’t use the dishwasher because I am afraid of it rusting.  The only con so far is that it’s quite loud.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 30, 2019
CommentsContent: So this airfryer is good quality in my opinion. It makes great french fries from scratch and makes crispy tater tots no oil needed. Also I made hamburger patties on the steak setting and pork chops. The pork chops came out pretty crispy but I did notice that putting just one allows the meat to crisp up more than having two peices. I would say this works better for individual meals than for large quatities when it comes to meat. I feel that this fryer gets a bad rep because the cooking times in the cookbook are wrong but the temperature at which they should cook at are right. A lot of the times when I let the food fry for the time said in the cookbook it would burn. My recommendation would be to cook the food for less time than precribed and then if it needs more time simply add more time. That is how I started to get better results whith the airfryer because it acctually does a good job. Its just the cookbook thats off. The machine is pretty easy to use and manual explains everthing clearly.  Clean up is easy just make sure to use hot water, the manual said cold water could damage the fryer.

CommentsTitle: Its very good but just an fyi.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2020
CommentsContent: It is very nice and works well.  We use it all of the time.  But just a heads up to save you a problem.  We have had ours for about 5 months and on the inside of the basket and carrier both, there are 3 or 4 Philipps screws.  Tonight my wife was washing it and one fell out and  went down the garbage disposal. She was able to get it back.  Upon checking I found that all were loose.  So save yourself  possible headache and check them and tighten them up.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this Air Fryer two weeks ago, the item arrived fast. It was very well packed no damage. When I opened the box the Air Fryer looked brand new, however, the display was all scratched like someone has grabbed their keys and scratched all over the display. I called COSORI customer serviced, the gentlemen was so polite and professional, they offered a replacement right away. They grabbed my information and Amazon order number, I GIVE AN A+ FOR THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICES.The replacement arrived 4 days later, brand new no scratch, I am still learning how to use it, but we already love it. I cooked fries, chicken and steak. This air fryer is very hot so you have to be very careful with timing. I love how it beeps when you have to flip or shake.As for the taste, I don't know if it is because it is new, but my food tasted a little bit like the Cosori, I don't know how to explain in, but I'm guessing it is because the product is new, because the same thing happened with my pressure cooker.My husband and I definitely recommend this air fryer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: After 6 months, this product is falling apart. The basket inside the drip pan moves and vibrates during cooking. It has chaffed away significant sections of the Teflon coating on the drip pan. This immediately rusted. Also the crimp at the top of the fryer basket has rust all of the way around under the lip. When you do the 5 minute preheat, very often the pan "Pops" out of the heating area. It moves very far. If you have the fryer on the edge of a counter, the basket will fall to the floor. The plastic on the handle broke on mine after a few of these falls. The flavor of the food is incredible. But I will look for another brand than Cosori.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 19, 2019
CommentsContent: I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my Cosori Air Fryer!!!  Fried foods are my favorites, but I hate cleaning up the mess.  Even though I am on the keto eating plan, I still don't like cleaning up the mess of frying food, especially bacon.  I knew a year ago I wanted an air fryer, and it took me awhile to pick out which one was right for me.  I researched, and I read reviews.  Finally I decided upon the Cosori.  The main reason I picked this one were the reviews, not only for the air fryer, but for the positive Cosori customer service reviews.I waited to write this review because I wanted to see how I liked it.  I've had it for two months now, and I purchased it at the regular price.  I also have not had any reason to contact their customer service.  I have used it everyday now, sometimes 2-3 times a day.It is sooo easy to clean.  After cooking, any grease I pour into an old coffee container, and then wipe it with paper towel before I use soap and a sponge (the soft side, not the scouring side.)  The baskets can go into the dishwasher, but so far I have washed it by hand each time because I use it so often, and I don't run the dishwasher every day.I have cooked bacon, steaks, sausage patties, frozen chicken wings, frozen chicken breasts, hamburgers, hotdogs, vegetables, etc.  I plan on experimenting with desserts eventually ... just haven't done it yet.  The first week of using the air fryer, I overcooked a few items, especially frozen vegetables like broccoli, trying to figure out the time of cooking.  No big deal.  I ate it anyway.  It has preset times, which I use every so often, but I wanted to understand the fryer so I experimented more.  I only cook for three people, sometimes four, so the size is just right.  If there is something in particular that I want to cook in it, I read air fryer recipes and ideas from others, then I adapt it to my likes and eating needs.  I am so very happy with my purchase!!!!  I hope this review helps make your decisions easier.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2019
CommentsContent: not sure if it cooks good or not yet ....i will let you know  but when you get it and they tell you to remove the plastic from inside it.  the big piece of plastic was stuck to the top as if it was put on while hot.  appears the plastic is attached to the coil while it was still hot because it is hard hard to get it off.  had to take twizzers and pull it from around those coils and very unhandy.  hope i got it all,  it seemed as if it had been heated the plastic adhered to the coil

CommentsTitle: The warrantee and customer service suck.  Will not repeat purchase.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 14, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought the fryer in November 2018.  I registered it for an extra year (2 years) of warrantee.  I recently contact the company explaining the drawer no long locked (clicked) in place as would not operate unless I jammed it closed with something heavy in front of the drawer.  I sent a picture of the top of the drawer showing the piece that "clicks" when you try to push the drawer in place.  I also sent a copy of the extended warrantee I had registered.What I got back from their customer support was instructions to send them a video of the drawer being inserted (and presumably popping back out), a copy of the purchase order and a (re) statement of the problem.  I suspect all that is designed to make me just go away.  It has, except for this review.What the company got from me is a (former) customer who will not replace this fryer with another one from CORSORI.If you think you will like this fryer, roll the dice and hope you never need it warrantee service.  Other than the lousy customer service and the drawer latch design, it's not a bad fryer.

CommentsTitle: Defective Design - Manufacturer won't stand behind product (updated at end) happy ending
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I bought this unit from Amazon Warehouse and it was listed as  Used - very good. The unit was brand new and the packaging was damaged. I used it for a few months and it quit working.  It was supposed to have a one year warranty so I contacted the manufacturer and explained that the basket latching system had failed.  I could  wiggle it and pull up and it would turn on the unit until you let loose. (see video)  They suggested that I clean the unit (even though I told them that I had already tried that) and they would not honor the warranty because it was listed a s used because  I bought it from Amazon Warehouse. The bottom line is that I will not purchase ANYTHING from Cosori. I believe that this product is defective in its design of its latching mechanism.  Cosori used a loop hole to justify not honoring their warranty.  The unit was never used before I received it.  It failed within the warranty period and they will not replace or repair the unit. BUYER BEWARE!(update)I reviewed the Amazon Warehouse policy and I was not eligible for the  company warranty as they had stated.I contacted  support noting that the unit was unused when  I received it and that I was disappointed that they wouldn't honor the warranty. In between time, I tore into the defective unit and found a micro switch that signaled the presence of the cooking tray had failed.  I ordered a replacement for $5 and it is on its way. Meanwhile Cosori contacted me  and made a ONE TIME EXCEPTION  and was shipping me a replacement unit.The bottom line is that I changed  this review to 3 stars because they considered the situation.

CommentsTitle: Didn't think I would use it this much !!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2019
CommentsContent: Controls are well laid out.  Pre-heat makes getting set easy.  Generous basket size.  Amazingly non-stick, even in the base unit with bacon or longer fried foods.  I've used foil to cover the base under the bracket to ease cleanup, but you really don't have to since it washes out SO EASILY.  The snowflake icon button for frozen foods is just right and I have developed a habit of delicious frozen brussel sprouts air fried on a regular basis.  Who would have thought?  Perfect for households of two or three, or even four.  Easy and fast chicken breasts or thighs or tenders, shrimp, asparagus, jicama fries, etc.  Haven't tried steak since I prefer sous vide slower cooking for those followed by a quick pan sear, but burgers were good.  Most pics show french fried potatoes, which are good, but don't overload the basket like those many photos show---that won't work well.  Oh, and I love the "shake" reminder which comes on autamically on a few of the icon button foods.  When you take the tray out to shake the oven pauses and restarts at the same place on the timer to continue the cook.  Highly recommend the Cosori Air fryer.

CommentsTitle: I love my Corsori 5.8 Qt air fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2020
CommentsContent: The quick review:  I love this AF. I’m glad I trusted the 10,000 people who gave this Corsori 5.8 QT AF high reviews. I can’t imagine anyone regretting purchasing this item.Detailed review:  This is my first AF and I read a lot of reviews and watched quite a few videos giving AF reviews. I have a family of 5 and my youngest is a 6’ tall teenage boy so I basically cook for 5 adults so AF cooking capacity was a factor.  Other factors I considered where ease of cleaning, ease of use, how much I thought I’d actually use an AF, and cost.I only have had this AF for 5 days as of 7/24/20.  I will update this post in a few weeks. I have used this AF every day since using it.**UPDATE 8/5/2020**:  I have used this air fryer every single day since I purchased it.  I am amazed at how easy it makes cooking chicken breasts, chicken tenders, and pork chops.  I especially like how the meat is fully cooked (I test using a meat thermometer) but still so tender and juicy.  On my list of foods to try are a whole chicken and steaks.  My teens use it to toast their sandwiches for lunch.  It's awesome at reheating leftovers (especially pizza!!!).  Oh, yes, it makes awesome fries and onion rings.  I am so happy I finally purchased an air fryer, and this Corsori is still easy to clean (even after I made pork chops with a lot of sauce the other night), easy to use, and has made cooking so much easier.  I continue to highly recommend the Corsori 5.8 QT Air Fryer.What I have made so far:*French fries (frozen) - yes, excellent!!  Easily handled entire bag and the fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, just how I like them.*Fried zucchini:  the traditional flour, egg wash, breading. Instead of frying in a skillet of oil I simply misted the slices with olive oil. They were wonderful. Next time, I will try to make a keto version of these.*chicken breakfast sausage links - also very good*frozen salmon patties that I purchase at Costco - very good!  What I like about this is that the salmon patties are usually my lunch. I practice 16:8 intermittent fasting. I don’t have the patience to do a lot of cooking for my first meal of the day and I want protein. This AF quickly cooks my salmon patty, it is delicious, and clean-up is a breeze!*Italian hot sausage sandwiches - oh my! ❤️  I purchased the accessories for this AF. I used the cake pan in the AF to cook the onions and peppers.  Then, I removed the veggies and cooked the sausages. My entire family and I loved how the AF cooked the sausages - crisp on the outside but juicy on the inside. Once the sausages were cooked, I made the sandwiches (sliced the sausage roll, put a sausage link in the roll, topped the sausage with the already cooked veggies. I put the sandwiches in the AF at 380° for 2 minutes.  Oh my!  I wish I had better words to describe just how good these sandwiches were!  Disclaimer:  I could have squeezed 3 sandwiches in at once but everything I’ve read says airflow is important, so I only did 2 at a time.** update 8/5/20:  I have also made boneless chicken breasts, bone-in chicken pieces (breasts, wings, drumsticks), and pork chops.  Everything has turned out great!Size:  the square basket (vs a round basket) seems to make the cooking capacity of the 5.8 QT Corsori greater than similarly sized AF’s.  I considered an oven style AF but I didn’t want to lose that much counter space. I am quite happy with the size of this AF.Ease of cleaning:  Every time I use this AF and then clean it, I am AMAZED at how easy it is to clean!  👍👍Ease of use:  As I stated earlier, this is my first air fryer. I find it very easy to use. It’s fairly self-explanatory with the preset buttons.How much I thought I’d use an AF:  This point was very important to me.  I have been the proud owner for 5 years, at least, of a bread machine that I’ve only used less than 10 times. Please don’t judge me, I hear about it all the time from my family. I have used this AF everyday since I received it, some days twice. I see this AF becoming an essential tool in my kitchen.Cost:  I am a big believer in “you get what you pay for”.  That said, I have 2 kids in college and another one that will be headed to college in a few years, so I can’t unwisely throw money around. I don’t have any experience with any other air fryers, so I can’t comment on whether I think more expensive brands are worth the extra expense or not. What I can say is that I think I definitely got my money’s worth with the Corsori 5.8 QT air fryer.Final words:  if you are lost in the sea of various air fryer brands, in my opinion you will be very happy if you decide to purchase the Corsori 5.8 QT air fryer.I purchased the AF with my own money and I am not reimbursed in any way for this review. I seldom write reviews but I am so impressed with this AF and I want to help anyone who is as befuddled as I was when I was trying to chose which AF to purchase.Other recommendations:  I did purchase the accessories that are available from Corsori for this AF. I am glad I did, they make the AF even more versatile. I recommend having tongs that are safe for scratch resistant surfaces. Lastly, I did put an insulated counter protector under my AF. It doesn’t seem to get that hot under my AF but I have new counters, so I am using a protector just in case.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: While I love this product up until this week, things have changed based on my ability to contact the company.  I have had my air fryer for 5-6 months.  The food is always amazing, however i was cooking pork chops earlier this week and about 6 minutes in while I was making some sides, the drawer shot out of the air fryer and onto the floor.  The drawer broke and doesn't sit sealed in the air fryer any more.I figured i would contact the manufacture and just order a new drawer and bin to go inside the fryer.  However, they do not have an email to contact only a phone number.  While my work schedule in production I can't call during their business hours.  This has caused me to go from cooking with it every night to nothing and I don't know how to fix it.  I don't want to buy another complete unit, when only the drawer needs to be replaced on this one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I was very skeptical about purchasing one of these (air fryers) but after a visit to my niece's house, seeing how quick and easy it was to cook frozen chicken strips in less time than it takes my oven to pre-heat, I decided to give it a go.  After it arrived and I initially washed it/found a place for it in the kitchen, I went to the store and purchased a variety of frozen foods to put it through its paces. I made french fries first and they turned out great, very crispy just as I like them.  Next was jalapeno poppers, chicken strips, and frozen battered fish.  I just finished making some breaded mushrooms and turkey burgers in it this evening and everything has turned out either as expected or has surpassed my expectations.It's easy enough for just about anyone to use and clean up is a breeze.  I'm only giving it four stars at this time because I have yet to try out some of the other cooking features but will be happy to up it to five stars if I continue to be as please with it as I have been so far.  I also really like the look of it; it's not a shiny black, it is more of a matte black which makes it match better with my other appliances.  I also like that it's more square than round, fits better on my counter.  It is rather large so if you don't have the counter space you might wish to order a smaller version.  So far it's been one of the best things I've purchased for my kitchen in a long time.

CommentsTitle: Convenient for a busy family, mostly cooks to perfection!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
