CommentsContent: Our air fryer has served a great purpose and constantly provides us with a delicious meal. I was eager to give this product a 5 star review but here’s why I won’t. The French fry button should work for majority of all frozen French fry options, however, this has given us burnt fries on more occasions than I care to admit. I typically use the frozen food button for french fries instead of the fry button due to this issue.Aside from that flaw, everything else has been a perfect meal! Cooked flawlessly and doesn’t leave a huge grease mess or pot of fry oil to clean up after later.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   My life is changed forever omg. Buy it. Its not even debatable.  I will never cook the same. Personally I dont like cooking all that much cause the mess you have to clean up and bc of how much time it takes but this baby eliminates both problems. 10 minutes you have PERFECT fries, salmon, I cant even express my gratitude for who ever created such magic. The cook book is BOMB, cant wait to become Martha Stewart. Cant wait to throw brussel sprouts in this baby. I’m literally buying my mom one and celebrating “christmas in july” bc shes an actual cook and this is gonna changer her life. If I could choose one machine out of all I the ones I have in the kitchen this is 1st without a DOUBT.Now. Regarding plastic smell - sure ~now~ I am noticing a slight smell that comes with the frying (I thought it was what I was cooking) but its so minor and irrelevant. The machine is magic and honestly I’m sure they all have more or less of a funk. Considering the reviews this one didnt have nearly as many as others. The number of reviews cant lie. Do yourself the favor - this is one of those items that goes on the “best life investments” next to pre TSA. so buy it. And as drake once said - YOU CAN THANK ME NOW.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2019
CommentsContent: I looked at specs and reviews of a number of products, but one review in particular recommended this one and remarked on the benefits of a square basket and this one has a square basket. I was originally considering spending less but based on the review I bought the Cosori, and I am happy with my decision. I love it and have made a variety of foods in it and everything has turned out great. And it is so easy to clean, simple to operate, doesn't get hot on the outside, and for the internal size, does not have a huge footprint. Fantastic product. If I had to select the kitchen appliances that I consider the most useful it would be the Cosori air fryer, a grill pan with interchangeable surfaces, a k-cup coffee machine and maybe a microwave. Do not hesitate to buy the Cosori!

CommentsTitle: Easy to clean and cooks well/evenly but annoying to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This air fryer is relatively easy to clean and heats fries, fried chicken, and bread fairly evenly. (on par with convection ovens, and better than toaster/small ovens) However, the annoying thing about this air fryer is the loud beeps that there is no way to turn off. When I originally purchased this product, I was hoping to use it in the morning, but the loud beeps make it impossible since it will wake everyone in the house up. If the loud beeps are not a concern for you, I can recommend this product. However, for me the beeps are a deal breaker.

CommentsTitle: missing the instruction book and recipe book prevent  proper user.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2019
CommentsContent: the instructions book and recipe book are missing. I need these books.

CommentsTitle: Nice fryer on the first try!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 2, 2020
CommentsContent: My husband wanted an air fryer. He kept seeing the one TV infomercial but I when I read the Amazon reviews on it. I didn’t like the ‘toxic death smell’ comments.  So after many days of research and reading reviews, I finally settled on the Corosi. First, I liked the supposed size of it.  And I also like the reviews of the preheating and shake features that make a difference from other fryers.  When it came in I was surprised at the size.And after a couple of months of owning it and using it - I AM SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS.  Size is perfect for family compared to others.  I like the squared deep basket. It is big to keep out on my counter but no biggie to pull out of pantry when needed.  The nonstick basket is easy to clean and I even purchase paper cooking liners for it that help with things sticking.  Why you should buy: 1-Preheat. If you preheat like an oven you giving food a jump on being crispy. 2-shake feature.  No it does not shake for you. But half way through cooking it beeps to alert you to move, flip, toss, shake, shimmy - whatever your food.YOU WILL NEED A LITTLE OIL FOR MAXIMUM CRISPNESS. I bought an oil sprayer that allows to spritz the food with enough to cook/crisp food.  We have used a lot for frozen items instead of using oven.  Tip: for exception of potatoes like fries - keep things in one layer. If you throw in on top items, the bottom items may not crisp up enough or you will doing a lot of turning. Takes one more run maybe but it’s worth having crispy spring rolls or taquitos when they are cooked in one layer.Did cook burgers once. Feel like it really shrunk them but they came out ok.  Did hot dog and those came out great.  My husband has done frozen chicken wings and he loved how they came out.I did buy the additional kit that has a pizza pan and other items so will need to try those considering in lock down due to COVID-19 right now.UPDATE: I have read other reviews of basket handle breaking/cracking.  With all things you cannot manhandle it.  It should not be dropped.  All it takes is a gentle push of the button and slide out.  If you treat it well and take care of it, it will work fine.

CommentsTitle: Not as Impressive as I was hoping...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2020
CommentsContent: The “touch screen” has never worked properly so there is only the pre-set 350 degree for 15 minutes that works. It takes about 10-20 button presses for it to even turn the power on and then start the pre-programmed cycle. I have learned to make do and the food really is great when you time it just right. I could never actually get it to sync even though it is WiFi compatible... I should have returned it but we were moving just after we got it and it didn’t get unboxed until after the returnable timeframe... pretty frustrating for the amount of money spent on it...  :/ I gave it two stars because it really does make great toast and frozen fries, you just have to set an alarm to stop it .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2020
CommentsContent: This thing is LEGIT.I’ll preface why with a little background info... My wife got an InstaPot a while back and it slowly became the bane of her existence. She went through Six-dozen eggs just trying to get consistent hard-boiled eggs, ruined two roasts and a litany of other dishes in a little over two weeks. She experienced firsthand the fleeting victory of accomplishing what she set out to do only three times. THREE. Needless to say, once she’d finished going through the multiple stages of grief, rage, depression and finally acceptance, I came home from work and saw the thing in pieces scattered across my driveway. She vowed “NEVER. AGAIN.” and that was that.Until this...Months had passed and she’s started noticing her friends using air fryers. She liked what she saw but the PTSD from the InstaPot was holding on strong. She was leery at first, then decided to pull the trigger... which may or may not have been helped along when I saw the pics of fries and chicken wings... fast-forward two weeks and I came home to ridiculously mouthwatering smells and tears. Only, this time, they were tears of JOY. I looked over and our kids were savagely attacking heaping mounds of fries, nuggets, wings, corn dogs, everything. She even fried half out veggie drawer. The table looked like a cartoon version of thanksgiving, only it was a Tuesday and only a week into the Covid quarantines. My 7-year-old told me to hurry up, sit and eat before she came to her senses and took it all away. To this day, our family has known no greater homemade feast.Five stars. Would recommend.

CommentsTitle: Easy to use, Easy buttons or set own time and temp
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I found that the easy buttons work for some things and others I use the suggestions online, like Pinterest or other sites and blogs about food and recipes. The steak setting worked perfectly for three 6 oz venison steaks. The veggie and root veggie settings probably should be tweaked and set your own.The ease of the basket removal is a great feature and it makes it super easy to clean. I have not put it in the dishwasher, yet, because I clean it right away and it doesn't need any deep cleaning.Bread under the basket for bacon is a MUST, after two out of four batches to cook one 1lb package of bacon (spread the pieces out to cook thru) it started smoking pretty good, the water method is not really a good one!Read blogs and especially Pinterest for ideas, it's a great tool.You must turn things if you want crispy/browned on both sides.You must oil things (mist) to get a crispy texture.

CommentsTitle: DIES/OVERHEATS/TURNS BACK ON, ON ITS OWN
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this product and I’ve probably used it 10 times. The last 2 times I have used it, it cut off completely and goes blank. It won’t show any of the digital buttons or anything. It’s like it completely died. So, I took the food out, went to use my oven, and then left it plugged up and it started up on its own and continued to count down, what if I wasn’t home? The outside of the fryer was hot as well. I will try to get a hold of the tech support for the fryer since it’s been over a month for the amazon return.

CommentsTitle: The perfect Beef Wellington wizard. So good we bought three!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 10, 2019
CommentsContent: As per the other reviews, our oven has become redundant. Had this beauty for over 8 month now and thought I'd share our experiences.We had one which cooked everything to perfection but rather than trying to time different ingredients we bought another eg, steak in one fries in the other.Then we bought one for a family member.Here's what we cook to absolute perfection:- Bacon, perfectly crispy. Just press the bacon button. It's that easy.- Chicken thighs, gotta admit it I now eat the chicken skin. Never used to but it's crispy and delicious. Just press the chicken button. Walk away, come back. Enjoy.- Steak (you'll never use a pan again) maintains all the juices with a perfect all-round sear. Just figure out your own cooking times for how you like it cooked.- Fries, roast potatoes, potato wedges. Fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside- Roasted vegetables, cooked with a little char- Breaded fish and chicken. Even the thickest pieces of say chicken are done in 5-8 minutes. Crispy, juicy and delicious. No fat. Amazing.We pretty much use these little wizard gadgets for every home cooked meal.It will take a while to figure out your perfect cooking times for steak, breaded chicken and so on. After that unplug your oven as you won't be using it.Anything you can cook in an oven, a pan or broiler will cook and taste so much better in the air fryer in more than half the time and with just a coating of spray oil.Our biggest gamble and success was had cooking Beef Wellington and it was the best we've ever made. The pastry was cooked evenly and to crispy perfection while the fillet was beautifully medium rare. That's a lot of expensive ingredients and preparation time to gamble. Gordon Ramsey's recipe, 6 minutes at 400 and 6 at 320. Job done. Gourmet.Give it a quick rinse and it's ready to conjure up the next delicious meal with the press of a button. Feels like cheating sometimes especially with steak coming out so well. Press a button walk away come back 5 minutes later and you've got restaurant quality steak.Just be sure to always pre-heat!Not sure about other cheaper airfryers. I know preheating is essential to the crispness which I'm not sure the others have.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 26, 2019
CommentsContent: Have used it a dozen times and can see it's usefulness now. I think getting a good recipe down for the flour dusting used to dredging meats and seafood breading might take a while. I mock fried some butterflied shrimp I'd prepped with egg, flour and Panko. It came out pretty well but was clear heavily breaded stuff needs to be raised from the bottom of the basket. Solution is to purchase the optional kit of accessories. Which I did. Plus the extra basket.Definitely seeing the efficiency of this thing.Hate learning new icons but once you know the relative temps you're good.Even after you choose and icon setting you can fine tune the time and temp on the fly.Nice clear alarms. Depending on icon mode you select it will beeeep half way to let you flip items in the basket. And beep again when done.Even after you choose an icon setting you can fine tune the time and or temp on the fly as necessary.

CommentsTitle: Don’t know how I lived without this
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 23, 2019
CommentsContent: This product deserves more than 5 stars.. it’s that good. I have been going back and forth with the idea of purchasing an air fryer for about a year now but couldn’t justify spending over 100$ for one. This one came up on a Prime Day deal for around $70.. after reading all the reviews I decided to buy it and give it a try. The reviews did not lie! This thing is great! My 4 year old loves chicken nuggets and this thing cooked frozen chicken nuggets in 10 minutes and they came out so crispy.. I am so happy that I no longer have to worry about my 4 year old asking me 100 times If his chicken nuggets are done cooking. It also came with a recipe book that has so many other recipes and recommendations.. I was actually really surprised at how many different things you can cook in here (steaks, meatballs, chicken parm, muffins, French toast) I can’t wait to try them all. The presets are really convenient and the manual cooking is also really simple and it preheats in about 5 minutes which is awesome. Although this one is big and does take up a bit of counter space, it was a great purchase especially at the discounted prime day price. I’m very happy with this product so far and I’ve already recommended it to my friends. I will definitely be purchasing the accessory set to complete this in the near future. This is definitely the best thing I’ve ever purchased off of Amazon!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Update: Rumbling noise is louder and louder when using it. Also smokes starts coming up from the side and back when used. It just seems unsafe to use. I will be returning it.Got this air fryer 2 days ago. Want to start eating healthier. Made wings and pork with onions in this thing. So far I have no issues. Easy to clean as well. It does however purpose a minor rumbling nose while cooking.

CommentsTitle: Mine quit working 8 weeks into use.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 9, 2019
CommentsContent: Purchased this air fryer May 14, 2019. I hate cooking, but have enjoyed cooking with this. HOWEVER, it stopped functioning correctly two weeks ago. It gets 4-6 minutes into cooking time and just shuts down. It’s very disappointing after initially being so thrilled. Before my issues started, I bought one for each of my kids. My fingers are crossed that those units don’t crap out on them as well. Buy another brand would be my advice.

CommentsTitle: Only problem is I need maybe 3 more to uses all at once.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I have gone crazy and been air frying everything. I cooked hamburgers, shrimp, anything frozen, pizza, steak (Which turn out awesome and only take 16 minutes.) bacon, sausage and any vegetable I can stick in there. The key is always pre-heat, spray with oil and seasoning. The picture I included was all cooked in the fryer. Hamburger steak, asparagus, corn on the cob and sauteed mushrooms. Well OK, the gravy was done on the stove. I can set the cooking temp or setting on my phone and hit start and there it goes. And the clean up is a breeze. Nothing stick, not grease, melted cheese nothing. I have talked my neighbors into buying this model and they must be crazy because they haven't taken it out of the box yet. Oh ye of little faith, Forgive them Lord they know not what they are missing. Their loss, but I understand people fear change. This throws everything we have been taught about cooking out the window. The food is done quicker and it actually taste better.My only complaint is that maybe just on mine but the buttons are not very responsive. But with always having my phone around this has not been a deal breaker. In fact is much easier to custom set it on my phone.I love this and the wife and I have joked that we need more to cook more things at once. But until then it's nothing the warm setting on the oven hasn't solved while I cook more items.Get one, get two you won't be sorry.

CommentsTitle: Need to Learn How to Cook Again and Single Tray is a Drawback
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2019
CommentsContent: The Air Fryer works well and is taking some time to get used to new cooking times. The rule of thumb of reducing temperature by 25 degrees and cooking time by 20 percent does not appear to hold true for this item. I have also found that with only a basket and no additional racks, the space for cooking is limited. I did buy other racks to put into the Air Fryer but the heat is distributed unevenly with the additional rack and again cooking times and temperatures need to be adjusted. Also can only add one additional rack. When I bought I thought a larger size unit would allow for more items to be cooked at once. Not the case.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I ordered this Sept. 3, 2019 and received it today, Sept. 5th, 2019. I was excited to use it and had the food ready. I preheated it and after 2 mins, it said E1. I called the company and they said its defective!!!  Since I just had major surgery, I can not repack it. I called the company and they emailed me information which I sent the information they wanted. I will edit my review when I get a new unit. I tried 3 times to use the unit and E1 kept coming up which is open circuit temperature monitor issue. I am now waiting for a new replacement. Such a disappointment since I saw a lot of good reviews for this.Update: 10/16/19 I received a new unit but wanted to wait a few weeks to see how it works. No problems so far, and it works well. I like how it cooks food. I was told that smoke that comes out from the bottom is normal when cooking certain foods like chicken or wings.  Easy to clean baskets in dishwasher.  I look forward to using this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2019
CommentsContent: For the first time we cooked a chicken (5 1/2 pounds)) not 1 piece of dry meat whats good about it is the leftover chicken we will just put it back in and reheat it.. I spent at least a week going thru all the reviews and must say it helped ALOT!! I just can't believe it took me so long to get one but I couldn't be happier, now to get my son one ( widower with 2 school age kids) he could get home from work and in 1 hour have a delicious meal.

CommentsTitle: Love it but be careful with the basket
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: Excellent customer service, basket issue was covered under warranty.Update: After about a month one of the screws fell out into my food. It stayed tight after screwing it back I'm but glad I saw it first!  Then after about 2 months it had trouble knowing the basket was closed. If I press down on the handle it turns on but then the basket is tilted out of the dryer, as soon as I let go it turns off.Original 5 star: Does so much more than appetizers. Perfectly cooks chicken, pork, potatoes, anything that you could bake or deep fry. Fried chicken in the airfryer is way  better than kfc. Reduces prep and cook time with no oil splatter, and an easy to clean basket (dishwasher safe). Works well with Alexa and the app is handy if you leave the room. Very much recommend

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had this air fryer for 6 months and use it at least 4 times a week. I do everything in it, chicken, steak, hambergers, sausage  you name it I use my air fryer. It cooks so fast and clean up is a breeze. When cooking fatty things place a piece of bread between. The baskets this Assets to absorb grease. Doing this not only gets  the grease but there will be no smoking. The taste with steaks is so good.So after 6 months I noticed that plastic on the outside cover was breaking off and had cracked. No problem I contacted Cosori and they sent me a new one. Great customer service  I would give it more stars but no way to do that.  If you do buy this brand rest assured that Cosori has a one year warranty and they do honor it .

CommentsTitle: This is my first air fryer...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: ...and it's pretty incredible. 5 minutes or less to pre-heat versus my oven that takes 30 minutes? Talk about pizza rolls WHEN NEEDED. I have a large range of foods I've tried that are better in the oven, some are better in the microwave, and now some foods are better in the air fryer. Leftovers are a freaking breeze. Just go to the freezer aisle, pick out some random quick meals (like egg rolls, corn dogs, something easy a 13 year old boy would eat) and I promise the air fryer will not let you down. Stick to the oven for meats - the air fryer does seem to dry out more than I'd like.Probably my only complaint about this is the basket itself - the main basket has the handle so even though I'm comfortable sticking the metal extras in the dishwasher, the main basket gets pretty gross. It's hard to clean in my opinion because of all the ridges - sponges will be ripped apart. I would definitely recommend purchasing separate dishwasher-safe accessories if you're super lazy like me and hate handwashing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2020
CommentsContent: As others have reported, mine arrived with a non-functioning control panel.  Everything works fine through the app. This seems to be a recurring issue based on recent reviews.  My guess is they've had a bad batch of hardware as this is an otherwise highly rated product.  Awaiting a response from Cosori Support as I type.UPDATE: Support were very responsive and acknowledged the issue.  They are sending me a replacement from a new batch once they are available.  They also seem genuinely interested in tracing all the bad items and asked for a photo of the etched batch number on the bottom of the unit.Upgrading to 3 stars for now.  Once I get the replacement and verify it works I'll review my rating again.UPDATE: My replacement arrived very quickly and I'm happy to report this unit is fully functional.

CommentsTitle: Happy as a clam (where in the world did that expression ever come from?)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 30, 2019
CommentsContent: Love this thing.  Cooking is actually fun again -- no more sticking my hands in a hot oven or getting burned by splattering grease on the stovetop.  The steaks come out juicy and tender on the inside, as they should, yet they are still cooked properly.  And don't even get me started on the fantastic french fries.  I even cooked a whole chicken breast in there yesterday.  While it just fit in the basket diagonally, I did have to perform a little surgery on the sternum as the basket was not quite deep enough, but it was worth the effort.  I have had this air fryer for only a week and a half, but am using it daily to experiment with.  As for those complaints about these baskets falling apart easily, I am checking each time I use it to make sure both parts are latched together properly before lifting them, and being careful to not touch the release button (which has a built-in safety cover) until I have set the unit down.  It seems to be very well built and cleans easily.  Cosori even provides a customer-support phone number, which is rare these days, and they are also offering an extra year warranty for free, if the form they provide is sent in within two weeks of purchase, which I did.  All the directions are clear and easily understandable, and the recipe book is quite handy for learning of the possibilities.  Plus, the machine offers suggested temperatures and cook times on its dashboard, all of which can easily be overridden by any preferred changes.  All in all, I am completely satisfied... no, change that to "elated," by this product.  If anything changes, I will update this review.

CommentsTitle: Your food will end up tasting like the material the fryer is made of
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Although I researched and this came up as one of the better air fryers, I’m disappointed with my purchase. Biggest qualm is that anything you cook ends up tasting like the smell of the fryer. What I mean by that is, the plastics and material it’s constructed from can be smelt and tasted the first time you use. Thought that would go away but a month later and all our food still taste like the fryer. Wish I could return but we are past our 30 day return policy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I just recieved my Corsori air fryer and i'm so excited. It is so large, so much cooking space. Came with excellent instruction book and a wonderful cookbook. I'm going to have some fun with this I can tell. UPDATE... Oh my word love this air fryer. Love the size and the safety feature from the basket falling out because of hitting release by mistake. I do find it cooks much faster then my old one but that is great!! I researched alot of them before buying this one. Absolutely.. no regrets!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my second air fryer, my first one I inherited from my parents who love to buy all the gadgets but almost never actually use them.I absolutely love it, but one thing drives me insane. The controls. Instead of having individual buttons which adjust temperature and time, you have to select the temperature and then use the same + or - to adjust it up or down, then you select time and use the same buttons. It would be much easier to have them separate. Also the power button could just as easily serve as the button to turn it on. I can't tell you how many times I have adjusted the time and temperature only to turn it off on accident. It takes a lot of brain power not to. It might be because it is my second and my first had better controls.That said, this one is a superior cooker, it is superior at cleaning. It is absolutely beautiful to look at. I love the square basket. The handle and attachment mechanism is much better designed.But I must say, if Cosori updated the controls, I'd buy a new one and pass this onto someone else. It's that annoying.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm not a great cook, but the air fryer is pretty fool proof. There are a few things that catch me off guard when I use it though:1. The temperature only goes up in intervals of 10, so if directions tell you to cook at 375 you have to either go 370 or 380 and adjust cooking times. Not a huge deal, but still a little off-putting if you aren't cooking savvy.2. Cleaning the product is kind of weird. I'm very careful about keeping things clean, and this airflow fryer tests me each time. There are these little air hole/vents on the part you pull out. Whenever I soak the basket to make sure I can get everything off while damaging the basket coating as little as possible. When I go to clean the basket and drawer, little food particulates end up stuck inside. It takes a lot of poking and prodding to get everything out. There are screws holding everything in place, so in theory you could take it apart to clean, but who wants to take something apart each clean?Aside from that the air fryer itself works wonders. I've made a couple of chicken dishes that turned out wonderful, crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Pre-made things are good too, like store bought sweet potato fries from Trader Joe's. I received this as a gift, but I would have little hesitation buying it for myself again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 21, 2019
CommentsContent: Bought this because the wife had been wanting an air fryer and this was the deal of the day during Prime Day. Figured that because of a ll the great reviews there wouldn't be a problem and it would work great. It BURNED and DRIED OUT eveything we tried cooking in it. Followed the directions and the receipes exactly and it burned and dried out all the food prepared in it. Waste of monmey and food. Highly disappointed and returning it immediately. Screw the whole healthy thing, at least my Fry Daddy doesn't burn and dry out the food.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 17, 2020
CommentsContent: BEWARE! I received the smart air fryer two days ago and every single time i used it, smoke comes out from the sides and smells like burning plastic.I reached out to Cosori customer service through email because you can’t get ahold of them through the phone and sent them a video of the problem. They have an automated message reply to me. I replied and the same exact automated message would reply back. This is ridiculous.I DO NOT want my kitchen to catch fire.Horrible customer service. Beware of this fire hazard

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2021
CommentsContent: Easy to use. Wish it had quick time buttons in addition to the convenient food buttons. I made a rack from stainless steel grid (amazon $12 see photo. Mesh 05, 60cm x 29 cm. Must cut down and bend) for tortillas etc. We love it.  .....BTW this is NOT a star trek food replicator. It uses a heating element and a fan to cook food fast which produces moist hot air and sometimes steam depending on what you're cooking. The steam has to go somewhere. I haven't had much dripping or pooling under this unit but when compared to my grease fryer this is easy to clean. If you find an air fryer that doesn't release moist hot air 'steam', it's either not plugged in or is secretly a star trek food replicator. ;).  PS: Please post link if u find a replicator.

CommentsTitle: Great Air Fryer and Customer Service
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: This is our first air fryer and it was purchased as a Christmas gift. It is incredibly simple to clean and the design and look of the air fryer is very sleek and fit in with our kitchen very well. I found using it to be very simple and the preset buttons seemed to work great.After a few weeks of use the fan in the air fryer stopped turning on essentially turning this thing into a big toaster. I contacted Cosori about the issue and within 24 hours they got back to me and after a few photos and videos for troubleshooting I received notice that a new air fryer was being sent to my house from the company. We received our new replacement air fryer in a few days and so far it is working great. It was nice to have a company so quickly respond and rectify the situation.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Amazon replaced the air fryer and the new one works. This is the best invention since the microwave!!! We use it at least 3 times a week for corn on the cob and carrots.  It makes egg rolls taste even better since there is no grease!!!!!!!Half the buttons did not work. The preheat button would not turn blue.  Everytime we opened the drawer the fryer turned off. I purchased this because of the great reviews but I am extremely disappointed.  I will be returning this product!!!!!!

CommentsTitle: Melted Itself and the handle snapped off.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 5, 2019
CommentsContent: Loved it at first, yay air fryer, super convenient. Pretty much used it instead of the oven for about 3 weeks. Then one day while cooking some chicken, 400 degrees for 13 minutes, pulled the sliding hopper out and the entire thing fell off the handle. Luckily didn't burn myself as I freaked myself out and then upon examining the basket and all... the screws heated up so much so that they melted through. Nasty messy. Refunding it, because the manufacturer wants to try and 'troubleshoot' yeah, let's troubleshoot plastic melting and the thing self-destructing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I love my air fryer. It cooks most things in about 40-50% less time than a conventional oven. It basically is a mini convection oven but it is extremely  efficient and leaves your food crispy but not over cooked. I’ve made multiple potato recipes that come out great (a mid size potato takes maybe 25 minutes to bake through) and chicken comes out great, cooked fully but not dried out at all. I also love cooking vegetables in this thing! A tiny spray of oil and a shake half way through and that’s it! The fryer is large so you can fit a fair amount of food at a time in it. It has a release button that is covered by a plastic slide so you don’t accidentally release it while it’s hot lol which I thought was a nice touch. It does not make your kitchen hot like an oven, it’s fairly quiet and fits on a countertop. I find myself rarely using my regular oven unless it’s a larger item I can’t fit in my air fryer. Plus you can find literally thousands of recipes online!IMPORTANT!!Make sure to read instructions fully and run the air fryer on preheat before using! You might notice a smell that will potentially transfer to your food. I ran mine twice and the smell went away. I’ve read reviews where people say their food tasted like burnt plastic and that’s because they did not do this step!

CommentsTitle: Why did I wait so long?!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2021
CommentsContent: I resisted buying an air fryer for a couple of years because I really didn’t want another kitchen gadget that was just going to collect dust after a week of use. Well, no worries there! I use it at least once a day now, sometimes twice a day. The basket is super easy to clean and I find no need to put it in the dishwasher, even though they say you can. I never used to understand the big deal about wings, but decided to make some for my husband and son...Holy cow! Wings are great in this. The skin is crispy and the chicken is juicy. I love making cubed butternut squash as well as potatoes...both white and sweet. Asparagus is perfect. I like that the Cosori has a square basket and allows you to fit more in than a round basket. The presets are great and easy to use. Overall...I couldn’t be happier with my purchase!

CommentsTitle: The best Air Fryer in the market
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2019
CommentsContent: I am glad I got this Air Fryer from Cosori. At first I was hesitant to get it because I didn’t know the brand and I never owned any products from Cosori. The customer reviews convinced me to get it and I am happy I did. I love everything about it, the size, the square basket, very spacious inside, it’s smart, well made and doesn’t feel cheap. It is a good product. It cooks food thorougly and even. I have been using this baby everyday ever since I got it. I think this is even better than the Panasonic Air Fryer plus that one is over priced.Anyway, I realized that Cosori makes good products. I hope this Brand/Company will last forever and will be known and popular like Kitchenaid, Cuisineart, etc. I just ordered my 2nd Cosori product, which is their pressure cooker, I am excited and I can’t wait to get it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 22, 2020
CommentsContent: so I bought this air fryer at the recommendation of my sister who lives in London( she swears by it). I followed all the inst etc but noticed I had to push the buttons a couple of times before it would register and work, when it did it was amazing, food tasted good, chicken was moist, fish was good, fries  omg anyway you get the picture. Of course I had to show my sister on facetime. she was the one who told me there was something wrong  and that the buttons should be more responsive. I called customer service, they were brilliant, very accommodating, and shipped me a new one within two days! Great product, great customer service.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2019
CommentsContent: I was very excited about this purchase. After approximately 6 uses it began to smoke. Of course it was 1 day after the return window.....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2019
CommentsContent: I like the design. It looks so beautiful on my countertop. The basket is big enough for a medium size chicken so there is plenty of space. A recipe book also comes with the package which saves me lots of time. There are 5 cooking modes and a preheat setting and I can control the machine through the app, which enables me to plan for meals.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2021
CommentsContent: Amazing top tier air frier, price is worth it as I bought a cheaper brand on here that was a nightmare to clean. I eventually tossed the old one and got this.Cooks everything from freezer food to bread/baked goods. Now gets more use than my oven. Cheese, grease nothing sticks to this air fryer. I handwash and have no issues easily getting anything stuck to the basket off with a normal plastic brush scrubber in a couple mins. I don't think it's dishwasher safe but don't know for sure as I have never needed to do that..No more baking soda vinegar scrub downs for hrs that barely get my fryer clean. Tons of settings and a wifi mode (not that I use that very much). Boyfriend and a couple family members have bought them. Highly recommend corsiar brand, they have been what I was looking for for years!

CommentsTitle: Amazing unit.....COSORI vs. Nuwave which is better?
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Ok Air Fryer Ladies and Gent, I am actually doing this review over as I have not had this product for about 2 months. This review will over this unit and the Nuwave Air fryer just in case you were thinking of getting it. I had that one for about a year and a half.First the Nuwave, It cooks very well. You get accurate cooking times and does a nice job of getting items crisp. HOWEVER, there are a few MAJOR CONS. The first and in my opinion a deal breaker for me. The Basket. The basket not only breaks all the time meaning when you go to close the door it will not it has issues closing. There are times I must let the unit cool then it will finally close. Not the greatest when you have to open it to shake the items but then can't close it for an hour. The company would not help at all they said buy a new basket….lol. The 2nd is cleaning it. Let us just assume the door had no issues. Cleaning it is a nightmare. Any sponge will either get stuck in the grooves or just not clean well. You can put in the dish Washer but who wants to do that after each time? Result DO NOT BUY THISCOSORI  - 5.8Cooks a little longer than the Nuwave but by a few min. Honestly, once you get used to the timings it’s a breeze. Cleaning. OMG so easy I use this 2 or 3 times a week its that easy to clean. Less than 5 min to clean. My honest opinion, best Air Fryer ever. I will say this. Chicken Wings on the Nuwave comes out a tad better but it’s just not worth the hassle. Trust me.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2019
CommentsContent: It looks very fancy. Coming with user manual and recipes, very thoughtful and friendly for a beginner user. Good for 2-3 ppl. It’s my first step towards a healthier lifestyle. Remember to remove the plastic and paperboard inside before use. Can’t wait to have my first meal cooked by it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I was pretty skeptical about buying an air fryer.  When they first came out I laughed and thought they would be a novelty for a year and then folks would move on.  It's been a few years and I decided to pull the trigger.  Lots of research and I landed on the Cosori.  This thing is big and holds a lot.  Everything I have made so far has been great.  Broccoli, salmon, burgers, chicken - you name it.  I really love cooking Salmon in this thing.  Turns out perfect every single time. And I avoid heating up the house using the oven.  It's less shiny plastic looking if you want to leave it out on the counter.  Pretty easy to clean as well.  This thing is a game changer, kicking myself for not buying it sooner.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   We bought the Cosori Air Fryer this year (2020) in March. We use it about 2-3 times a month. Today November 16 after trying to make some tots it would not stay shut thus making it inoperable. The lock latch function is poorly engineered and I’m afraid to force it or hold it shut

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2021
CommentsContent: Literally has changed the way I/we eat. I eat steaks at home now ($5 ribeyes from the grocery store) that tastes great! Way different than the bland taste from the oven. hard to explain why, but there is a big difference. Plus, we do the frozen Kroger burgers and they're great as well. No after-taste, and just basic burger tastes as it should. But putting the bun on top for the last 30 seconds or so makes the difference as well, kind of crispy, warm bun with mayo, lettuce, etc and it's a THOUSAND times cleaner and easier to make than the skillet, where grease goes everywhere, plus the waste of time it takes on stove. As they all say, the fries are DIFFERENT than when in oven, way better, the wya they taste at the restaurant, but better.This from a live-long drive thru and take out person. We've literally eaten more, and way better, and cheaper, at home in past month than ever. It's easy to give up 10-15 minutes to make a meal, vs the stove or oven where it takes prep, hour or whatever, then cleanup, not happening with me. Never use my oven, mainly because after all that work it never tasted good. Eveyrthing they say is true, it tastes different, and is really quick. frozen burgers and crinkle fries together at once, in 10 minutes - you're eating! and crinkle fries tastes the way crinkle fries in deep fryer tastes, but no grease. I don't even use the spray or anything, they still taste great to me!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2019
CommentsContent: Waited way too long to finally invest in an air fryer. Did tons of research which eventually led me to this baby. Perfecto! Reasonable footprint. Quiet. Simple to operate. Quick to clean. And mostest bestest part: the air fried foods are IN-SANE!!P.S. I ordered the version w the app although the assumed it was unnecessary. SO glad I did; we use the app most of the time we air fry.

CommentsTitle: Very easy to use, easy to clean. Tasty food in minutes.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2019
CommentsContent: I didn't think I was going to be a big fan of air fryer until this product changed my opinion!  I thought air fryers are just for fried chicken, but actually, this item can be used to cook all kinds of food.  No matter it's steak, fish, wings, or even veggies.  Just put it in and let it be - it will become ready in minutes.  The cooked food tastes pretty similar to actual grilled food, but the clean up is much easier than a grill, and also air frying is much healthier than grilling.  Attached photo is air fried sea bass!  I use this item all the time now, recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Cleaned, plugged in, prepared to use. Turned on to see that 8 buttons are broken including the preheat and temp/time buttons. Only a few of the preset buttons are working. I've seen other reviews about how their first fryers arrived defective until they contacted customer support and got sent a new one. It should arrive working the first time. I will update after I contact them.UPDATE:It arrived in original packaging and taped up, similar to the first. Buttons work fine, however, the bottom of the air fryer does not completely push in or close, letting steam out the front. I've included pictures showing steam being released. If I push the handle in and hold it, the gap closes and steam is released from the back like it should. I believe it is a problem with the latch. The review will remain 1 star until I get one with no defects.UPDATE 2:I decided to keep it for a few days to test and see if the gap at bottom of the air fryer that was releasing steam would affect the product. To my dismay, in the middle of cooking chicken strips, the air fryer basket dislodged and shot across my counter, almost scattering my food around the kitchen. I looked in horror as the hot basket lay on my newly refurbished counter before quickly grabbing it and placing it on a heat resistant surface, wondering how, had I not been there watching intently, the damage could have been catastrophic. I am furious and I believe that receiving a faulty product twice, with the second one almost causing damage to my property and food, is not acceptable. Do not buy this product.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: so this is the second one i had to order because the first one was defective, only 3 of the buttons worked, i had to order a second one which incidentally cost me $30 more than the original one I bought- called to ask why there was a price difference and could it be matched since the fact that the one I ordered did not work so I was not at fault and shouldn’t have to pay more to replace the defective one only to be told the original  was cheaper because Amazon sold me a used/previously returned one without any mention of the fact that it was either used or previously returned- I absolutely would not have bought used cookware , and would have been right to not do so because it did not work !Had i not called to find out why there was such a price difference between the new one and old one when they are both sold by the same seller (which happens to be Amazon ) -or had it worked - I would not have even known they sold me a used!!!! itemsupremely annoyed,it’s only the first day with the replacement but so far all the buttons work - hopefully it continues to do soupdating:the new air fryer works wonderfully, if I didn’t have to go through hoops to get a working one,  and the customer service (of amazon) had been better I would have given it a 5 star

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2019
CommentsContent: I’m not happy with the results, it burns your food, the cookbook is pointless, just a beautiful pictures and nothing more. Regular oven the best, this one is bad. I don’t recommend to but!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2019
CommentsContent: Easy to clean,use,cook everything really saves timeAm a PhD student who loves to cook but unfortunately I don’t have enough time to practice my cooking hobby but with COSORI airfryer the recipes that used to take an hour or more in the oven just take half of the time and with yummmmmi and healthy results.I’ve attached some of my dishes that i used COSORI to prepare them also I bought the accessories of the machine gonna use the skewers to go some Kabab.Can’t wait😁Thaaank you ♥️ for this smarty invention and cost-effective machine .

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 23, 2020
CommentsContent: This Cosori was purchased as a gift.  I own one exactly like it.  I have had it for about a year and haven't used my oven for a long time.  I have been able to enjoy fried chicken without the mess of cooking it or the guilt of eating it.  It is excellent for frozen potatoes as it is fast and makes them crispy like they were deep fried but not grease.  Fish is tasty and moist.  I really haven't found anything that doesn't cook easier and taste better in any other way. Crispy on the outside and moist and juicy on the inside.  I highly recommend this fryer as it is efficient and easy to use.  Cleaning is a breeze.  When I dish up I fill it with hot soapy water and by the time I've finished eating it requires a swish and it is clean.  So happy I purchased it.

CommentsTitle: Nice air fryer - little knob that would lock the removable drawer seem to wear off in time though
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2020
CommentsContent: Ease of use - well, I had to train myself to not press the power button again, which is very easy to do thinking that it is how you would start the machine. No, you need to press the button once to turn the machine on, and then press 'play' button above. At first, my hand will automatically turn the machine off instead of starting the air fryer cycle :)Functionality-wise, it is very good. Have no complaint so far.One thing I have noticed wit the drawer latch - drawer is secured by a little knob at the bottom which will find its place when you push it in. Over time, this will wear off and the drawer will not fit - and the air fryer will not turn on without it closed all the way. Called COSORI and they sent me a replacement - which did not yet develop same issue.Looking at the design though, that plastic knob looks like it will eventually wear off and will cause same issue.

CommentsTitle: We love the flavor and texture of the food
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2020
CommentsContent: I have used this air fryer at least once a day since purchasing. My family loves the grilled cheese, fried potatoes, crispy chicken, french fries, donuts, and onion rings. We are a family of 6 and it is often difficult to make enough meat at one time with even cooking. It is difficult to clean properly and get all of the oil out of the slats in the basket. I have used the dishwasher but was not satisfied with how clean it got. I will continue to hand clean after soaking in hot soapy water.We are very impressed with the flavor and moistness of the food we cook. I would love a rack for 2 layers of cooking and a better way to clean but overall love this product

CommentsTitle: BEST Kitchen appliance I've bought in a long long time!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2019
CommentsContent: I LOVE MY AIR FRYER.  I've only had it a couple of weeks but I've already made so many things.... Air fried apple pies, roasted vegetables, chicken tender.... I'm currently cooking my second rotisserie chicken in it.  I've never done roasted vegetables in the middle of the week... thats USUALLY a weekend thing due to time.  But with my air fryer I can dice up some potato's, carrots.. anything... and put in my air fryer with a few spritzes of olive oil and some kosher salt for about 15 min and BAM.  I throw my sons popcorn chicken and fries in there together for about 10 min and BAM. I love it.  I'm soooo glad I bit the bullet and ordered it. I honestly was worried thinking I'd never use it but I've used it more in the last 2 weeks than I've used my oven in the last month.  A GREAT PURCHASE

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I habe been using the Cosori for a couple of weeks now and it was worth ever penny.  Great size, which was a must for me.  So far I have made fries (frozen), many chicken thighs and many, many chicken wings.  the Chicken thighs are so good, I find myself now craving them.  I spray them with a little oil, season with italian seasoning, salt and pepper, cook at 400 for about 15-20 mins and they come out delicious.  Skin gets as crispy as frying and juicy meat.  15-20 mins is decent speed for cooking bone-in thighs thoroughly.  Today I reheated wings I made yesterday and they were as crispy and juicy as fresh.  This is my first air-fryer, so i have a sample size of 1....but it is really hard for me to imagine other air fryers performing much better than this.  Clean up is a breeze, like most things, if you get to it when it's still hot.  Use pre-heat feature before cleaning if you want to put it off until after dinner.

CommentsTitle: Excellent even fast cooking and looks good on the counter
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Overall I love this air fryer, I use it almost every single day.  It's so easy and fast to use compared to the oven, and it really makes food crisp.  I would've given it 5 stars, except for 2 things - the way the tray pulls out is a little clunky, you have to yank it out, it's not as smooth as it could be.  And if you tip it down the oil drips out the bottom of the drawer onto the counter which seems like is a fail somehow.  I had a smaller one before and I loved it but it wasn't big enough to make food more than 1 person so I upgraded to this one, but that one did not have these issues.  I would still not trade it in for another one because the overall cooking is great and looks very nice on the counter.  I use it to "re-heat/re-fry" fried chicken and it comes out better than when you first pick it up from the store, not to mention healthier because the oil drips out of it and it's less greasy.  I also love cooking artichokes in it, ready in 15 minutes, and I've never known how easy it can be.  Air-frying raw chicken breasts (not frozen) takes about 20-25 minutes and I've fit 2 huge size breasts in it to cook together, no oil needed, skin is crisp and meat is super juicy.  Fresh fries with just spray oil and salt, ready in 20 mins.  Brussel sprouts 15 mins.  Crisp turkey bacon and hash browns for breakfast 12 mins.  This white one also comes with extra tray and metal skewers so you can make your own meat or veggie skewers.  Everyone I've cooked for here is pleasantly surprised how well the food comes out and wants their own, so highly recommended.  The drawer is dishwasher safe so very easy to clean.One reminder is that it does put out a lot of heat, so you have to pull it away from your backsplash and other appliances when it's cooking.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2020
CommentsContent: if you can't tolerate the smell of burnt plastic/metal all over your house then don't buy it. The smell well make you want to gag. I check everything and took the thing apart the best I could to find the cause of the burnt smell but I didn't find anything. I concluded maybe it is the coil itself. Anyway I leave it out in the patio and I cook outside too. The good part is the food does not absorb the burnt plastic/metal smell. the latch on the pan basket need a better design. Sometime it feel like I am going to break it wen trying to putting it back to the fryer.Update. 7/20.  Okay the metal/plastic smell been gone for months now.  Maybe it is when  fan blow the hot air thru the vent it also heated up whatever it was.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm very happy with this air fryer. I dragged my heels on buying one because I'm always buying kitchen gadgets and then never using them. I researched different styles and sizes watching YouTube videos and came up with this. I'm glad I got the 5.8QT. It's just my husband and I and the smaller size would have been to small for us as I'm cooking meals in it. I love how I can make a full meal in it. The pic I've included in this review I used a precooked chicken sausage sliced up, green beans, red peppers and red onions. Put in a bowl and I sprayed with olive oil spray. Then added salt, pepper and garlic powder and mixed it all together and dumped into the air fryer basket. Set at 390 for 12 minutes and shake every 3 minutes or so. I put in all on some fettuccine but rice works too. I also do this with shrimp or chicken strips and vary my seasonings. The only thing I've noticed is this is very powerful so I have to watch my cooking times and temps since I'm still learning. When done I put some soap and hot water to soak anything stuck for a few minutes. I put the basket part in the top rack of my dishwasher. So easy to clean!

CommentsTitle: Nice fryer, expands the gamut of your cooking
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: There is so much more we can do in our kitchen now that we have this air fryer. Bacon without the fuss and muss?  - yep. Fish and Chips? check. more than decent dries? check. (although nothing beats proper homemade traditional fries...) crispy fish for fish tacos? darn right.  relatively easy to use and super easy to clean. the Wifi thing is a bit of a gimmick but the recipes are nice and useful. the plastic on our drawer is coming off a little.. not affecting usability but reminding you this is a sub $100 appliance made in china. the button are a little cheesy too.. Not a big deal, just don't think you'll pass this on to the next generation. Overall a fun and useful addition to our kitchen. Oh try the bacon wrapped cream cheese stuffed jalapeño peppers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I've been wanting an air fryer for some time but have never found one that had good reviews AND a good price.  I took a chance with this when it came up for a sale price on the Amazon Treasure Truck, and I'm glad I did!This doesn't take up a lot of space on the counter.  It's square so you can fit more food into the pan too.  The digital controls on the front basically make this thing idiot proof, but a fair warning, the times on these settings will overcook your food.  I usually start with their setting and back down on the time and temp settings until I get it just the way I like it.  You can prepare an entire dinner right inside the basket.  It comes with a cookbook to get you started too.Clean up is easy.  Just put it in the sink and fill it with warm dish soap water and let it sit while you have dinner.  Then just wipe it out and it's done!This is great for the busy life that we all lead these days.  It makes eating a healthy, home-cooked meal quicker than running out and getting fast food.I am definitely a fan of this unit!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent: Update: December 2020 - Cosari reached out to me because of this review and after an email exchange they refunded me what I paid for the unit as an Amazon gift card because it was under warranty. Actually they offered me the choice of a refund or to put me on the list to send me a replacement as soon as they had new stock. Excellent customer service. I then bought the exact same model again (found another one on Amazon) and my new one does not have the issues with the freezing buttons I wrote about in my previous review. So in short I am very happy and am enjoying using the air fryer both through the control panel and the app (and Alexa).------------ Original review ---------------This one was a replacement for one that was a little bit bigger and would not fit where I wanted to stored it and it cooks just as (very) well. I do enjoy playing with the wifi/app control but would be the first to admit that it is a bit of a toy.What is not good and the only reason I am giving it 2 stars instead of 5 is that the buttons are not easy to push and register input. There often seems to be a short lag where it seems like the device is frozen taking the button input. This is pretty annoying as I often have to push a button multiple times to get it to register, even more so when you are changing time/temp so need multiple pushes to register, so I generally prefer to use the phone app to kick it off and adjust it. It is possible that mine is just a hardware dud where the senors for the buttons are misaligned with the buttons display, but that does not explain the input freeze behavior I am experiencing. My girlfriend hates using it and wanted me to return it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the most revolutionary product I have every bought for the kitchen. I use it almost every day. Chicken thighs come out like they are off the grill. They are perfectly cooked. I made amazing catfish with just Creole seasoning and a couple sprays of olive oil. I really like making tortilla chips out of small corn tortillas. I have really nailed that one down.I'm also glad I got the wifi version. At the same price as the non-wifi it really is a no-brainer. What I like about this feature is you can watch how much time is left on your phone in case you need to shake the basket. You can also select one of the recipes on the app and hit start cooking and it will do the rest.Very easy to clean and doesn't take up as much space as I thought it would. I'm also glad I got a larger basket. It can hold a whole chicken and 6 chicken thighs without them touching.

CommentsTitle: Cosori Air Fryer: Where cooking is a Pleasure!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2019
CommentsContent: This remarkable new Air Fryer is a must for every household.  If you love the crunch of fried foods, or the ease of cooking your favorite meal, this Cosori Air Fryer is for you. Crispy food without all the grease or calories! It come packed with great tasting recipes in their booklet and the ease of operation makes it something you'll use almost daily. Once you try the "fried chicken" or the coconut shrimp, you'll be hooked. Plus there's a support page on Facebook where everyone shares their own recipes, pictures and answers question 'newbies' might have. You'll have so much fun using your new Cosori Air Fryer, you'll wonder why you haven't tried it sooner! Bon Appetite!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2019
CommentsContent: Bought this on prime day not knowing what an air fryer was but just knowing everyone and their mother has one and swears by them. After reading review after review saying “just buy it” I was convinced I NEEDED one in my life. My husband and I have literally cooked in it every single day since purchasing. The first thing I cooked was chopped up potatoes and my mind was blown when they were perfect in 10 minutes. Ever since, we’ve cooked everything from steaks to chicken to veggies to mini pizzas to breakfast sandwiches. It truly is a life changing thing to come home for lunch and just dump some stuff in the basket and have it ready in 10~15 minutes and still have time to enjoy a lunch break for once.I also really like the pre-set options. I noticed other hair dryers just have temp dials and idk how people who aren’t familiar with air fryers would figure that out so it’s nice to be able to just push a button and let ‘er go. The drawer is a little tough to get out at first until you get used to it. And the product photo is a little misleading and makes the screen look more high tech than it is. I posted photos of he actual screen as well as a size comparison photo to my standard stand mixer. We also really are happy with the recipe book it came with. So I have to join the others with saying “just buy it”.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2021
CommentsContent: This is my 2nd air fryer. Loved the concept but hated that my old PowerXL was small...hard to clean...and had a round basket. After knowing what i DID want i found this! Excellent product. Have used non-stop since i received it after T'giving 2020. Easy to clean. Lots of menu selections almost too many. Trial and error. SQUARE BASKET tho? GENIUS! Made (4) 1/2 pound burgers at the same time and were better than grilled and not messy like pan fried! Highly recommend

CommentsTitle: Screw fell out of basket and into our food.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2020
CommentsContent: *Edit: Cosori customer service sent out a replacement basket to replace it without hassle, that bumped my star rating to 2.*Original content:A screw fell out from the basket handle and into the food that was being cooked without us noticing - only by sheer luck did my kid notice it before he bit down.  When I inspected the basket - it was a screw that held the handle to it and it looks like whatever the screw screwed into failed as well because there's nothing there anymore - I was not able to locate the "nut" that held it in place.  I'm filing a report with the CPSC about this.Seriously, it's a very dangerous malfunction.Edit: ....found the nut, thank God.

CommentsTitle: First time user and was impressed
CommentsAuthor: lots of fun, keeps me sharp, love it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I had never had an air fryer and with all the reviews on Facebook I thought I would try this one. It has definitely been a learning curve as far as time to cook certain items. But having said that it is very convenient does not take up much space on my counter and the food in general is quite tasty after being cooked in this. I am retired and there are just two of us here so the size is perfect. I would say that if you have a larger family that this might not be the one you're looking for. I don't know if they make one bigger but they do stand by their product and even if you have a large family you could use it for things like french fries side dishes hamburgers that sort of thing.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2019
CommentsContent: I recently got the air fryer and was excited to try it out. I’ve made chicken wings in it twice. My concern was that the chicken has a very distinct taste, that I’m sure came from the fryer. I washed it before using it and removed all the plastics, but I was totally creeped out by it. I recently tried it again and left some for my wife without mentioning the taste issue to her to see what she said and she had made a similar comment without being prompted, soooooooo I’m probably going to return if for a different brand.On the positive side, it was super easy to use and clean.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I love my 5.8 qt Cosori Air Fryer.  I use it for almost all my meals and was saddened when the top screw fell out of the removable basket.  So I contacted Cosori, they immediately responded asking for some additional information and sent me a replacement basket.  Unfortunately, the basket didn't fit properly, so I emailed them again and immediately Adriana sent me an email telling me that they are sending me another replacement basket. That's customer service!  I forgot to hit the submit button, so now I'm adding a second experience with them.  My unit was purchased on October 19, 2019, and the experience about the lost screw occurred in June of 2020.  Now I'm experiencing the air fryer turning off suddenly, and when I close the basket, it continues cooking for the remaining time.  I wrote Cosori thinking that since it's more than a year old, nothing would happen, but instead after sending them proof of purchase and an ID number, Elijah wrote back and said they are sending me a replacement unit.  I love my air fryer and  use it all the time.  I don't know if I'll have to check to see if I need to tighen the screws that hold the air fryer handle  to the basket, but perhaps they have fixed the issue.  In any case, kudos to Corsori Customer Service.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2019
CommentsContent: I never thought I'd want an air fryer after buying an instapot and never using it more than 2 times before reselling it. That being said, this air fryer life is addicting! Holy cow! My husband keeps volunteering to cook with it too, which he normally never cooked unless it involved a pot of water. He even wants to but a second one and we haven't even owned it for 3 weeks, so we can cook the main meal and a side at the same time. I researched air fryers for a couple months on all different sites and am so happy I chose this one. I was a little unsure because I hadn't heard of the Cosori brand before this bur the reviews were right, this one is awesome.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I chose this air fryer based on my neighbor’s positive experience with hers, and I am very pleased with my purchase. My initial frustration was similar to most users, which was The difficulty in getting the touch screen to respond. It took a handful of tries, but now I never have a problem with the buttons because I learned that the touchscreen only requires a light touch. Most people, myself included, mash buttons on their electronics and this Cosori air fryer does NOT like that. I use my air fryer everyday instead of the oven and get excellent, sometimes even better results! Roasted potatoes and roasted brussel sprouts are way better in the air fryer, compared to my oven. I used the suggested settings in the included Cosori recipe booklet and they come out perfect every time. For cubed, marinated baked tofu, I use the “shrimp” setting and they are a favorite at our house now. However, I prefer to use airfryercalculator.com to manually adjust temperature and time for frozen foods I cook in this air fryer as I found the Cosori presets made the food a bit too fried/crunchy/browned. I usually pick a preset on the air fryer that is closest to the temperature that I want to use and then adjust according to the online calculator. Don’t forget to flip or shake your food half way through cooking! I also love the “keep warm” setting to keep my foods hot and crispy (instead of taking it out and making things soggy) while I finish up the rest of my meal on the stove. Cleaning is very straightforward, and I would also recommend checking the inside heating coil for any food particles that may have blown around during previous cooking to prevent creating a burning smell. I also suggest lining the drawer with aluminum foil before snapping the fryer basket inside to make clean ups even easier. This air fryer is great for the price point and I would certainly recommend this to the rest of my friends, and you too if you’ve read this far =)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I received my air fryer 2/22/2020. I loved the product until yesterday when before I preheated it  I opened the drawer as I always do to make sure its clean and ready to go, it looked great  then after it was preheated I opened the drawer to put the porkchops in there was a screw laying in the basket! I removed the screw and cooked my food anyways. After I was done cooking and the air fryer was cooled I went to clean it and there was another screw laying in the basket!! It looks like it may be just from the handle but still this is ridiculous!!! Not happy!!

CommentsTitle: Who Fries? You Fry, I Fry, We All Fry!!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Okay, I'm very new to air fryers but have wanted one for some time. Finally got one as a gift from my boo. After checking out a video on Youtube, I decided to buy the one the lady in the video was using to air fry fish. Well one night, I decided to fry some fish in that bad boy and it was wonderful. The fish came out delicious and not at all greasy. The boo loved it, I loved it. We loved it. You will love it. The Cosori Air Fryer is also very easy to clean and the baskets are a pretty good size. I put 3 large pieces of Tilapia in there.  I am thrilled I can fry food without worrying about the sound of my arteries clogging and make healthy meals for dinner. I'm in air fryer love!!!! Happy Birthday to me!!!! Thank you baby for the gift. I looveee you!!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I'd heard about air fryers for a while but had never really looked into them before. I always found them to be synonymous with infomercials and didn't really think they could be very useful. Then my wife started talking about how'd she'd been seeing her favorite food bloggers using them and how she thought she might like one.I ended up getting this Cosori for her b-day and it's now her favorite kitchen appliance and mine. We eat a lot of chicken and the air fryer makes the best "fried" chicken I've had and it's so incredibly simple. We typically add nothing but a little salt and press the chicken button and that's it. We've made it for multiple friends and family members and have gotten raving reviews as well. We've also done sweet potato fries, fresh broccoli, cauliflower, eggplant, and a few other veggies, we even tried making some cookies in it.We've transported it on multiple occasions as well, bumping it into things here and there and it's held up incredibly well besides the couple scuffs and scratches. The cleanup is incredible btw, so simple and quick. The nonstick surfaces on the tray make it super easy to quickly scrub and wipe down. One last thing I'll say is that I'm glad we didn't go any smaller than this. It does take up a good chunk of counter space but it's nice being able to do enough in one batch to feed the 2 of us and then have some leftovers as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2019
CommentsContent: touch control panel was defective.  Strong plastic/chemical smell even after running thru dishwasher and wiping.

CommentsTitle: it is surprising how useful this device is in the kitchen
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 15, 2021
CommentsContent: I reluctantly bought this device because my wife insisted she wanted one. Researched showed me this was a good mid-size unit and it had some great features - like Alexa integration. We got it, and I believe we have used it every day in one capacity or another. The normal stuff you would expect - like frying - works well. We found some frozen breaded shrimp that are good, some healthy frozen egg rolls, etc. We never take home left over french fries from a restaurant, but this will perk them (and onion rings) back up to their original flavor. We baked salmon in this device to perfection. Preheat, 8 minutes, let it set for 5 after cooking - and PERFECTION. Reheating bread is amazing. We have a nice Italian restaurant that we will carry out from occasionally. But by the time we get home with the meal, the warm wrapped bread is soggy and yucky. Preheat the Air Fryer for 4 minutes to 360, cook for about 5 minutes, and it is just like it came fresh out of the over.I'm a believer.....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: first off let me say this was the first air fryer I owned. it works as you would expect and I did get a lot of cooking out of it over the year and a half but unfortunately that's no more. I went to pull out the tray after it was pre-heated & out of nowhere the handle melted off from the tray itself I touched it (carefully of course ) to make sure it didn't snap off or I missed used it in some way but the plastic was hot and can see where it began to warp. will follow up if there is a temporary fix to it because it would be really unfortunate to throw away such an expensive kitchen product so quickly.with that said it cook great very easy to use I found that experimenting with the times and temps you will get better results than what was pre-programmed into it didn't use all the functions mainly my own cooking times and temp so all the bells and whistles aren't that important. the cleaning I found to be very annoying the basket is easy and so is the drip tray but the basket walls are where you run into problems you can soak it scrub it spray it but the crevices are so narrow and so many you won't really get it 100% clean & that's okay to an extent because I will know myself that my products aren't completely clean I'm not satisfiedIf I can't fix the product myself then I (WILL NOT) be buying it again unfortunately just for it to happen again.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 12, 2019
CommentsContent: Having owned most of the other brands out there on the market, I must say that this Cosori model is my favorite and the best working of all of them.The non-stick surface is so easy to clean and it even does not stick without adding extra non-stick spray to the surface. The controls are very easy to use and react promptly when touched.There are several features in this air fryer that I have not seen in others. My favorite would be  the frozen food button preset. If you select the frozen food preset you can adjust the time and temperature to your desire for your particular food type. Once you press the start button, the food will begin to cook and halfway through the elapsed time, the machine will beep and remind you to turn the food. This provides for very even cooking. Although I have found that certain items such as chicken wings I did not even have to turn and they browned on both sides efficiently.If you want a great air fryer and don't want to go through 10 other brands before you find one that works for you, I would suggest buy this one first. It really is an awesome air fryer!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2019
CommentsContent: Took over 2 weeks to finally get here.  They say the delivery is scheduled and you have to be here to sign for it.  Guy just randomly showed up and didn't want my signature.  Worked great.  Kids loved the fries and it didn't heat up the house.  Used it for the THIRD time today and it quit in the middle of cooking.  Can't get it to work at all.  Don't waste your money on this piece of crap!!

CommentsTitle: Close it all the before trying to cook.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I liked the size.  I found a fried chicken receipt for an air fryer.  I tried this fried chicken to the letter, but it was disappointing.  At first, after reading the instruactions carefully I started to cook.  I could not get it to turn on.  I tried over and over, but NO success.  I called the number for the hot line for  help.  After holding forever, I finally took my place to be called back.  I never received a call back for help !!  Finally, my grandaughter who is a good cook,  offered to help.  Within a few minutes she had success, it came on and started cooking.  The fried chicken was just OK.  I found out the basket has to be pushed into place before it will start cooking.  NOT IN THE INSTRUCTION BOOK AT ALL.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased this air fryer at the end of October.  I have only used it three times and on the third use it broke.
