I am in contact with the company now and will update this review when the matter is settled.  I did have a 2 year warranty on it.I want to update this review.. Cosori worked fast to resolve my problem and in two days have shipped a new product to me.  You can't ask for better service than that. :)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2020
CommentsContent: The manual explaining how to connect to the mobile app and Alexa is basically, just, wrong! So connectivity wise I'd give it one star. However it fries well, so I'll up my rating to three.To ACTUALLY connect to your app: 1. It does NOT use bluetooth, despite showing a bluetooth icon in the app and saying Bluetooth in the manual. Instead it uses Wifi, so find the Wifi network after pressing the button for 5 seconds. Go from there.You can NOT link to Alexa if you try to, from the app. Despite there being an option for it, and despite the manual saying that's how you do it. You have to start Alexa separately and detect the device from the Alexa app to get them linked. Do NOT start in side the VeSync app, it just ends up redirecting to a non-existent web page... Pretty sad.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 2, 2020
CommentsContent: Ok first of all I never never post any review but I needed to get this off my chest. I have been wanting an air fryer for over a year. I finally decided it’s time and ordered this one, Mind you money is tight, due to COVID and lay off. So I received it and tried multiple recipe and it does what it says but my issue is with handle and the circulator. The handle started to get lose within weeks of use. It’s cheaply made. And the circulator gets dirty and brown, it’s not easy to clean down there. I want my money back or another air fryer!!!!!! This was supposed to be an investment for years to come. I’m not even sure if it’s going to last rest of the 2020. Cheaply made, just stealing people hard earned money! I’m pissed

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2020
CommentsContent: This air fryer is complete garbage. It will stop connecting to the app and the buttons do not work. I have an expensive piece of plasric taking up a ton of space on my countertop and I can’t turn it on. Avoid at all costs.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I've wanted an air fryer for years.  Decided on Cosori because of the reviews and because the basket is square which makes it easier for fitting in more chicken nuggets or wings.  It is truly remarkable and produces fantastic, crisp nuggets, wings and french fries or tater tots.  Cleanup takes seconds!  I do feel the basket is durable, but it's good to know you can easily buy a replacement basket on line for a reasonable cost.  I'm 100% pleased with how easy it is to use, clean and how much of a time-saver it is!

CommentsTitle: Because of the cleaning hassle I will certainly not recommend this product (even if it cooks well)!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my first air fryer which makes me pretty new to the usage.Cooking: I am happy with the outcome.Especially chicken drumsticks/breasts/tenderloins turned out to be extremely juicy and soft.French fries were not that great. Lot of uneven cooking. But may be I added too many in one batch.Since it has a cake as one of the presetting I baked a banana nut bread. The texture was good but I am not very great at baking, so not sure if I am the best judge for this feature.Also tried veggie patty which turned out good crispy on the outside and softer on the inside.Smoke:The back outlet emits too much smoke for each cooking. This makes the whole house smell of food. I have to leave one of windows open always when I am using the air fryer which is not very convenient!Smell:After 3-4 usages I realized along with the smoke their is a particular smell that is emitted. Something like when we reuse fried oil. I have been hand washing and then dishwashing both the containers after each use.I turned the air fryer upside down to check the coil which was pretty much greasy.Cleaning: Extremely extremely difficultTo get rid of the smell I cleaned the coil and the around surface using water and brush. This was extremely difficult because the coil cannot be removed and there is no way to reach the center or anywhere near the fan. So I guess even if I clean the around area of coil the smell issue is still going to be there for me.Because of the cleaning hassle I will certainly not recommend this product (even if it cooks well)!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 5, 2020
CommentsContent: The touch panelyou change the temperature and minutes.is so finicky. Don't waste your time

CommentsTitle: Update to my original review that said:  Smoke detectors set off every time I used it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Update to my original review:  Cosori responded immediately to address my issues. They offered to send me a replacement unit which I had planned to accept. Then I saw my son (who works a very late shift) starting to use the original one I purchased. I explained the problem and he said “Mom, I’ve been using it every night when I get home and no problem!”  So what I experienced must’ve been a startup issue only. I’ve used it several times since and I love it. Easy to clean, easy to use, works just as the instructions state, great taste and again, hats off to Cosori for excellent customer service.Original review:  Three times in a row, including first use (was trying to cook different meats) and it sets off my smoke detectors. I’ve washed and rewashed the baskets, wiped down the inside of the cooking area, checked the heating element visually and see no food or grease spatter. Second and third attempts it didn’t make it through the pre-heat cycle. Cleaned everything again tried once more and with 2 minutes left in pre-heat same result. Can’t use it, planning to return it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I saw my sister-in-law use her two Cosori air fryers and was impressed with how quickly and well they cooked chicken thighs, bacon, and brussel sprouts so I bought one.  I made the best chicken schnitzel of my life with it. And the blackened broccoli that takes 45 minutes in the regular oven is perfect after 8 minutes. So we bought this second one and can make both meat and veggies at the same time. Easy to clean and a delight to use.

CommentsTitle: My mom and I are pleased with this air fryer!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I actually ordered a different air fryer first from another company as a gift for my mom. While I'm sure that model would have been sufficient in it's own right, it turned out not to be quite what she was wanting, so I exchanged it and got this air fryer instead. To my pleasant surprise, it came much faster than I was expecting it would, and we put it to work that same day. We already had an air fryer cookbook (though this unit does come with it's own cookbook too) and made curried brussels sprouts for an after-dinner snack. Today we tried 'fried' cheese curds. Everything was simple and efficient to use (though we did find out that the display turns off when the baskets are removed - but it resumes again as soon as the baskets are reinserted). Clean-up is easy, and the digital display is clear and intuitive. I can see why this is so highly rated on here! I'm excited to see what other recipes we can try in our new gadget. (Next up: sweet potato fries when my aunt comes to visit.) It already has a permanent place of honor on our counter.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Ii had previously written that I was disappointed with my Cosori air fryer because the release button that separates the two baskets wouldn't work. Well, they saw my post and CALLED me! I didn't want to return the fryer (hassle) but they offered to send me two new baskets. I received them and it's like brand new again. Thank you Cosori for caring about customer satisfaction.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I recently had major surgery and a friend came to take care of me until I was able to take care of myself.  My friend knew I was not a good cook (but he is) and said I really needed to get an Air Fryer. It would make my life a whole lot easier and my food would taste better. It's kind of a set-it and forget it thing. I was showed photos of the food he made with his air fryer. Chicken, wings, french fries, pork loin, etc. My Cosoriu showed up the day he left and I have used it almost every day sin ce. (Three weeks) I believe it will prove to be one of the best purchases ever made. My favorite parts are: the pre-heat setting, the beeping reminders to flip the food, the photo buttons that make decisions for me. I have not experienced one problem with it. So easy to use. I am eating better and my food doesn't take as much prep pr cooking time!  How did I live without it?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2020
CommentsContent: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I researched all the air fryers on the market and Cosori consistently came up as the highest rated. Our Cosori arrived last week and when we started it up, none of the buttons on the “touchscreen” worked when we touched them. Nothing. The only way we could work the device was through the app.  Figured it was defective and returned it to Amazon and received my replacement on Thursday. Just fired it up again and the same problem occurred. None of the buttons on the touchscreen work. We can’t turn it on, preheat, change the temperature EXCEPT when using the app.  This can’t be correct. How can this product advertise its easy to use  touchscreen when it doesn’t work?  It’s nice to be able to operate remotely, but I’d prefer to have a fully operational product. Not sure if Amazon has a bad batch of these, but we’ll buy a Ninja or Phillips instead next time.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 13, 2018
CommentsContent: Still getting used to it, Going to try different food types , it cooks real fast ! and pretty even browning, not bad at clean up after use, good for a busy family or a single person ! I have the big one so I can put a lot of things in it !

CommentsTitle: Not the air fryer of your dreams, keep searching
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I'm not sure how this product has so many great reviews. First of all, the design is terrible. The button release is placed very horribly and you're likely to have an accident with it, and it will eventually break because it is cheap thin clear plastic.The pre-heat setting is garbage because after you have preheated it to the temperature you want, you will have to re-enter your cook time and temperature after it's done. It won't remember it. That is very frustrating. Food will either burn or not cook all the way.If you have a lot of patience and money to waste a lot of food to figure out which settings work best for what food, then go ahead and try this. Otherwise look elsewhere because I found it not worth it so far

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I got this air fryer recently and have already used it a ton, it does a spectacular job heating up frozen foods while keeping a good crispy crunchy feel. I’ve tried a few of the recipes in the Cosori cookbook and they’ve all been great! The buttons on the fryer can be a little touchy, but other than that I have no complaints. I love that it’s dishwasher safe and the WiFi connection is nicer than you’d think. Specifically, I like that it sends me notifications when it’s done preheating or time to flip or when the foods ready, it makes it super easy to do other things while you wait for the food. Also, it’s nice to be able to preheat from my room with Alexa. The size of the tray is great too, the bigger the better.  I’ve cooked in a few other air fryers and It can be difficult to get a good cook with the smaller ones, and it’s certainly difficult to cook for more than one or two people in the smaller ones. I’d definitely recommend this fryer to anyone who wants a bit of a nicer fryer and with WiFi control as a bonus!

CommentsTitle: Basket popping out while using, and even not using
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 27, 2020
CommentsContent: Product is great as far as cooking goes. Problem is basket always pops out. First when I got it just a couple of times. Now I have to put a weight  in front of it to keep it closed while I’m cooking. Totally at loss for words As to why I can’t cook on manual now that wi-fi is setup. Buttons don’t work.Anyway, since I forgot to hit send, “was wondering why I never received a response,” I’ll add this now: The other day, forgot to put weight in front of basket. Basket popped out again putting dinner on floor, AND TINY BITS OF PLASTIC BROKE OFF! Dented pan. Food had to be thrown away. I know I can’t send it back now because it is dented and chipped, If you want an air fryer that cooks good this is it!!! IF YOU DON’T mind the dents and chips you’ll get and going the “extra mile “ to ensure it doesn’t pop out. Or having a back up plan for dinner should your dinner end up on the floor and it was “JUST ABOUT READY”, THEN THIS IS THE ONLY FRYER YOU WILL EVER NEED UNTIL YOU GET FED UP WITH LOSING WHAT WS GONNA BE A GOOD DINNER

CommentsTitle: OMG THIS THING IS AWESOME ~ KETO AVOCADO FRIES?!!! YUMMY
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   OMG THIS THING IS AWESOME ~ KETO AVOCADO FRIES?!!! YUMMYVery happy that we went with the larger unit, and the first thing we cooked was an Avocado Parmesan crusted Jo-Jo style fry.  These were awesome!Will be using this much more in our house!So much better than a deep fryer!*In the recipe book it called for flour and breadcrumbs... I substituted and just used an egg wash, and grated Parmesan cheese... #Keto4Life

CommentsTitle: All the screws came off and won’t retighten
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this in late October.About two months ago the screws started getting loose, I would retighten. As of two weeks ago two screws would no longer tighten and the basket stayed with one screw. Well tonight that screw randomly popped off while taking out my food and the baskets separated. Very annoying because some of my food fell. It’s only been a few months and I barley use it. Broke way to soon and this air fryer is expensive. So not worth it.

CommentsTitle: Great air fryer and so much better designed than others we've tried.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I replaced a larger air fryer with this one. Just from an engineering perspective -- this COSORI air frier is far and away a better option. The two-basket design which allows you to separate the inner basket from the outer one is so much more intelligent than the air fryer I had previously purchased which relied on an insert to keep food up and off the bottom of the basket. But the insert was removable and relied on seemingly nonfunctional silicon spacers which proved useless after only a few uses. You'd try to shake the basket to re-distribute food, and the insert would come loose requiring you to manually remove all of the food, and then re-seat the floor (bottom) of the basket. With the COSORI, the inner basket is completely removable from the outer basket making serving so much more convenient and when "shaking" the two baskets they stay together allowing for an easy redistribution of the food. Such a clean design. Easy to wash. Wow. If you've ever wanted to try out having an air fryer, I'd suggest you try this on first. Love a good product. Dislike rip off under-performers that cost me time and money returning them. ALSO -- COSORI actually provides contact info and encourages you to use it in case you are having any kind of problem with their unit. That's customer service!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I read reviews and watched a few videos on different Air Fryers to see what the pros and cons where.  Decide on the Cosori 5.8 Qt for size, versatility and cost.  We tried it out for the first time to cook sweet potatoes and then turkey burgers without cleaning the fryer.  Following the cook book that came with it word for word, they came out amazing.  The burgers where full of juice when you cut into them.  It was way easier than ever to use and clean up was simple.  I can't believe how much cleaner the kitchen was compared to using a a cast iron skillet or traditional deep fryer.  We are excited to try so many different meals and options in the new Air Fryer.  We are a family of 5 and to make meals we may need to cook in it twice, however, it's that easy to prepare the foods and then cook them.  I would definitely recommend this Air Fryer to anyone think of getting one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 4, 2020
CommentsContent: My hubby and I just air fried our first steak filet mignon! We are excited & looking forward to eating Salmon, fish, chicken and veggies in our new Cosori Air Fryer...we absolutely love it! Easy cleaning too....I did order parchment paper that you can use in the air fryer and a silicone dish that can also be used in the air fryer, have not used as of yet! It also came with a rack and 5 skewers for kabobs! Yay!!! Cant wait!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2020
CommentsContent: What can I say...so far I love this air fryer. I have used it to make Crunchy Breaded Pork Chops and they were delicious and took half the time and were way healthier than frying in oil. In fact we haven't had anything fried in years but with this fryer it looks like my husband will be getting his old favorites back. Not only does it have the benefit of healthy dining but it takes less than half of the power it would take to use the conventional stove top or oven. I am pleasantly pleased and wish I had bought one sooner.

CommentsTitle: Good but could be Great if it weren't for flaws
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2021
CommentsContent: I have had the Cosori Air Fryer XL for almost a year now.Pros: makes great food (chicken wings, fries, fish, potatoes, Brussel sprouts, steak, pork chops, kabobs). That's what I've made in there several times and love it. Easy to clean. Food comes out very flavorful, not dry, nor full of grease like with fried foods.Con: The outside began chipping a few months after using. The largest con however is the screw that keeps coming loose and has now completely fallen out from the handle, which is a huge safety hazard when handling this product hot. Wish there was a way I could get that part or even the whole basket replaced. The chipping and screws coming loose, I took 2 stars away!

CommentsTitle: Best Air Fryer EVER...  AND CUSTOMER CARE
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 26, 2020
CommentsContent: This is one of the best purchases I’ve made with Amazon! The Cosori air fryer 5.8 itself is truly wonderful!! I was afraid of bone in chicken breast drying out because I cooked them longer than suggested-they were large, but they were crispy and juicy!! My Son would not eat chicken breast from ANYWHERE bc he felt they were ALWAYS DRY, BUT he has changed his mind since using The COSORI AIR FRYER!! We’ve even roasted vegetables in it and they’re beautiful and tasty!! But it is the company’s CUSTOMER SERVICE that makes this purchase even better!! I had an issue with the basket coming apart from the base, I contacted the company prepared to argue the issue and was in complete surprise when no defense customer interaction took place!! They replied professionally and ALWAYS courteous!! They definitely understand that follow up is very important in customer satisfaction!!!!

CommentsTitle: cooks slow and a little noisy
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2019
CommentsContent: Good price and all attachments and two year warranty....but my wife uses it. we had another brand that we gave away that worked great as a gift. we were going to buy the one on tv, but after reading reviews we found out they were junk and did not cook well.  This one cooks slower with a little noise, sounds like a dishwasher...we will keep using it maybe what ever is rolling around inside it will stop..they are all made in china, might be a stowaway?? update fix the noise. heating coils on bottom were touching, caused rattle when running, took screwdriver and pried the two apart slightly.

CommentsTitle: It’s big enough for a family of 6
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I was so in need of an air fryer! At first I thought this is to fancy for me, I mean why do I need it to have WiFi?!  So I got it earlier than Amazon said (bonus) I tried to set up the WiFi and it wouldn’t sync! After 15 minutes of trying I lost patience ( I just need it to cook) it cooked everything to perfection!The best thing about this Air fryer is it cooks enough fries for 6 ppl at a time at 5.8 qt’s! I also cooked 3 chicken breasts at a time!Downsides (outside of WiFi set up), it’s hard to operate when trying to open and separate the basket from the bottom. It’s also hard to put back together.  My teens (house full of boys) and husband will tear it up trying to use it because of the handling. The air fryer before this one was super simple.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2020
CommentsContent: Air Fryer stops a few minutes in and won’t restart. We unplug it and let it cool and after it resets, it’s starts cooking for a short period and stops. This has been a chronic problem for the month we have it but the problem keeps getting worse. The features and performance are great when it works, however it never works.

CommentsTitle: Touchpad only works half the time
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2020
CommentsContent: The fryer works great - once you get it started.  Like many others have stated, the touch pad is highly unresponsive and only certain buttons work - if you touch it just the right way.  Most of the time I just control it with the app, but not everyone in my household is tech savvy enough to download the app and control it this way.I do like the app. It is handy to be able to start it from another room, or monitor the cooking time that is left.As far as the taste and easy of cleaning, I think it does these things well.  I just wish I had went with an air fryer that has real buttons or dials.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2019
CommentsContent: Love, love, love our air fryer. My spouse who is not a cook loves the fryer so much he has actually planned dinners, looked up recipes, and went grocery shopping for home cooked meals.  I came home from a long trip and was treated to a delicious steak dinner..The steak was juicy and tender and just delicious. It's user friendly and affective. Our food has never over cooked. Were recommend you check the food half way thru to check for doneness. It has a pause button so you can check the food.  Clean up is easy as well. We chose this air fryer because of the size and amount of food it can hold. There will be a little noise like air circulating but it's not overwhelming and doesn't bother us at all.  Happy with our air fryer and would recommend as an alternative to using the oven or frying pan

CommentsTitle: Good Air Fryer with a few weak spots
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2020
CommentsContent: If you haven't tried Air Frying yet, you'll be pleasantly surprised by how versatile and easy to use these things are. This is a good sized fryer with some nice presets for commonly cooked items.Outside of a few things for baking, I've avoided the oven and cooked up some great meals with this fryer. From chicken breasts to crispy hash brown patties, you can cook up quite a variety and avoid unwanted grease.The unit is easy to clean.There is one big negative though - the buttons on the front are HORRIBLE. You power it up by pressing the power button repeatedly in the hopes that somehow your next push is the special one that makes it come on. Often you're doing it so rapidly at that point and switching fingers that you double clutch and turn it on and OFF again only to have to try again.Some of the presets work every single time, but other times you have to jam on them and I have yet to figure out how to get it to respond to manually setting the temp/time with the buttons.In comes the app, right?  Well, yeah, sort of.  It works fine if you want to use your phone and the app, however one huge flaw here is that you can only have 1 phone connected to it. So much for sparing everyone in the house the agony of using the sketchy buttons.  The minute someone else added the fryer it disconnected my device.Outside of those nuances, I think it is a great appliance and I've certainly gotten my use out of it. I wish they'd offer a way to improve on my button pushing game before my finger breaks off.

CommentsTitle: Screws fall out into your food!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ve only had this air fryer for a month and a half... already had to put two screws back in on the basket which fall out in the food. Well I didn’t notice that another screw came out when I made salmon for a salad and I crunched on this screw tonight!!!!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2021
CommentsContent: Did a lot of research prior to purchasing this air fryer and man I am happy!!  Funny enough, my 2 bestest girlfriends also bought the same AF too, but I got the white.  Which, do not let the white stray you away, it is very easy too clean.  I love everything I have cooked in this.  Their customer service is amazing.  My basket had a problem with popping out, which apparently is common.  I contacted them and with proof of purchase and some photos of the AF itself, they send me a new basket.  I also follow a FB group for well Cosorians and it is great. I definitely, without a doubt recommend this.  Btw, I also have their newest Air Fryer/Oven and it is awesome as well.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I especially wanted to write this review, because I got mine and it didn’t seem to close well from the beginning. Wasn’t flush on the sides. I thought well I just have to close it firmly. The first time I preheated, 2 minutes in, the drawer flung out. Hmmm I put it back in and continued on and still had to FIRMLY close it every time opened! By the 3rd time I’m using it it will not close, even firmly. I got right on Amazon and asked to return for a new one. Just got the new one today and even though I haven’t used it yet it closes so much differently! I’m excited to try it out and so very thankful to Amazon for exchanging it so quickly and with NO fuss or muss! The two times I did cook in this ( I have another kind also) I loved it! The clean up was so much better and quite a bit more room in the basket. I highly recommend the air fryer!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 7, 2020
CommentsContent: My first Corosi Air Fryer was defective. Amazon replaced it and this one works perfectly. I’ve been trying to reach Corosi’s support help, both by their phone number and also their email, both without success. They don’t answer phones now, but rather give their email address, which is non deliverable. Can anyone say “frustrating”?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2019
CommentsContent: BUY THE COSORY AIRFRYER XL 5.8 QT ON FEBRUARY 28, 2019. AND TODAY NOVEMBER 25, 2019 ONLY 9 MONTHS BROKE.AT THE BEGINNING I WAS CONTENT WITH THE PRODUCT. BUT TODAY DISILLUSIONED WITH THIS PRODUCT. DO NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE ABSOLUTELY TO ANYONE

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I'll hit preset button for say 6 minutes and the food is still raw.  The fryer will randomly shut off.  When i turn it back on it just beeps until unplug it and start it again

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2021
CommentsContent: We have loved this since we got it right at about a year the front panal buttons stop working. I looked us the website and got ahold of a customer service agent. He asked for info and pictures. I assumed it would go nowhere. The next day I got a email that they were sending us a new one. It’s refreshing to deal with a company that stands behind there product. Thank you Cosori for your hospitality we will be buying more of your products.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2021
CommentsContent: I have returned five air fryer ovens and one air fryer "pot" and have found the perfect air fryer in this one! It toasts bread/bagels beautifully and is the easiest fryer I have used! No mess to clean like I had to with the oven air fryers; EASY to clean--no sticking; perfect frying! So far I have made chicken wings, stuffed mushrooms, turkey burgers, bacon, and fish. I LOVE IT!!! Finally!! This one has everything I've been looking for in an air fryer--presets for everything I cook, a drawer that captures drips and batter, non-stick surfaces that come clean in soapy water, and clean cooking space (no drips on oven doors and bottoms)! I highly recommend it!

CommentsTitle: Need to adjust times and learn to work it a little more.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 21, 2019
CommentsContent: It works great so far. The only problem I have with it is I follow the instructions to the T in their book and my items are still burnt. I've made fries, and fried chicken. At first I thought I didn't have enough fries for the amount of time I choose but than I made the fried chicken exactly how the recipe book called and it was still burnt. The inside was extremely juicy and the flavor was great just wished they looked a little better. I'll keep playing with the time and tempature. Overall I am happy though.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2019
CommentsContent: Super easy to use and cooked perfectly. I made fried chicken and french fries for the first try. I simply used the presets and let it go.The chicken came out perfectly cooked and juicy with crispy Golden brown crust..no turning no bloody insides and no extra oil!Fries were super crispy and golden while still fluffy inside.Took 25min for chicken and 20 for the fries.All other recipes I have tried from the included book have been equally pleasing!Only con is that I don't have more than one....yet! As I had to cook the chicken and fries separately because of the quantity.....but man this thing makes me want to sell all my other cookware and just get a few more of these!

CommentsTitle: Earned it's place on my countertop!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2020
CommentsContent: I am new to Air Friers but happily stumbled upon buying this Cosori a couple of months ago.  I did carry it back and forth from the pantry for a couple of weeks but when I realized the functionality . . . Lets just say it has has earned its place on my crowded countertop. I have fallen in love with this item.  To be fair, there are only two of us so it is a perfect size for our meals.  But the thing I love the most is cooking and containing the mess, especially meats.  Bacon is great example- Both sides done evenly (in half the time and 1/4 the trouble) and the mess is contained!  Separate the basket, pour off the grease (I save it), rinse the tray and there is no bacon grease spattered over my stove, floor, cabinets and countertop.  Last night I did lamburgers in it. Perfect!! Hamburgers, steaks, chicken all turn out great and tonight I'm trying my first seafood.  Love my Cosori!

CommentsTitle: Was expecting more from a mature product ...
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2021
CommentsContent: Heard air fryers are great! Got the one my friend recommended which is super popular! Eh, after a day wish I picked a different model, was expecting more. Food cooks great, its functionality that is a bit disappointing. #1 Beeping is too loud and wakes people up. #2 There should be separate up/down for time and temp ... with this unit you have to make it beep to choose which you want and then it beeps loudly each button press ... is it possible to disabled beeper?? #3 Google/Alexa integration - there is no option to keep food warm after it cooks ... after getting to food you have to manually reheat it, kind of disappointing for an almost cool feature.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 26, 2020
CommentsContent: I was skeptical also about this but ordered one because high fat/greasy food gives my insides grief. We tried the BBQ chicken recipe the day it arrived and were happily surprised by how fast it cooked and the taste. We tried the regular fried chicken last night and were surprised again at how good it was. Crispy but not greasy at all. I’ll add more spices to the flour mix next time but it was really good.  Anxious to try others and I’m sure this appliance will be on the frequently used shelf with the electric wok.UPDATE: After a few uses the fryer would shut off and had to cool before coming back on. I emailed the company and they said that if I email them my info and a video of it misbehaving they’d send a new one. I did do, and sure enough they sent me a new machine and said don’t worry about sending old one back. So I’d recommend the customer service too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I received my Cosori Air Fryer XL last night and used it. It was wonderful! Very easy to use, easy to clean, and food quality is great! I hand washed both the basket and the liner last night after use. I went this morning to put them both back in and it keeps popping out and wont stay in. I called the Cosori customer service number, but received an automated recording that no one was available. I left a message for them to call me back. I used it one time and now cant use it all and have to deal with the hassle of returning the air fryer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 26, 2020
CommentsContent: PROS: Quick / Convenient / Consistent / Cooks Nicely / Easy Clean-UpSince purchasing the Cosori Max XL 5.8 Qt. Air Fryer 6 weeks ago, My family has almost stopped eating at fast food establishments ... because it's so easy and convenient to cook. We use it EVERY DAY / SEVERAL TIMES A DAY.It's worked like a charm. (Smile)Just place your food in the Air Fryer basket ... Set the TIMER based on the food type ... AND wait for the BEEP.FOOD RESULT: Crisp on the Outside ..  Tender on the Inside!  On SOME food items, it may take a couple of times to determine how long to cook a food item BASED on YOUR PERSONAL TASTE / LIKING. after that, it smooth sailing / cooking. :)  We strongly recommend this Air Fryer.  It has really EXCEEDED our expectations.CONS: None so far!

CommentsTitle: Amazing product and even more amazing customer service!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2021
CommentsContent: My boyfriend got me this air fryer for my birthday last September (2020). I've always been curious about getting one, but also try to keep my kitchen appliances low due to space limitations. Welp, he ended up getting me the huge 5 quart one and I was a little taken aback, but definitely excited to use it and try it out.What can I say other than I've used this thing about 80% of the days since I got it- so easy to use and you can quickly make your fries, veggies, and even full meals (even a full rotisserie chicken!). One of my favorite things to make is egg cups (in silicone muffin holders) for breakfast. We also make wings often, which the recipe in the book for the sriracha wings comes out perfectly!Anyway, so I've had my amazing times with this air fryer and decided one day to let my boyfriend use it for making some chicken for burrito bowls. He pulled the basket out, and due to his inexperience of using it, he let it sit halfway in the air fryer instead of pulling it out fully and setting it on the counter. Well, my life flashed before my eyes as I saw the baskets drop to the floor. I was able to somewhat catch it, but it still hit the floor pretty hard. Now I'm not sure if it was due to it being hot that it warped so easily from this, but both of the inside and outside baskets warped a bit from the fall. Nothing major- it was still able to go back into the air fryer and no steam escaped- it was more of an aesthetic issue. It was then that i set off on my search for replacement baskets (while seriously reconsidering my relationship- I mean, it's like he broke a piece of my heart). Only the internal basket was sold separately on amazon. This led me to reach out to Cosori directly- and they actually offered to replace both baskets at no charge as a one time courtesy! I definitely wasn't expecting this since it was our fault the baskets warped and nothing to do with the product itself, but what amazing customer service!Now I can't guarantee they would replace another person's baskets due to damage done from their own error, but it was definitely impressive they offered to do it for me and I really appreciated it! You can definitely count on their customer service when purchasing this product, which is always important when getting a kitchen appliance.And now, my boyfriend is going to be monitored a bit more closely when he cooks with it...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2019
CommentsContent: I decided to wait a little while before writing a review so I would have a chance to get use to using my airfryer and see if I like cooking in one. Well, I love my Cosori airfryer!  I am glad i got the larger size. I think anything smaller would have been too small for my husband and myself. I made the best thin cut bone in pork chops today! Crispy on the outside,  tender on the inside.  The only issue I have had is the small screws that hold the basket handle became loose and one screw fell out. Fortunately I found the screw and small nut. I put it back and tighten the others up. Something owners may want to check on their fryers. I still give it five stars.

CommentsTitle: 10 STARS! BEST APPLIANCE IN MY KITCHEN!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 6, 2020
CommentsContent: How did I ever live without an air fryer!? This appliance has literally replaced my oven ever since I bought it. I tend to relegate my appliances to a shelf or cabinet for the 1-2x a week I use them -- NOT THIS BAD BOY. He stays on the countertop because I literally use it every single day. Every day! You think a recipe can't be made in this? Think again. Anything that should go in your oven can now go in the air fryer for a fraction of the time and use way less energy. My oven takes forever to heat up, and you know it's big in there, so cooking time can take a long while! All of that goes away with an air fryer. You get that great texture on your food and reduced cooking time! This machine is also super easy to use, SUPER easy to clean and has all the easy buttons to make cooking whatever you're in the mood for simple. Cannot recommend this enough!

CommentsTitle: Only one button on touch screen works ??
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I actually can't believe the amount of good reviews for this product. Upon arrival I was excited to test this thing out only to find out that only ONE of the touch screen buttons work. Maybe if the one button that worked was the "start" button I would be able to use it with wifi but otherwise this air fryer is completely useless. I will be sending it back and buying another brand.

CommentsTitle: Maybe I don't know enough about air fryers
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I have never used an air fryer before.  I purchased this one and decided to make wings on Super Bowl Sunday.  I used the preset 'wing' function, which took 20 minutes (if I remember correctly).  Honestly, they came out exactly as if I had cooked them in the oven. . . not really impressed and not what I expected.  I thought they would be crispy as in 'deep fried crispy' or something at least similar.  They came out the same as in my oven - not what I wanted or expected.  I'll try some other items, or maybe not use the preset function and time them myself - I don't know.  But so far definitely disappointed.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2019
CommentsContent: UPDATE 6/24/19:  Need to give credit where credit is due.  The unit itself would randomly shut down during use.  It was past the amazon return period so I reached out to the company via the email address provided with the unit.  Despite it being a Saturday they quickly responded to my email requesting some additional information which I provided.  Within 24 hours they had responded with tracking information for a new unit on the way.  So far I have used it twice with no issue.  Very impressed with how crunchy the food is using this thing.....  Updated to four stars as the unit is working as advertised and the customer service exceeded my expectations.OLD REVIEW:Bought this April 4th.  It now will not even turn on.  Cannot even return it.  It’s not heavy enough to be a boat anchor.

CommentsTitle: Do NOT buy - screw fell out into our food
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2021
CommentsContent: Have had this for less than a year and used a handful of times each month. It is easy to use, annoying to clean (but all air fryers are), and we’ve enjoy some of the recipes...BUT yesterday one of the screws that is on the inside where the food is heated fell out and got mixed into our food and we almost bit into it while we were eating. This could have broken our teeth or we may have swallowed a screw. While we enjoyed using this, we will not be using it again. Just doesn’t feel that great to use anymore after this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I was skeptical about using air fryers, but it turns out really great! I use less oil than cooking in a pan, and it gives food crispy texture. I tried to make crab cakes, wings and potato wedges. They all taste pretty darn close to restaurants. One thing I love about this air fryer is they do all the math for you, therefore, food is not over cooked. Juicy, tender and flavorful. They also include a booklet to inspire  you to pick. I never bake dessert before and I’m gonna try to make homemade brownies soon. I’m really glad that I pick the white color, very classy and elegant. I would put parchment paper in there before I fry next time because it takes me quite some time when you try to fry different food. Overall I’m satisfied with this purchase:)

CommentsTitle: It has a lot of neat features
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I just received this product.  I have checked it out and I like what I see,  I had a cheap unit which lasted for about 2 years.  I could have still gotten by with it, but I wanted to upgrade.  I like the new features on this Air Fryer.  It seams to be easy to use.  I like the square design better than the round one I had.  I like that it has accessories that I can order for this unit rather than guess what items fit better.  I have never considered a Corosi unit until now.  I used my old air fryer every day for something...toast, cooking, reheat. etc.  I saw several recipes in the book that came with it that I had not seen before.  I think I am going to love this unit.

CommentsTitle: DO NOT BUY! Worst experience with a company ever!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this for my mother for Mother’s Day back in May as she had always wanted one. It arrived the day before, but to my disbelief they sent me a dehydrator instead. I immediately returned it, and had to wait another week to get the right product. When I did receive the actual product, the front panel was unresponsive and the device could only be operated via WiFi. Fed up, I immediately sent it back. That was almost two months ago, and I have yet to receive my refund or any clarity on when I might get it back. Purchase this product at your own peril.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2019
CommentsContent: We've been wanting an air fryer for several years, based on our research and reviews we decided to go with the COSORI Smart WiFi Air Fryer 5.8QT for a Christmas gift to ourselves and WOW it works like a champ!! So very, very impressed: Easy to operate, lots of good recipes, great online experience, etc etc. We pushed the limit of the 5.8 Qt capacity and cooked a 6 pound chicken and it came out 3 Thumbs UP! We cannot say enough good things about it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: My first Air Fryer, and I have to say I love it. We are a household of two and the 5.8 qt size is perfect for us. I see no need to ever put it in the dishwasher, as the cleanup of the 2 pieces is quick and easy. The convenience of not heating up a big oven is wonderful for us, and everything I have tried so far has been good. I cooked salmon a few nights ago, and it came out perfect. The first dish I tried was chicken tenders (just evoo and spices), and they were great. I'm a happy, satisfied customer!

CommentsTitle: Oh my God where have you been my whole life
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 9, 2021
CommentsContent: I've always been very skeptical about using these things. But being on a new diet I felt like maybe this was a better way to do it. This is absolutely amazing I don't know why I held out for so long. Everything I've cooked in there taste so much better than doing it on a conventional oven. I will say it's not better than my smoker but the convenience of being able to cook lots of things in a quicker amount of time and the fact that they're juicier than doing the oven it's so much of a bonus that I've actually started using this more than my smoker. this was definitely worth it I haven't tried the Wi-Fi feature part of it yet but everything else I have done it gets it all finished in the first shot. Warning large items that are frozen may take a second run through. But definitely worth it

CommentsTitle: Great quality & great touch screen responsiveness.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 28, 2020
CommentsContent: The air fryer is really what everyone says it is. COSORI is a great brand and the build quality is actually pretty great considering the price. The LED touch screen is super responsive and thankfully behind a layer of plastic covering (which is embedded so you can’t peel it) which means you don’t have to worry about the painted settings like other air fryers have. Biggest bonus, the basket is a square! This means you can fit more of the foods you love without stacking them.Unfortunately for me, after 5 months of use the basket/bucket wouldn’t click into place and kept shifting out. The good news, I called COSORI and explained the issue (3 min phone call) and they said they would send a replacement. Huuuuuge plus to be able to have a company that responds that quickly and painlessly. Customer service is A1 if you ever have any issues.

CommentsTitle: Cooks great! Build quality is awful!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2020
CommentsContent: This has been a long time coming...Honestly I love how these things cooks, it comes with a very helpful recipe book and it looks really nice. The reason for the bad score is because of the build quality. The screws keep falling off which makes the basket fall apart. The screw comes off when I wash it and would fall in the garbage disposal. I am already missing one screw.The air fryer basket is lose even after I try to tighten it. It's just irritating... It shouldn't be coming lose if the build quality was there. This is one of the more expensive air fryers so I would expect it to be built sturdy but sadly that is not the case....

CommentsTitle: Easy to use. Not dishwasher friendly. Terrible smell
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2020
CommentsContent: This air fryer has a great front panel control. In comparing to other models it’s easier to use. But it warped considerably after putting the basket in the dishwasher (the description says it’s dishwasher safe). However, the worst thing about this fryer is the smell. I did the normal practice of burning off any chemicals upon first use but after using it for about 50 times the smell is horrible and it gets into the food. Something not adding up

CommentsTitle: Wonderful fryer with a easy to use digital display
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I seriously love this thing. This fryer is super useful, easy to use and has allowed my family to make some of our go to fried items at a much healthier approach. It cooks up hot wings in no time that are juicy, crispy and retain flavor.  We’ve cooked up bacon and it came out so perfect that we no longer cook it on the stove due to splatter mess and over whelming smell. Note: there is a real great YouTube fryer community online that teach you how to cook up some delish food in a fryer in less tha n 15-20 mins.I’ve bought two as gifts and felt good knowing I gave them a legit gift that will be used and loved as much as I love mine.5.8 Liter unit. 👍🏼

CommentsTitle: Time/temp Buttons have never been responsive
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve had the fryer for almost a year and it cooks wonderfully but the buttons for temperature and time selection have never been reliable and generally  been non- responsive. Alexa sometimes works but mostly responds with a question about alarm.com. I would highly recommend air fryers, but not this one until they make the buttons more responsive. I have been using the pre-set buttons and just trying to get approximate time and temps to match directions, but it is really frustrating.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: I bought this for my husband (about a month ago, Xmas 2020) who likes to cook and he loves this machine. It checks all the boxes, easy to use, easy to clean and food tastes better. We have a large professional type oven/range (non-convection) and it is just not that practical when cooking for just two people most of the time. He has cooked a variety of foods and everything has turned out great. I would say so far, the steak has been the best. I am used to cooking on a gas grill and the steak cooked in this machine is better. He bought some of the accessories for it. The wire rack is great because it seems to allow for a better convection process. I like the fact it stores easily in a cabinet. I have a modern style home and prefer to leave the countertops uncluttered. Highly recommend this product.

CommentsTitle: It's basically magic. I wish I had one a long time ago.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 5, 2019
CommentsContent: I wasn't sure what to expect with this.It's basically a high-speed convention oven which cooks very evenly, and does a very nice job of crisping. I have tried a variety of meals, and everything has come out great. Fish, chicken wings, eggs, garlic bread, steak, you name it.You do have to manage your expectations though. You're not going to get deep-fried flavour out of this, because the food doesn't sit in the oil. It does an ok job. but it's closer to baked than fried. Fries/potatoes come out somewhere in between baked/deepfried. There's also no tossing mechanism, so the food doesn't rotate on its own.I also continually underestimate how fast it cooks food. I have routinely started it, and then started working on sides, only for it to finish far faster than whatever else I'm doing. I'm honestly considering getting two of the things just so I can do two things at the same time.Utterly simple to clean. I just throw the tray in the dishwasher.Overall, I'm amazed at the utility of this thing. I've used it every day since I got it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2020
CommentsContent: What do I like about it ?  The size and shape make it convenient for cooking; those round one reduce the space inside of the unit, this one has decent size for cooking.  The ease of use , the pictures for the presets make it easy to use and you have the option of increasing the temperature or time, if needed.  The food comes out great in a shorter period of time.  Although the unit is very easy to clean the only exception is trying to clean the fan unit.  You have to make sure you clean as much of the grease that can adhere to the top; there than that the clean up is great. I have a Foodi Grill that my children bought me but, I go to this unit first because it is much more lightweight and easier to clean.  I don’t leave appliances out on my counter so that is one reason it gets used more.  All-in-all, I am very satisfied with this unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 3, 2019
CommentsContent: I loved my air fryer. It cooked things perfectly, until it didn't. I went to use it tonight and my air fryer won't come on. Checked the outlets, the basket, unplugged and replugged it and nothing worked. Go to look at the return policy to see if I could give it another chance and just get a replacement or get a refund but my 30 day return period ended yesterday. Needless to say I'm very disappointed because of the price of this and how little I actually got to use it. Looking at what I will have to do to take advantage of the warranty doesn't even seem worth the trouble of returning it to the manufacturer. Really sad that it didn't end up working like it should have and that I'm now stuck with a dead appliance that I hardly got to use.

CommentsTitle: Was Excited, Was Disappointed, Over it
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2020
CommentsContent: I was super excited to order this because there were so many great reviews a lot of purchases and we have a Cosori electric teapot at my office which works beautifully, has a great design and a great look. I thought this would be great too. I love the little black box that sits on my counter top, it's a nice looking appliance. The noise level is average compared to that of a microwave. It's easy to use except that the buttons do not always work. I sometimes have to turn the power off and start over because the up/down buttons do not register. The screws for the basket have to be tightened continually, otherwise, they fall out while youre cooking (shaking) the basket. I actually had to tighten the screws inside the tray (the part the basket sits in) when putting it back together this morning. Yes, the teflon coating is starting to peel off already. Its dishwasher safe but I'm not happy with the way it cleans up, it still looks dirty and maybe that's just how it is. One of the biggest issues was that we had to start propping the drawer (basket) shut with out Vitamix. It would continually pop open at random times while we were using it. Now that I have been tightening the screws on a regular, we have not been having that issue as much. In reading a lot of the reviews and looking at photos, I'm quite certain that our handle will probably break soon too. I know it has not been a year yet since our purchase, but I am already looking for a replacement. It makes good veggie tots though! My favorite thing to air fry next to beer battered fish.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020
CommentsContent: We received our CODORI Air Fryer three days ago. In that time we’ve used it as many times for fried squash, chicken legs, and baked potatoes!  YES! BAKED POTATOES!!! This thing prepares EXCELLENT baked potatoes that are fluffy inside with a wonderfully crispy skin!! My wife and I love baked potatoes and trust us on this: This fryer makes the best baked potatoes EVER! Four-hundred degrees for 40 minutes! Put some oil on the potato, some garlic powder, and sea salt, then stick’em in the fryer!  The fried squash was amazing; the chicken legs succulent! There’s been absolutely NO mess around or under the machine. Totally easy to clean! Determination could be measured by the means to which you’d have to go to get this machine away from us!

CommentsTitle: We are very happy with our purchase.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2020
CommentsContent: It is quicker than the oven and does not heat up the entire kitchen. This is welcome in California. The flavor is equal if not superior. The results are more consistent than our oven. It is easy to use and we are finding ourselves using it more and more.  If you need to prepare for a large dinner party the oven is still the better choice because you can cook more of something at the same time instead of in batches.  Buy with confidence.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I had been looking at air fryers for about a year or so, trying to decide if I really needed another kitchen appliance taking up space in my kitchen.  Would I use it enough to justify buying one?  I looked at quite a few air fryers in the process of trying to make up my mind.  It became clear to me that if I was going to get one, it needed to be a larger one to make it worth it.  I had never heard of Cosori before, but it was an Amazon’s Choice and had good reviews.  I liked the look of it and that it had a more squared basket than round.  It was a little more money than I had initially wanted to spend, but I went for it.  So glad I did!  I love this thing!  It is so easy to operate and clean, and food tastes great and cooks so quickly!  It’s my new toy!  It seems to be well made, but I got an additional year on the warranty when I registered it (just in case).  I’ve made chicken twice, steak, asparagus, eggplant, and broccoli twice.  Very pleased with the results.  Like my Instant Pot, I wish I would have bought one sooner!

CommentsTitle: I wouldn't use this on boneless skinless chicken breast because the meat becomes dry
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2018
CommentsContent: I like how well this air fryer makes wings and sweet potato fries. I would recommend this for foods u would normally deep fry

CommentsTitle: WiFi connected, but no customization of presets or shake reminders. No exhaust port filter.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 25, 2020
CommentsContent: This unit does not allow for reprogramming of the preset buttons (through the control panel or the App) so you cannot customize temperature, time, or shake reminders for the preset buttons.  Other units allow you to reprogram the panel buttons.  Within the App, there is no way to add a shake reminder to custom recipes, this is a silly oversight.The unit does not have a physical power switch, so the only way to turn it off is to reach behind the unit and unplug from the wall.The unit has no filter on the exhaust port.  As a result, I find I have to use it under the vent hood which means setting it up on the stove (and thus not being able to use the stove).

CommentsTitle: great for someone who is blind
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 28, 2020
CommentsContent: I am blind and use this air fryer, now some of you may be thinking how does one use this device if it's a touch screen and they are blind? Well I control it via the vesync app on my iPhone with my phones screen reader called voiceover.I really like it, the basket is big enough to where I have experimented putting frozen dinners in it if they will fit. Most turn out well but some frozen dinners were not made to be cooked in an air fryer, but hey that's the beauty of experimenting.Recommend!

CommentsTitle: Far exceeded my expectations. Should've ordered a bigger one!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2020
CommentsContent: It takes a little longer to cook than a traditional fryer and is a little smaller than I'd like. However, I am amazed at how good it works. I have always been skeptical of air fryers so I bought this model for what seemed a fair price to try it out and see what all the hype was about. The results far exceeded my expectations and now I wish I went with a bigger device (but not knowing if I'd like it or if it worked how I'd hoped I didn't want to sink a lot of money into one). Well worth the money. Perfect for a couple or small family. But we have a family of six so it gets tricky making several batches. Still super impressed at the food. It takes a little trial and error to get things just right. The auto function buttons are very helpful for desired foods. It even has an alarm to tell you when to shake the basket. Clean up is amazingly simple. Much easier than my deep fryer.

CommentsTitle: Love, love, love the new Air Fryer!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Love not having to heat up the oven (energy cost savings!) to roast a few veggies or to heat up things that you really don't want to do in a microwave (pizza, bread, etc.) We use it nearly everyday. Easy to use; I'm constantly trying new things in it. Easy to search on Google for temp/time settings for nearly anything you want to fry, bake or roast. For heating up frozen fried foods, you don't need to add ANY oil at all. I DO recommend lining the basket with aluminum foil when possible for easy clean-up and immediate re-use without washing. NOTE: The 3 screws that hold the handle onto interior/exterior basket DO come loose so you'll need to use a small screwdriver to tighten them up. Discovered this when one fell out! Suggest you check these occasionally and tighten so you won't find a loose screw! (pun intended ;)

CommentsTitle: Strong Plastic Smell at First, but Otherwise Wonderful!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I paid $75 for it during Black Friday deals so I think it’s a 4.5 stars. If I were to pay the original price I’d probably give it 4 stars instead. Very easy to use and I like the smart phone app option. BUT, the plastic smell when used really bothers me. Every time I turn on the fryer a strong plastic smell comes out and it sometimes smokes my eyes. It’s getting a lot better, but it’s taken more than 10 uses to get here. I checked lots of reviews and QAs here. The seller suggested running the fryer at 400 degrees for 30 minutes, or soak the plastic in vinegar for 30 minutes. My friend who has the same model told me she ran the machine outside a few times before she took it in. I tried all the above and overall it took me more than 10 times to finally feel the smell is acceptable... I think it’s slowly going away, but just be ware...

CommentsTitle: One of the best IF not the best air fryer’s out there.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Everything works like a charm, food tastes great, large basket for just about anything, presets make it super easy, price is unbeatable and the best part the clean up, so easy. This is the one to get in my opinion. I know there’s a lot of them to choose...I know I was determined to get one from Emeril L. but when I saw this; the price, the features well...keep shopping and keep looking but I tell you the basket is a lot bigger then most brands. Good luck

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2019
CommentsContent: Are you kidding, I cannot believe there is an Air Fryer such as the Cosori 5.8 quart, I have only used it to fry Tilapia Fish with fries so far and believe me, I will be using this fryer for 90% of my cooking. The outside dimensions are great and especially the inner bucket to hold the food. Very nice styling, it looks great on the countertop. It is very solid, very well made. The touch screen features are excellant to fry foods, the cookbook that is included is tremendous.

CommentsTitle: Most have equipment for any kitchen !!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2021
CommentsContent: Pros:1. Super easy to cook!2. Large baskets.3. Easy to use and understand.4. App compatible.5. Easy to clean.Cons:1. Control panel is not very responsive.2. Gets very hot.Overall:Great entry air fryer for anyone interested. After getting this I do not use my own oven anymore. Its just so much more faster cooking this way and fried food tastes better!! Cleaning is easy since the basket comes in two pieces. My only problem is the control panel is a little hit or miss. You need to push a lot. Overall great piece for any kitchen.

CommentsTitle: This one is big, but works oh so very well.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 1, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a large piece of kitchen appliance. It was much larger than I thought it would be. It takes up a large space on the counter.It works extremely well. The rectangular basket holds a surprisingly large amount of anything. It cooks things just as well as baking in the oven, but just a few minutes quicker, and also using less energy.I'm still trying new recipes, but so far everything I have tried to cook in it has come out absolutely delicious and, most importantly, free of the cooking oils I'd need for pan frying.The only real downside it the pans are so large I can only fit the pans in the dishwasher with nothing else. A small price to pay for good food.

CommentsTitle: Love it, but it cooks way faster than it says so keep that in mind
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I burned the first 5 or 6 things we cooked in here because it just cooks way faster than the instructions say. I've found the cooking temp to be about 50 degrees less than the oven and cooking time to be 1/3 to 1/2 of oven. Just keep in mind you can always put something back in to cook longer but you can't come back from overcooked or burnt. Now that we've adjusted we are loving how fast it cooks and that everything comes out juicer and more flavorful than deep frying, with the danger, mess, health concerns, and without heating the house up using the oven. Highly recommend air fryers in general and I think we made a good choice in picking this one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 18, 2019
CommentsContent: The Cosori Air Fryer is a quality unit with many desirable features. The size is very accommodating, though it fits well and attractively on the counter. Display is easy to read and it is a breeze to clean.I was most impressed with the customer support which is willing, eager, and knowledgable to assist you. A rarity in today's retail economy.If you are considering the purchase of an Air Fryer, I highly recommend this unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2020
CommentsContent: My daughter had been very positive about using an air fryer even though she had a smaller one than this model. I decided if it was going to work out well for me that I wanted a larger one to handle more meal options. I decided on this model from Cosori CP-158F 5.8 qt model.I could not be happier with my purchase as I'm using the fryer almost every day for either main courses or sides. I have yet to cook something in it that wasn't as good or better in the fryer than previous methods.....usually better. Having a crisp outer surface with a juicy interior makes so many foods better.Have done everything from fry frozen food such as french fries and egg rolls to grilled cheese sandwiches to hot dogs to fried rice to filet mignon. The cookbook that comes with the unit has a number of recipes that are now in our routine for meals such as chicken parmesan. Google is your friend for finding air fryer recipes.I thought fryer would mainly substitute for the microwave and provide better "heated-up food". It does that and so much more. Would have never thought I'd be doing so many main courses in the fryer. And the fact that it cooks faster than a traditional oven is also a plus.I did bump into problem with bolts loosening in the handle that others have experienced. I would encourage you to check their tightness on occasion. Had tightened them once when loose. But the upper bolt in handle came out and the bolt for it is located inside handle and could not get it in position to repair. I contacted customer service  and provided the requested information. A new inner basket/handle was delivered FedEx at no charge just 7 days after reporting the problem. Communication from customer service was outstanding from initial reporting to providing a tracking number for the replacement part.I cannot compare  the fryer to other models or brands as this is the only one I've used. But am very impressed with this Cosori model and their customer service.

CommentsTitle: Super cool, super easy to use, and super easy to clean.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2019
CommentsContent: To be frank, I thought this was one of those gadgets that they sell on TV and it disappears after a while since it doesn't really do anything or solve any problem as they claim.But to my surprise, this has been one of the best investments that I made in my kitchen. I bought this on a daily deal and used it after a couple of weeks of buying it being still sceptic of it's abilities.When I used it first time, it blew my mind. Not fried, but fried? It was like " I can't believe it's not butter".Make sure that you buy the biggest version though since 5.8 was barely enough to put a whole chicken in it, so buying a smaller version is not a good idea.

CommentsTitle: Good product (now at a 50% price increase!)
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 29, 2019
CommentsContent: I love it. Frying without oil - who can not love it? Capacity is a bit modest, but that's a known deficiency of this type of fryers. I bought it at $83.99 only a few weeks ago. Now the price is $119.99, a whopping  about 50% price increase! I was going to buy one for one of my family members. But that's not going to happen at a 50% price increase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: What I love:Food comes out great! Didn’t think I’d like from scratch fries in here but they really do get crispy with very little oil! Love it for that! I use it mostly to get my kids quick meals like chicken nuggets and fries or taquitos, Texas toast, frozen pizza, crisp up asparagus. It’s a great size to get enough food for 2-3 people. Def not a full meal but a side. Tried roasting a chicken but wasn’t as moist as I like it to be, perfect an oven for roasting chicken. But I absolutely love the kabob skewer it came with! My daughter loves the kabobs and made me make it for her for about 5 days straight!The bad side?The basket is super tricky to clean! Time consuming! Also the tray the basket sits in has a screw that CONSTANTLY gets looks and causes the basket to sit funny and allow to much steam escape when getting g hot. Now the screw seems to be over screwed if that makes sense and is loose.All in all! I love it and I am an air fryer lover now! Maybe down the road when I need a new one I’ll probably try another brand but I bought this because it was inexpensive and it came with an additional gadget. But it really is great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2019
CommentsContent: I am really loving this air fryer. It's the first and only one I've tried so I can't compare it to anything else but so far I am very impressed! First of all, I love the shape of it. I've seen other fryers that were circle, and for some reason I never liked it, so I'm really happy this is square. Second, it's sooo easy to clean and it's dishwasher safe which is a plus. Lastly, it makes cooking SOO much easier and faster. So far I have only cooked regular potatoes and sweet potatoes but I can't believe how easy it is. Cut it up, drizzle some olive oil, put it in the air fryer and FORGET ABOUT IT. The potatoes come out crispy and delicious. Can't wait to try more things!!

CommentsTitle: Ehh! Perfect but WHAT’S THE BIG DEAL??
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Machine works perfectly - haven’t even used its WiFi. However if you don’t deep fry foods anyway, you won’t appreciate this machine - it does what my oven and broiler do. Place meat on a wire grate inside my shallow roasting pan and VOILA!  Grease drips off meat into roasting pan, calories reduced!I still must marinade or heavily season meat, fish and seafood or it will still taste bland if I just air fry it - I don’t use salt because I help control our high blood pressure.We bake fries, muffins, etc in the oven - why spend $120 for another counter space grabber? Okay so this machine doesn’t “heat up my kitchen” - but that’s only an issue in the summertime.Ehh!  Jury is still out re air fryers.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 13, 2019
CommentsContent: Fryer has a large capacity and is easy to use. Recipe book not fancy, but with enough to get really started. Clean up is no sweat - finding other recipes that will challenge this fryer - have no doubt that it will be capable. Three stars because box left by driver in front of garage and not on front porch, where items are usually left, exposed to the elements or theft. Poor form.

CommentsTitle: Great if you love the smell and taste of plastic
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Have used this 2 days in a row and made 3 different dishes. Disappointed to report that this machine is not made to be used immediately and NOTHING in the instruction manual advises to “condition” the machine before use. After reading ALL of the negative reviews I realized this machine should be turned on (as if being used but with no food inside) for about 5 hours  for the disgusting manufacturing plastic smell to go away. The first meal I made was bacon wrapped chicken and roasted potatoes and the smell was horrendous but the food tasted fine. The next day when reheating the food for lunch all of it tasted strong of plastic. I used the machine the next day to male pork chops again the smell too strong to bare (it even over powers the aroma of food you’re making)and this time the pork chops tasted like the plastic ass soon as it was ready. I’m “conditioning” the machine now. I’ve turned it on to 400 and letting it stay on at 15 minute intervals to see if this helps

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2019
CommentsContent: This is a great unit.  I've bought and returned an air fryer before and I've borrowed my mother-in-laws.  Both units were a pain in the arse to clean even though they made great food.  I decided to get this unit because it was lower price around Prime Day thinking I'd probably have to return this too if cleanup was too much.  We've used this air fryer at least 25 times or more since having it over last few weeks.  Each time the food has been great and the cleanup has been simple.This is worth the cost.The cookbook has been quite helpful as well for both ideas on what to cook in it and as a guide for cooking times on stuff you normally cook in a big oven.  No longer do we need to heat up the big oven to cook a few chicken tenders or heat up some other small item.  You do have to be careful and write down times (for future cooking) as this device has cooked these items much faster than my big convection oven.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 24, 2020
CommentsContent: This is a pretty new addition to our kitchen, and it's going to take a little bit of time to get used to cooking with it (as with all new things). The few things we have tried have turned out great, but I did overcook the steaks.There are two reasons it doesn't get 5 stars.1. It's noisy. The fan which circulates the air inside the cooking basket is definitively noisy.2. The touch panel at the front seems like cheap plastic. Response to touch isn't great, and it gives if you push a little hard.

CommentsTitle: Good product but with a couple small cons
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: There is not much to say for this air fryer. It does its job very well and the cookbook it comes with is definitely a plus. I only have two negative things to say about it:1) The buttons are touch-sensitive and do not always detect a button press on the first try. Often times I find myself pressing the buttons multiple times to get it to sense that I'm touching it. It can get annoying over time.2) The handle comes loose over time and needs to be tightened. It's not difficult to tighten but it is always going to be something to watch out for when using the appliance.Other than that it's still a good product and worth a buy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2021
CommentsContent: We ordered the COSORI Smart WiFi Airfryer for my dad for Christmas and we have been nothing but impressed so far! It takes a little trial and error to determine how long foods should cook to be at your preferred crispness, but once that’s figured out—perfect every time! We have made both frozen foods (French fries, tator tots, etc.) and fresh foods (breaded chicken cutlets), both exceeding our expectations for crispy outside and warm, well-done insides. We have found that some foods are just better with a little olive oil sprayed on, but it still feels so much more healthy eating these foods without putting them in the deep fryer!The shake reminder is an excellent feature of this device, as you can walk about and do something else and hear when you must move the food around. My dad really enjoys being able to preheat/adjust the airfrying using the Amazon Alexa.Overall, happily surprised with the quality of this product and it ended up being the best Christmas present of the year!

CommentsTitle: Great air fryer but has Plastic part that failed. Not a long-standing type of appliance.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2020
CommentsContent: So I loved this air fryer. Loved it. Had it since May of 2019.  But what sucked this week was as you can see in the picture the plastic pieces melted off.  And I don’t know how long the plastic was melting. Possible into our food.  It’s all metal basket  But the piece that connects is plastic. This really could have been avoided with all metal pieces.  Other then that it was a good air fryer.  Best one I have used and I got another one for a friend back in feb. just bummed about it breaking. :(

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2021
CommentsContent: I use this for everything!!!! Everything made in this air fryer taste so much better then when they are made in other wats. Super super easy to use and very easy to clean.  If you don’t have this your missing out.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2019
CommentsContent: The basket is falling apart after 2 months of owning this Cosori Air Fryer. I would have given it 5 stars if it was easily repairable but the handle would need to be taken apart to place and tighten the screw and secure it back into the washer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 30, 2020
