CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 31, 2019
CommentsContent: We have made so many different foods in the air fryer.  It's a learning process on  temperature and timing, but nothing we've made has come out badly. Fries are fast food delicious. Chicken wings and fingers are just like out of the deep fryer with none of the mess! The basket holds 2-3 servings and is very easy to clean either by hand or in the dish washer. I would recommend this air fryer to anyone looking to cook food faster and without a lot of added oil.  And just google whatever you're looking to make ..... there are lots of recipes out there.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2019
CommentsContent: It smokes like a freight train...I had read some of the reviews saying it emits white smoke but I figured maybe it wasn't bad and I could live with it since it had some other options I wanted.....however it pours white smoke and fills the whole house with smoke...I tried putting water in the pan as one person suggested but it didn't help...also the smoke causes condensation all over the air fryer and drips all onto the counter top...I've had three other brand air fryers and none of them smoked...I don't think this is a defective fryer I think it's just something the cosori does...not acceptable to me .I will be returning and trying a different brand

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2020
CommentsContent: I never had an air fryer before until now.  This is an amazing device and it's so easy to make food that is healthier than frying it in straight oil.  There is a nifty recipe book and you can find a lot of air fryer recipes on Pinterest.  The only issue I had was that some foods don't come out like I would like them, like bacon (I need it crispy) but it was not a deal breaker.  I have only had this for about 2-3 weeks and I love it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Buttons on the display are basically useless.  Not sure if mine is defective or common.  Works fine from the app, but don't always want to use my phone to cook..Edit 2/13/20 I ended up calling the company and rhey sent me a replacement one free of charge....this one is a little better, but the button issue still exists....

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Update to my initial 2-star review:  Cosori contacted me after reading my initial review and replaced the defected fryer with a new one.  The replacement works great.  I’ve increased my review to 4 stars since they replaced it for me.  They still should have taken care of this when I first called about the issue.  I would also like them to improve their app.Initial 2-star review:  Cooks great, but the control panel is junk.  I called customer service when I first got this and they offered no return on this and instead just said I’m not pushing the buttons correctly.  Not sure what else I can do.. I’m pushing the buttons and nothing happens.  I can sometimes get a few of them to work for awhile after turning it off and then back on but it’s short lived.  We’ve gone to using the app, but that’s not always a great solution either.  After my wife uses it, I have to connect to the fryer again.  This happens every time and is very annoying.  If the manufacturer reads this review, you should replace my fryer with a new one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2019
CommentsContent: This is the real thing. Love it. Really. Had doubts a few years ago about an air fryer but this thing works. Steaks, potatoes, chops,corn...on and on.Edit Update still good. Whole chicken good; boiled eggs bad; pork roast/carnitas good; cod good; pizza good... Everything needs experimenting on time and temp and use your eyes. I don't mind the noise, love that is does not heat up my kitchen, and for my wife and me it is great. I use it everyday.This is not a miracle product and it has limitations (small basket even on the large unit). However, it does work, no hiccups yet with the electronics.  Some foods are just better in the big oven or in a gallon of oil.Still working on boiled eggs, though

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2021
CommentsContent: I had never used an air fryer before.  I have been pleased with the way meat cooks in the air fryer.  I haven't used it many times but it does seem to work really well.  I fixed a dessert with it tonight that tasted good.  I am still getting used to pulling the drawer out and releasing the basket.  It seems a little awkward but I am getting more used to it.I like the square shape of the cooking basket.  I think it can cook more than a round basket would be able to. Overall, I do like this air fryer.

CommentsTitle: Great air fryer...quick and easy to use.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this air fryer. I have cooked foods from meats, fresh & frozen French fries, potato skins, to chicken tenders all perfectly. I like that it keeps the meats crispy on the outside, but tender. It is so quick and easy to use. Also I find it easy to clean the baskets and I can easily wipe it down inside.  I have actually bought my son one for Christmas. I am sure they will love theirs too.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 4, 2020
CommentsContent: Pros: This air fryer performs wonderfully. Cooks food to perfection, settings are great, basket is a nice, big size. We use it almost daily and recommend it to everyone.Cons: We have owned this for six months and the basket is rusting? We don’t wash it every time we use it, as many things don’t create much grease at all, and when we do we hand wash and dry upside down on the counter. I’m concerned that it’s going to get worse and not sure I want to pay $100 twice a year to keep using something even as great as this?

CommentsTitle: Very good, also excellent customer service.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: I’ve pretty much cooked everything in here. From all types of meats, veggies, frozen foods, even deserts. Everything comes out perfectly cooked. This has been one of my best investments. I highly recommend it. Just make sure to sign up for the extended warranty!!I purchased this air fryer back in December 2019. After 1 year and 2ish months it malfunctioned. It began to smoke up and release a burning order. I used it at least 3-4 times a week. I contacted cosori via email, and got a response within minutes. Their customer service was excellent! A new replacement unit was sent to me, and i’m back to using the air fryer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2021
CommentsContent: Not impressed with this new unit compared to my older Non Wifi unitThe new unit doesn’t seem to cook as well as my older non Wifi unit.  It doesn’t seem to push as much air and thus doesn’t get as crisp.The buttons also don’t work nearly as well.  I have a hard time getting it to respond.  The Wifi app does help with this, but when I’m standing in front of the unit, id rather push a button instead of getting out the phone or yelling at Alexa to make the changes.Overall I wish I’d kept my old 5.8 Unit instead of getting this new Wifi unit.  It just doesn’t seem to cook as good

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2020
CommentsContent: This product has a flush face with no physical buttons to press for your selections.  You are supposed to depress the area for your selection and the selection is supposed to light up.  You can press all you want and certain buttons may or may not work.......most cases they do not work.  For this reason, I would not recommend this product.  Save your money....look for something else.  This is a design flaw.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2020
CommentsContent: This is very needed item to have at home! It cooks fast and the food is super delicious! I've cooked salmon from Costco in it, and it wasn't dry finally but juice and flavorful! The chicken legs we cooked had crispy skin and soft truly cooked inside! Very delicious! And I'm glad to think that the food we cook in it is a little bit more healthy as cooked with no grease and oil.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020
CommentsContent: This thing is awesome 👌  I put off buying  one for a long time thinking  it would be something  else that takes up room and another kitchen appliance  that never actually gets used.  I have used it like every other day since it came! Cleaning is quick and painless, settings are easy to use and the food it yummy with no oil  😋 wish I'd bought it  sooner! Whole family  approved

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: I loved (note past tense) my Corsori Air Fryer. Pros:—Easy to use—Energy efficient—Versatile—Compact—AffordableCons:— A bit loud—A bit small—Lasted only ONE YEAR!!Yes. One year. And I had a voltage protector on it, as I do with ANY appliance that has a circuit board and computer. I even unplugged it after every use. I’d used it about 2-3 times a week, which is what I consider moderate usage. Anyway, about a month ago it turned off while it was running. Then on again. It was an anomaly so I just hoped it would not happen again. Yesterday I was cooking some chicken breasts in it on a 350 15 minute cycle. Near the end of the cycle it stopped and started two times, so I unplugged it and tried another outlet just in case that was the problem. I plugged it in, it started again for about , and that was it. Air fryer dead. 🙁

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2021
CommentsContent: Love this air fryer! Did a ton of reviews and this was highly recommended. Go ahead and get this one if you are looking.  Works excellent and just sorry didn't buy one sooner! From my experience so far it cooks faster than the time required.  Fries will burn if you aren't careful.  It takes some learning to figure out the exact times but once you do it's so simple to cook with.  Pork chops and even ribs did very well in it.

CommentsTitle: I love it so much already!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2019
CommentsContent: After this air fryer was delivered today I unpacked it and couldn't wait to test it out so me & my dad made some tilapia fish in it and they came out juicy and delicious!!! This thing is definitely a keeper. Tomorrow we are going to make the French toast sticks recipe from the recipe book😋 I can't wait to try them out! This is also one of the best orders I've made on Amazon😁 if you're still looking around for an air fryer on Amazon, buy this one! You won't be disappointed:)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 12, 2020
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I love it!!!! I was very scared since I’m a lousy cook...i usually cook for a dozen and we are only two. I made this video for my mom and is in Spanish but I guess is self explanatory 😅

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 7, 2020
CommentsContent: I read a bunch of reviews before buying this. I have used it for a few months now (almost every day) and love it. It seems sturdy and makes things in a jiffy! If your on the fence, just go ahead and get it because it will probably the the best thing you ever do for yourself!Now I don’t make big huge things in it, though I’m sure I could because it’s very large. I use it for every day food and breakfast sandwiches. I use it for things I never even thought I would when I first got it.I used to eat a lot of fast food but now it is much faster to just make it myself!

CommentsTitle: Highly recommend! Great model and brand!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Love this product! I just did a video review on youtube between this model and the Paula Deen 9.5 quart model.  There is no comparison between the 2. I am returning the Paula deen model.  The only issue I have with the Cosori Is that it is not big enough. Other than that this model is excellent! With the Paula Deen model it left certain things soggy on the bottom even after flipping halfway through cooking. This model does not even need flipping with pre fried foods such as fish sticks. I do shake in between but do not have to flip. Digital is also the way to go.  I highly recommend this brand and I use it at least 5 days a week and sometimes multiple times A-day. I can also say you are able to cook a 5 or 6 pound young chicken in this 1. You do have to push it down a little bit in the Pan to make sure it doesn't hit the heating element But I have been able to do that with no problem. Highly recommend!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2020
CommentsContent: I'm really glad I bought this. I do note though, that cooking temperatures and time that automatically show up may be a bit high and long. Experiment a bit. I don't like my foods to come out really dark or nearly black, so maybe it's just me, but I find that lowering the temp by 10 degrees and the cooking time by a few minutes (depending on the food) cooks the food to my liking and the food is safely cooked. Buy a food thermometer if you have doubts.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 20, 2020
CommentsContent: If you are looking for a great product in air fryers look no more! I originally owned a smaller air fryer made by a different company. I was very impressed with this air fryer easy to clean cooks in very little time and food taste but way too small.  I went in search of a bigger air fryer with the square basket and came across the Cosori  Wi-Fi air fryer.This is another item to add for a smart home. You may ask why do you need an air fryer with Wi-Fi, I said the same but I find that I use it very often! This app also provides cooking menus of all sorts and you can join a group via Facebook to also enhance your cooking experience.Originally there was an issue when I first purchased product, but I image like anything else when you have mass production there are sometimes flaws. I contact customer service they respond within 24 hours and resolve my problem to my satisfaction. I love this product I would definitely recommend!

CommentsAuthor: I Buy Lots of Stuff I Don’t Need
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this thing. Most of the air dryers have pretty bad reviews. What I like about this one is how interactive the company appears to be on reviews, so that was the deciding factor in why I chose this. I went with the WiFi version, but to be honest probably could have foregone that feature. I have yet to use anything via WiFi. This thing works great and I have made so many yummy things in it. It is easily my most used kitchen cooking gadget since I got it. Everything from bacon, chicken nuggets, chicken Parmesan, empanadas, and broccoli. We are going to do some churros this weekend. Easy to clean and it’s sized perfectly to make enough food for a family of five (usually in one or two batches, but things cook quickly).

CommentsTitle: Air fryed turkey legs are just as good as oil fried
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2019
CommentsContent: I decided to dive into air fryers. I have 5 instant pots, 2 for home, 2 for work, one for Holidays (8 quart) Bought my Mom one too. I purchased the corsori air fryer before spending more on an instant fryer 10 quart. One plate of fries, 2 plates of crispy chicken and one of half potatoes and I was hooked. So I bought the Instant fryer.The cosori is better than the instant fryer. Easier to clean, Crispier food, mind you, the rotating roaster and chicken roaster and light on the instant fryer is awesome to see thru the glass door - that you have to clean, as well as the sides of the fryer, and the rotisserie or basket. DO GET AN INSTANT POT, but for air frying? COSORI !  Just bought one for Mom for Christmas, and i Have one at work, and one at home.

CommentsTitle: Less than a year and the Teflon  is coming off, going to try ninja which has ceramic not teflon
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2020
CommentsContent: I bought this product in March of this year I use it almost daily and today I noticed that the Teflon is starting to peel off. I have contacted the manufacturer I will add more stars if I get appropriate feedback. There is supposed to be a one-year warrantyEdit: heard back from manufacturer and they recommended I purchase a replacement basket from Amazon when available. Not doing that because that would be teflon coated too. Some warranty :(I am going to try the ninja airfryer b/c it is a ceramic nonstick coating.

CommentsTitle: I knew I’d love my Cosori!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 14, 2021
CommentsContent: I’m in love with this thing! I put some leg quarters to air fry and let me tell you omg! The chicken was so juicy and crispy the way I like it. I’d like to add that I am the worst chicken making in oven person. I will dry out my chicken and my bf and I will eat it in disgust Lol!! We both ate 2 pieces of chicken!! I also threw in some Brussels sprouts and asparagus which also came out delicious! This air fryer is the best choice I’ve made hands dwn!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 18, 2020
CommentsContent: After hearing my daughter rave about how much she likes the fryer her sister gave her for Christmas I bought one as well. I got the newer digital (without WiFi) and find that suits me well. The Cosori Air fryer is so easy to clean as compared to using an oil fryer!The flavor and appearance of the food is great and beautiful! So much so my husband now feels he doesn’t need to replace our gas grill! It is so easy to use I just need to get him to learn how to use it! Our teenage grandkids use their fryer to do tots and roasted veggies, something they wouldn’t have done with an oil fryer!

CommentsTitle: Excellent Air Fryer for the price
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2019
CommentsContent: So far so good. I have only had the fryer for a few days. I have cooked frozen French fries (trial and error on time), pork chops and chicken wings. Chicken wings did great, pork chop a little tough but flavorful and chicken wings were the best...very juicy and tender. My only complaint is I would like a chart, and even on some of the recipes, that showed the weight of the meat used.  You can buy pork chops that are paper thin to over 1 inch thick. Cooking times are not equal and not all fryers are equal. I downloaded a chart off the internet that is a start. So I guess trial and error will be the norm until I can get used to the cooker. But overall I think it's an excellent device especially for the wife and I. Now no need to turn on the oven or cook top just for the two of us.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 15, 2020
CommentsContent: I Really like the COSORI over the INSTA POT. I tried to make pizza in my Insta pot and it came out horrid. Lol. Lack of circulated heat under food an I put very little food in it as I am cooking for a 4 year old, So there is PLENTY OF SPACE to expect a nice crisp, but didn't get it. NOW...this COSORI... does very well. I don't even really need to flip it but I just do it for good practice and when I did oh boy I some sizzle when I flipped a chick patty as "IF" it was a dedicate heat source from the bottom, that how well the heat circulation is. The buttons could use some reconfiguration but I just I fix the temp and time myself. I rather that than NOT be able to get my crisp no matter what I do. Happy purchase thus far.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2021
CommentsContent: Had two other brands and this one is definitely the best! The flavor is incredible! So easy to use with the digital program settings... super easy clean up too!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2020
CommentsContent: I just got my Cosori 5.8 WIFI enabled air fryer. So far, I love it!! I can literally preheat it from anywhere in the house, it is amazing. I made turkey bacon and cookies so far, they came out perfect. I joke with my husband about it being my new baby. -adult wins! Also, it comes with a 1 year warranty, however if you register your Cosori, it adds an extra year. So you get a 2 year warranty for free!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 25, 2020
CommentsContent: The reviews are right, I'm amazed and totally hooked. I couldn't be happier with COSORI Air Fryer Max XL. I was debating what size of an air fryer to get and thought the COSORI Max XL would be too big and wide for my needs and my countertop...however, with a family of 4, it's perfect. I can make all sorts of dishes in a shorter amount of time, it's easy to clean and a healthier option to the fried foods my family loves. The only downside is the air fryer is a tad heavier than I would have liked but as long as I don't move it too often, it should be fine.

CommentsTitle: I feel like I can cook now.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: If you don’t have one of these, you’re missing out. We live in NYC and have lived on delivery for as long as I can remember. What is cooking? Well the cosori air fryer showed us. This arrived right before COViD 19 lockdowns happened, and we’ve been cooking with it every day. The recipe book was a great starting point and we tried a ton. Now we’ve gotten a little more confident and are trying out our own recipes. Looks great On the counter (and I hate keeping appliances out) Everything has been delicious, cleaning is a breeze, and me and the lady are much more excited about making great food at home. Revolutionary!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2021
CommentsContent: First want to say that I originally had the Ninja Foodi air fry oven. It absolutely sucked so I decided to return it after a few months of use. I exhausted myself reading reviews of legit air fryers (with baskets) and came across the Corsori. I have only used it about 5-6 times mainly for frozen foods and it has been nothing short of amazing. Quick cooking time and crisp food every time! Super easy to clean and is truly non stick in every aspect! I don’t know how long the machine will hold up for but it’s been great for us thus far. Try it out you won’t be disappointed

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 14, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought the air fryer with zero expectation. Besides, it was on sale on Prime Day. Well,  it has exceeded my expectation. I've made chicken, pork, veggies, fries, and even roasted almonds and walnuts. It's basically a handy little oven on my kitchen counter. Although it took a bit of experimenting to get the right "crispness" level, since sometimes things can come out a bit more charred than I prefer. The cleanup isn't difficult. The baskets are dishwasher safe, and I wipe down the interior with a moist paper towel after it has cooled. I wish I had bought the smaller size though. 5.8 Quart is a bit large for two people, and takes up quite a bit of counter space. Overall, I'm very happy with this appliance.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2019
CommentsContent: This is my third air fryer-all different brands. This was the least expensive but works the best. The second fryer stopped working after the first use. I’ve had the first fryer over a year and love it but sometimes I like to air fry side dishes with the main. I also cook for 4 of us. Tonight, I cooked the chicken in this fryer. The chicken came out moist with a crispy coating. It was perfect. So easy to use. Didn’t even need the directions. It’s super quiet compared to the others. It’s a keeper!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2020
CommentsContent: This is my first air fryer and it has become one of my 3 must have small kitchen appliances.  Texture and flavor of foods is far better than any instant pot, microwave, crockpot, etc.  Food is cooked quickly and clean up is a dream.  I do line the bottom with tin foil and use  the pre-cut parchment paper liners if the item has a sauce or marinade on it --- but that is because I'm lazy and want the shortest clean up time/effort possible.  Love that it has a square, not circular cooking space to fit more in.  Best of all it doesn't heat up my kitchen  like using the oven does (summer - no AC).

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2018
CommentsContent: I’m in love with this fryer. Wow!  It cooks quickly, things are crisp and flavorful and cleanup a breeze.

CommentsTitle: Tray auto ejects - Broken after 10 months - Updated 5 Stars - It fixed itself
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2020
CommentsContent: Updated, it miraculously fixed itself.  No auto reject now.  Back to 5 stars.This was a great product until it developed an auto eject feature.  While cooking, the tray pops out.  I'd like to give it 5 stars, but we'll see how their customer service performs.  I feel I should not have to pay shipping charges if they want the broken unit back.  Best scenario is that I send them a copy of my invoice and a video showing the tray ejecting by itself.  Cooking of course stops when it ejects as should be, so the safety feature does work.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2021
CommentsContent: I use the air fryer several times a week.  Especially like using it for chicken breasts, fries both white and sweet potatoes. Of course veggies are good in it also.Have had it for several months now and really like it.Bought a second one for my daughter in law for Christmas and they seem to like it also.With both orders they came on time with everything intact.The only con is to be sure not to use anything harsh to clean the pans.  I did use a scrubber on something that had stuck a bit and it did take the coating off on a very small spot.  So now I just soak it a bit than only use the dish cloth to clean it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I have had this just a few days but loving it so far.  Veggies were yummy; chicken good (but pre-set time was too long so a little overdone - but I'll learn.)I like the oil-less factor and the push and forget until done!Seems well made, not too loud, attractive, and holds a good amount. (I bought a 'used' version to save a few bucks - but it was brand new; only new sealing tape added).I'm pleased and pleased I purchased.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 20, 2020
CommentsContent: We used the air fryer to bake our typical frozen mini corn dogs, but it was a fail. It doesn’t look like it cooked evenly. It had a very strong Teflon smell when in use so it’s very unappetizing to eat any food made with the air fryer. The area where the nails are used to hold the handle is hard to clean. There’s tiny crevices there with high chance of food debris and grease/oil can hide. However, I did like the smart feature of being able to control it from my phone. It’s just not worth it if the food isn’t cooked evenly.

CommentsTitle: Broke in less than 4 months! Very disappointed!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2020
CommentsContent: So I was actually getting good results cooking with this air fryer. It just takes a little bit of experimenting honestly.I got this as a Christmas gift from a family member. I took really good care of it and cleaned it like instructed. One morning I was cooking bacon like I always do every morning, then I started to smell smoke and what smelt like something electrical coming from the kitchen. Big billows of smoke were coming from the air fryer and smelled like something was catching fire. I run over turn it off, and unplug the air fryer freaking out. After giving it some time to cool down I unplug it. I'm freaking out thing the food must have caught fire even though I used the same settings I always do and never had issues. I open the fryer and the bacon is fine and still slightly undercooked.That being said it could have caught my place on fire if I hadn't gotten up quickly enough and I'm very disappointed that this product didn't last. I would not even consider a replacement at this point seeing as it's not very safe in the first place.Do yourself a favor and just research other brands.

CommentsTitle: Just got my air fryer, fast sample testing.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Even though i just got this Air Fryer yesterday, I wanted to come on and let everyone know that this is an easy air fryer to use. it will take some time for my family and I to adjust the times to what we like. I tried the original settings for french fries they were over done, but i think that's because i used frozen french fries on the french fries setting which is intended for fresh cut from potatoes french fries. My son's pizza rolls were perfect crisp wise but he didn't like them as he's use to the oven where when its heated up the pepperoni in the rolls melts the grease and it brings out more of the flavor and it didn't do that with the air fryer. But we will keep trying. Its easy to clean and very easy to use. We are happy and are now looking for even more recipes to try! Great Product, i will tell everyone i meet who is wanting an air fryer how happy we are with this one. it was the one with the best reviews, best pricing and all around best options.

CommentsTitle: Great Air Fryer With what I think has problems with baskets!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 15, 2019
CommentsContent:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.










  
  
    
   I have used this a couple of times so far. Just got it Aug 14. I do like the pre heat an then select what youare cooking. The main thing I like is being square and not round like an egg is sitting on my cabinet.I have a video attached to this showing what may be a problem and it may be normal for this fryer.The baskets inner and outer connection have a lot of slack as shown in video. This may become a problem in the futurewith use. I have had other air fryers “egg shaped” that had very little or no slack at all. So I hope the Mfg. cantell me if this is normal for this unit. I would have given 5 stars if it didn't have so much slack in baskets for itis a good cooking unit.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2020
CommentsContent: Cons; I bought this air fryer in September. It is now December. It still has a strong plastic smell when food is cooking. I was hoping the smell would go away but it hasn't. The front plastic face plate on the basket has started to melt and is now coming off. The basket isnt staying closed it pops out and stops cooking.Pros; it cooks good! But the food has a slight off taste I think it is from the strong plastic smell. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I was mine by hand.

CommentsTitle: WOW 🤩 What took me so long???
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2020
CommentsContent: I’ll admit the idea of air fryers sounded silly to me until my daughter convinced me to give it a try. So glad I did! First of all, my Corsori is beautiful and looks great on my counter. It has lots of pre-set buttons that make it easy to get started. Glad I opted for the larger 5.8 square basket, it fits 2 steaks perfectly and the extra room allows for better air flow. I’ve  used it every day since it arrived....I LOVE IT! My husband considers himself a Wings Connoisseur, and he says these are the best he’s tasted.  So far I’ve made several variations of wings, fish, meat loaf, steak, mozzarella sticks, and Brussels sprouts. Everything was crispy, juicy and delicious, quick and easy.  Seriously....what took me so long!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2021
CommentsContent: I was very skeptical when I purchased this because I wasn’t familiar with the brand, but the number of reviews convinced me to take a chance, and our oven died and needed some way to cook food.  I also thought that the whole air fryer thing was a fad, I’d had a Cusinart air fryer and the Instant Pot lid (which I didn’t like at all) however I am so glad I got this.First, I love this because it really is a small convection oven and so it is so much more versatile that just crispy French fries.  Today I made cookies for my child and I and since our oven is on the fritz, I tried them in the air fryer and in 6 minutes we had something delicious!It is super easy to clean and I am thinking about getting a second one so that I can make multiple things. I love this air fryer!

CommentsTitle: We really like the COSORI Air Fryers
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2020
CommentsContent: We have the smaller size COSORI Air Fryer and like it so much we had to upgrade to the COSORI 5.8QT  Air Fryer.The first 5.8QT arrived with a defective non-stick coating inside the basket which is bubbled and flakes off.Received a replacement and there are no defects in the non-stick coating - excellent!We're excited to be able to cook more/larger portions with the 5.8QT unit and very pleased with this purchase.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 8, 2020
CommentsContent: The first one I ordered had a defective keypad. They immediately sent me a replacement and scheduled me a free UPS pick up for the defective unit. Ups picked up the defective one and delivered the new replacement the next day.This was also the most well packaged item I've ever gotten. It looks and works great. Easy cleanup too. I've used it a dozen times already and it works great.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I love how easy it is to use my airfryer. I have used it now to cook salmon, steak, and chicken and the food comes out great. Its super quick, I have dinner ready in 15 minutes. I dont have a mess to clean up after and best of all my house doesn't get warmed up with the cooking which is a reason I was avoiding to cook during the heat wave in California. Now I can have my fast home cooked meals every day again. I would recommend it to anyone struggling with eating healthy and cooking at home.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 25, 2020
CommentsContent: Great Air Fryer! I have literally used this EVERYDAY since I received it. Easy to clean and super easy to run. There are 2 issues I do have with it though, 1. The screws that connect the handle to the inner basket keep coming loose. 2. There is a minimal amount of steam leaking through the bottom left front of the basket. Both do not affect the usability but a little annoying. All around it's a freakin' cookin' machine!

CommentsTitle: Best air fryer for no oil cooking!!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 10, 2019
CommentsContent: I’ve owned or gifted six air fryers, three Nu Waves and three Phillips. I’ve also purchased an Air Fryer XL and immediately returned it because of poor cooking. One Nu Wave broke one month after purchase. They all cooked ok. We cook completely oil free. The Cosori is easily the top choice. My standard is oil-less crimper-cut Russet potatoes which I snack on daily as part of my whole food plant based diet. The Cosori does easily the best job with the potatoes as well as Beyond Mest burgers, broccoli and anything the grandkids want. You can’t go wrong. We own two.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 1, 2019
CommentsContent: I did a lot of research on Air Fryers, please allow me to tell you, you will not be disappointed. We have been using the Cosori almost every day, The recipes in the book cooks perfectly, we did the vegetables, all the meats with exception of lamb and they all cook just as instructed in the book. I love the fact when cooking chicken you do not have to flip it midway. We actually roasted a small turkey breast without the bone, and it was so moist and tender. It does not take much oil at all, less than a tablespoon.  I had purchase the Ninja airfryer and although it work sufficient, it could not come close to the Cosori. We love this product.  And to clean the basket is awesome. You do not need parchment paper for any reason. It cleans very well. The design of the product is well made. Very easy to operate. It is very easy to operate. Give it a shot.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 22, 2020
CommentsContent: We are bonafide Air Fryer Converts!!! We bought our 5.8Qt. Cosori in December. Ever since then - Gospel TRUTH - we cook 100% of our proteins in our indispensable air fryer. Ready? We cook Key West Pink Shrimp; Filet Mignon; Pork Tenderloin;  Chicken breasts; Steelhead (Ocean) Trout (healthier/tastier salmon-esque); Snapper varieties of all kinds; Grouper. Why?!1) FAST2) SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCED ODORS3) HEALTHY (most we do is a very very very light extra virgin olive oil coating to adhere spices.4) SUPER EASY CLEAN UP!We have learned to cook every single protein at 400 and we almost always use the pre-heat. Meats take 4-5 minutes then flip then 4-5 minutes then rest 4-5 minutes. Steaks turn out phenomenal - even have a slight crust!Pork goes 6 flip 6 because we eat a 7 oz tenderloin cut.We cook fish at 400 also and .75 to 1.2 pounds generally takes 8 minutes. We usually go for 6 minutes (the standard Porto setting is 400 degrees and 6 minutes) - check the fish and then go another 2 minutes.A pound of KW Pinks takes 6 minutes (would be ok at 4-5).The flavors and juices are perfect every time. Single best appliance we’ve ever bought.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2019
CommentsContent: I have been leary of the whole air frying craze of late.  After several friends encouraged me, I purchased this one.  It works great!  I'm single and cook smaller portions of course, but since I got this thing, I haven't used my stove or microwave at all!  I've cooked many different things and it has not disappointed me at all! Time will tell if it holds up but for now.....it's awesome!  I would recommend the accessory kit if you cook for a larger group.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 4, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this for about 2 months now and I will say this thing saved me from slaving over a stove lol. It's just me and my son so I dont have to cook too much so for what we eat this is the perfect size. The instructions are clear on how to use, it even comes with a recipe book which was helpful.When I cook, I add a little bit of cooking spray to the bottom and use a air fryer liner so it's not as messy. So far, it's very easy to clean, nothing sticks to it but I haven't tried it through the dishwasher yet so I dont know how it is after being ran through one.

CommentsTitle: The New Smell That Never Left
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2020
CommentsContent: Like so many others we ordered our airfryer during Covid to help diversify our meals. Unfortunately, since the first use we've experienced a smell that has always transferred to our food. We initially thought it was the newness of the fryer, but the smell and taste is still here. I wish I could say it is easy to clean, but we have the hardest time removing the basket to clean. My sister has the same one with no issues, maybe I have a deffective one.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2019
CommentsContent: The only negative thing I will say is the basket kind of has a cheap feel.  So you you feel the need to be very careful with it when handling and pushing it in.  Other than that it is amazing.  I made the best chicken wings I have ever made, and I have tried many methods.  Better than most restaurants.  I have also tried fish, chicken breast, and fries.  All with great results.  If this thing holds up it will be an amazing part of the kitchen.  I like results of things I've tried much better than instant pot.  Though there are things that will still be great in the instant pot and can not be cooked in this.

CommentsTitle: How to use it and cook with it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Always remember you have to heat it first, with nothing in it. They don't seem to tell you that.  We have had problem with it burning french fries, It could be caused by putting just a few in the fryer. Don't know. Also cooking pork chops, it does not tell you how. We used the stake cooking, that seem to work. The taste of the pork chop was good. I believe once we get use to use it and how to cook with it I believe we will love it more. The cook book seem to have been written by a computer not a cook.

CommentsTitle: Very convenient and easy to use
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2020
CommentsContent: So the air fryer certainly lives up to its reputation and does cook items as if you fried them in oil. French fries, bacon, shrimp, fried chicken, and even grilled cheese (yes I'm sure that sounds strange) are just a few of the things off the top of my head that were cooked to perfection.This particular model comes with an easy-to-understand recipe book that is about 85% accurate. The missing 15% is that you may need to play around with the listed temps but once you find the right temp, it cooks perfectly. You can even get away with using some oil as well which many air fryers don't support.I docked a star off my rating because despite how awesome and convenient this model is, it has a few minor faults. The screws that keep the tray intact as well as the drip pan intact do loosen up, likely from the heat of the fryer. You will need to periodically tighten them. The plastic front cover of the sauce pan is also beginning to detach, again likely from the heat of repeated use. I have attached pictures showcasing the above statements.Ultimately, this air fryer has quickly become my favorite cooking tool and despite its minor faults, would definitely recommend it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 6, 2020
CommentsContent: This product is a big risk, I'd advise into looking into a more stable and thorough product.The safety hazard is the basket of the air fryer opening randomly. It can be 15 minutes into cooking, 3 minutes preheating whichever. I've made precautions and made sure it is securely closed but the problem still persists.The last incident it happened, the basket popped out and fell off the counter. The basket was in separate pieces and I burned my hand trying to pick it up. On top of that I lost the food I was preparing and had to prepare some more.

CommentsTitle: Low quality coating, I would not purchase again.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2020
CommentsContent: I have to say I love how this works and makes meal preparation really easy, however, the coating that the pan comes with had started chipping and bubbling. I fear l may even have eaten some of it. I have used this machine less then 10 times. I would avoid.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 20, 2019
CommentsContent: Only lasted 7 months.Updated review. I loved this air fryer and used it daily. Sadly the handle that attached to the basket came apart after 7 months.I love it! My meat is always nice, tender, and juicy. It’s so easy and cuts my cooking time in half. All you do is season the food and put it in the basket and time it. It has made my life so much easier

CommentsTitle: Healthier alternative if you like fried foods
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 6, 2020
CommentsContent: My friend finally convinced me to buy an air fryer after a year later. I chose this one because I got to use it at his house for a couple of days. I’m so glad I bought it!! No more wasting oil when deep frying! Also, using the air fryer is much healthier. However, I do feel like I have to play around with the temperature and time when cooking certain foods. Definitely had to check on my food from time to time to make sure it wasn’t burnt. FYI, I did over cook and burned some fries. Also, I don’t get the same exact texture of the crispiness as if I were to use oil (of course because it’s an air fryer). Other than that, I think it’s a great product!

CommentsTitle: Make sure you get the model you pay for by checking the settings 1st.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 15, 2020
CommentsContent: Very easy to use small convection oven. Food browns and bakes nicely. I was concerned about some of the reviews mentioning the plastic smell when used.  I washed it as instructed and took it outside, and primed it by using the preheat cycle 4 times, letting it cool down in between each time. I am hooked on this air fryer. I feel like I hit paydirt with the first purchase.The only very bad thing was it did not come with the shake feature as described. I did Not get what I paid for, I received an inferior model.  If I hadn't performed the priming and baked in it, I would have returned it. Bait and switch.

CommentsTitle: Perfect for 1-2 people. Can easily replace several cookware items in your kitchen.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2020
CommentsContent: After I purchased a Cosori air fryer, I was so pleased with its ease of use and how delicious the food was when prepared, I purchased one for my son. Being single and working 12 hour days, using a conventional oven is not always an option for him. There is a reminder to alert you to turn the item over for even browning. Whether it is a grilled sandwich, steak or fries, the food is moist, tasty and easy to prepare. A receipe book is included.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2021
CommentsContent: I was very skeptical because of false advertisements and everything that comes with shopping on line. I thought "ok, this wont be that efficient for me, but lets try it." I bought this air fryer as a gift, we tried the chicken parmesan recipe in the book that comes with it and wow it was delicious! I even used gluten free bread crumbs and they came out crispy and the chicken was moist. It was super easy to use, the book walked you through step by step and the clean up was easy!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: I am so glad I decided to jump on the air fryer band wagon.  Its been the best cooking experience ever.  I really do enjoy my Cosori air fryer.  I liked it so much that I bought one for my mother for Christmas.  Unfortunately, I went with a different brand since it came with other features.  I regret it and feel bad for my mother.  The "other brand" is not nearly as user friendly as the Cosori.  Cooking with the Cosori is as easy as 1-2-3 and so is  cleaning it!!  I haven't gotten super crazy with it, but it makes the best steaks and burgers.  I plan to return my mother's air fryer and replace it with a Cosori.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2020
CommentsContent: I only had it for one day so far.... But, we cooked three meals breakfast, lunch and dinner in it and it was amazing! Easy to use, easy to get going and easy to clean. Fun as well. It also came with so many different ways and things to cook! If it keeps on like this I might buy a second one just to cook more things at once. The spot where you place the food is deep in size and can fit a good amount but, if you want to cook for a lot of people you may need two or a bigger one. Great for a family of 2 or 3.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 13, 2021
CommentsContent: Cheaper than the top reviewed Phillips air fryers by so much I couldn't resist trying this brand and model. Having used it and cleaned it a few times I fail to see how it could get much better. Works well and unless it wears out 3 times faster than Phillips brand ones it was a great deal. Make room on your counters for one more thing, cause this is going to be hard to put away. Oven flavor will a few more minutes than the microwave. Pretty good stuff.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2021
CommentsContent: This is literally the best thing every. Everyone makes fun of girls who love their air fryer but it’s so true. My boyfriend is jealous of how much I love it. It makes breakfast on the go easy with Alexa aspect. A quick 3 min preheat and a 3 min cook for a jimmy dean English muffin and it’s perfect to grab and go to work. Anything frozen and fried? Perfect. Half the time and twice the crunch of an oven.  I tell everyone to get an air fryer. I should get a sponsorship honestly

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 10, 2020
CommentsContent: The only reason I’m giving it only 3 stars is because the basket/drawer warped over time. We purchased the end of January. We have only had it for a little more than 2 months and have only hand-washed the drawer and basket. But it will no longer lock into the fryer And is visibly warped.Prior to this, food came out just right when using the air fryer. I really love using it, but the warped drawer is now making it difficult to use since it will not stay latched while cooking.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2019
CommentsContent: I don't normally post reviews, but I have to commend Cosori for their exceptional customer service.  No one likes to deal with an appliance that quits working.  The fan quit working on my air fryer after about 4 months.  I contacted customer service to find out the process for dealing with the warranty.  It couldn't have been easier.  I provided a video of the issue and proof of purchase.  My air fryer quit working one week ago today and this morning my replacement was delivered.  I couldn't have asked for better customer support.  I love my air fryer and use it almost daily.  I use it to cook chicken wings, steak, and for reheating.  I love it and would definitely purchase from Cosori again.

CommentsTitle: Awesome product, does have some issues
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 29, 2020
CommentsContent: This is the best Air Fryer I have ever had, and I've gone through a few. This COSORI WiFi Air Fryer works miracles of food. I have baked, fried, and reheated using this unit. Baked things like single-serve pizza slices, potatoes, chicken, etc. Made fries, onion rings, chicken nuggets, and much more.The issue I have with the unit, however, is a similar issue reported by another reviewer, wherein the front panel buttons are not entirely responsive. We can sometimes get them to respond, using the full pad of your finger, rather than a finger tip. It's annoying sometimes to get things to start due to this, and at times, just resort to using the app to start the food cooking. All-in-all though, the issues are minor compared to the great benefit of not having to heat oil, and also wait for the oil to cool after. And the added health benefit of not having to ingest so much oily food is a plus. Highly recommend this product. Hopefully the company releases a v2 unit with more responsive buttons, or a fix for this one.

CommentsTitle: Wifi issues and buttons to operate the fryer stopped working
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2020
CommentsContent: The entire fryer is in the trash (literally).  The Wifi feature doesn't connect (from the moment I bought it the wifi feature didn't work).  Also, the buttons to actually operate the machine (they are not physical buttons but digital ones), stopped working even after very hard presses.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND you buy this item.  I've spent thousands on amazon and this is the first item i've ever given a one star rating to.  Please buy a different brand.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I loved this air fryer.  It cooked a little hot but I learned to adjust the time and the food came out great.  I bought this for my cottage and used it maybe 10 times in the month I was there.  Returned for another two week period and when I tried to use it the front panel will not light.  You can blindly push the buttons and they will respond.  I have turned it off and on, unplugged it and nothing has changed.  I guess I will return this unit.  Delivered on July 18th so just over my return to Amazon date.  Warranty says return in the original packaging which no longer exists.

CommentsTitle: MEN! It's The best Tool in the kitchen! Ever!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 20, 2020
CommentsContent: Dear Cosori,Thank you so much for this glorious creation!!  My wife (only since receiving this air fryer) has figured out with her magical powers, how to make the best damn ranch chicken I've ever had!!  It's so easy to make she's even willing to make it several times a week!  She never complains about making dinner when the air fryer is being used.  I need you and everyone else know how great this is!  Here's a short list:Easy to cleanCooks food fastEasy to useQuietIt's the best... 6 stars if I could!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2021
CommentsContent: I purchased this air fryer on April 20, 2020 hoping it would be useful for increased cooking at home due to COVID restrictions. I used it twice within the first two months with no problems, but I did not use it often. When I went to use for the 5th time, it did not work and hasn't worked since. While it powers up properly, it does not get hot or cooks anything. I immediately reached out to the seller, but go not response. Next stop, the manufacturer, which is a huge annoyance since the item is brand new and barely used. DO NO BY THIS ITEM AND STAY CLEAR OF THIS SELLER. An expensive air fryer that doesn't work is nothing but counter trash that no one needs. Disappointed customer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2021
CommentsContent: WhenI first bought this in 2019 it's been working and cooking great. It was also super easy to clean which changed after  a year or so. The basket is pretty much no longer nonstick. It's a great appliance to have and can make healthier cooking easier, but cleaning the basket each time now is what makes me not want to use it anymore. Also the build up inside the air fryer around the coils. It's like after every use I have to deep clean the whole thing which is my least favorite part about using this air fryer now.Update:Cosori was kind enough to send me another air fryer. Now I can make all my favorite foods again without dreading having to clean the basket. It's so easy to clean now that it's new. Easy to operate, faster than the oven,  healthier than traditional frying. Get this air fryer it's worth it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2020
CommentsContent: I use this air frying about 2-times a week. Food comes out perfect. I have done a roast, steak, fish chicken wings, mozzarella sticks, all sorts of potatoes,  left over french fries are so tasty and heated up pizza. I have made food from the Cosori cookbook. Food comes out perfect!  I LOVE the Bluetooth/Wi-Fi function. I can be in another room and it notifies my phone when its done preheating or done cooking or when I need to stir the food.  I love the basket, Its the prefect size for a roast, fish or steak. Its super easy to clean. I have had no issues of the coating on the basket peeling. I have put it in the dishwasher and hand washed it. I have not had any issues with smoke coming from the unit, but do I clean after every use.What I DON'T like/hate, the push/screen buttons are hard to operate. Sometimes they work, sometimes I have to repeatedly push a program button touching it lightly or putting some pressure on any buttons just to get it to work. That is very frustrating.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States July 3, 2020
CommentsContent: Mom tries to make as many things in the air fryer now because oily foods like bacon don't splatter all over the range. The drawer comes out for easy cleaning, but I haven't seen what the "ceiling" of the drawer looks like yet.

CommentsTitle: So happy I made this purchase!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2020
CommentsContent: I researched and asked friends who owned air fryers many questions before finally deciding to buy one. I am so happy that I did! I also wasn't sure if I wanted a smaller one, but I am happy I did not go that route. Although it's just me I am cooking for most of the time, this is a great size because I like to food prep and it doesn't matter if you are cooking a little or a lot. I have boiled eggs, made various styles of chicken breast and wings, and various vegetables so far. Everything has turned out great and the process is much healthier than how I used to cook! Big bonus: The unit is very easy to use and easy to clean!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 1, 2019
CommentsContent: Takes up a lot of space. Very quiet. Food isn't any better than oven/stove. Not really useful. Not a bad product just not for me. Food was really dry. Cooking times/temp is off.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020
CommentsContent: I have always wanted an air fryer, kept putting it off.  Now after the first use I am kicking myself for not getting it sooner.  Super easy to use.  Very easy to clean.  Looks sleek and nice in the kitchen.  First thing we tried were buffalo chicken wings.  Now we are spoiled, we will never get them outside of the home again because they were pure PERFECTION.  Crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the outside.  French fries perfectly crips on the outside, tender inside.  Now we plan meals around the air fryer.  Sorry oven, you have been demoted!

CommentsTitle: Air fryer good, basket handle defective.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2021
CommentsContent: Bought this in June 2020. Loved this air fryer for the past 8 months. Then after 8 months the basket handle just broke. Looks like the plastic handle disintegrated where it attach to the basket. Since posting this, they have sent me a replacement  basket. I did file a claim through their website. I hope they remedy this problem with the handle. I don't want to buy  a new basket every 6 to 8 months.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2021
CommentsContent: On Amazon, there are so many products to choose from (from all types of unknown brands), so purchasing this was really a shot in the dark. However, I'm glad we went with this Cosori product because it has been incredible! It works wonderfully, is easy to clean, and can hold plenty of food. For anyone looking for an all-purpose, heavy-duty air fryer, this fits the bill. I'm glad I went with this one instead of the less expensive options with limited functionality.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 27, 2019
CommentsContent: Main complaint is that before 2-months of ownership the fan rattle's violently causing a terrible noise; too loud to continue to use. Product is useful if it doesn't break down. The food has been delicious. Looking for a replacement...

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 22, 2020
CommentsContent: Its so big (that's what she said)! My only gripe currently is so minimal that I debated even putting it in this review...but...the 'buttons' just don't feel worth the $85 that I purchased this for on Prime day. Overall as a mother this is making things easier when it comes to getting meals together. It's a little weird to get used to at first and it actually makes a lot of noise, but so far what we have cooked has been really tasty. Its nice not having to bust out the cast iron AND turn on the oven to make chicken for the kids. SOOOO...the million dollar question.....is it worth it? Is it going to step my kitchen game up? I bought it because it was on sale and my mom budget brain wouldn't let me pay full price when I do have a perfectly good stove for cooking. I'd say if you don't mind spending the money OR you buy it on sale like me..... it's a good investment (so far that is). It's saved me time in the kitchen which helps when it comes to nighttime routines. So for me, it's worth it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020
CommentsContent: I am writing about the COSORI Smart WiFi Air Fryer 5.8QT.Right out of the box, i could not power it on.  The power button is lit but does not power the machine.  I gave up after several attempts and left the machine plugged in 45 min later, it suddenly comes on by itself, the keypad lit.  After cooking chicken (well cooked by the way!), I turned it off but then could not turn it back on.  It took another 15 minutes and it came alive when I pressed the power button.Update: I wrote the paragraph above over several months ago but forgot to submit my review.Well, now the air fryer won't even turn on, even after I left it on for almost an hour!  Maybe, I got the one lemon in the whole manufacturing process and I am quite disappointed.I don't understand a power button that does not power a machine on.  Any ideas, anyone?

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2020
CommentsContent: smells like straight up plastic. ive cleaned it twice with soap and water and preheated it four times to get the smell out and it didn’t work. my house smells like plastic now.

CommentsTitle: The perfect fryer for the lazy chef.  Love it.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2020
CommentsContent: This thing has changed my life! I love love love the Cosori air fryer. It’s easy to use, hold a lot of food, and cooks everything I’ve put in to perfection.  I stayed away from cooking fried foods because I’m lazy. This Completely takes the time and mess out of frying.  Amazing.One little piece of advice though: Don’t add any oil to the food unless you’re going to stand by and babysit the cooking process.  I discovered early on that extra oil isn’t necessary, and it will overcook your food very quickly.

CommentsTitle: Way better than our first air fryer
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2019
CommentsContent: I bought this for my husband. We used to have a small round one that was starting to tarnish from overuse. He used his little one everyday so I knew it would be a good investment to shell out more money for a quality one. Hubby is so happy with this. It cooks faster and gets hotter than the other one. Because it has more space being square-shaped instead of round, his food comes out crispier and better. The old one was smaller so sometimes things came out a little soggy where food touched/ overlapped - but not with this one. We can use it for everything and it cooks so quick. No need for oil. He likes that it's digitized - the old one just had a timer dial. The only bummer is that I got the black one. They were out of the white ones and our kitchen is white. When I went back for the white one, it cost A LOT more than the black. Husband said that it's not worth that much money to get a different color. I'm just nit-picking at this point though. Everything else was positive.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2021
CommentsContent: Love the capacity, cooks quickly.  Clean up is not easy when washing the basket especially the sides.  The buttons to change the temp doesn’t work and when I tried calling customer service (several times) I never reached anyone.  Now the warranty has expired.  I still use it using a preset with the right temperature but have to keep pushing a preset button to get the time needed since I can’t change the temp manually.  Would I purchase again?  Probably not because of the design of the basket (the sides) very hard to clean and the buttons to change time and temp never worked.  Lastly customer service need to answer the phone.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a Gowise Air fryer before this one and it met an untimely demise from a wife spilling her horribly over-sugared/creamed coffee on the electronics.So, I got this one.WOWOWOWOW I've been missing out on the size/performance of this one vs the gowise.The nonstick basket is WAY better too.

CommentsTitle: The Cosori Air Fryer is a WIN!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2019
CommentsContent: I am very happy that I decided to purchase the Cosori air fryer. The reviews are not exaggerated. This air fryer is amazing. I have used it daily since purchasing it. The Cosori 5.8qt is sleek and pleasing to look at. The basket is large enough to prepare a whole chicken. There are 11 presets available to help with accurate cooking times. I can't say enough about this product. I look forward to preparing more meals and snacks in it.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 10, 2020
CommentsContent: I purchased the COSORI Air Fryer,Max XL 5.8 Quart, because of the recommendation on a cooking site.  I am delighted with it.  Even though I live alone, I chose to purchase the larger 5.8 qt because I frequently cook extra servings,  either for leftovers or to freeze and have later.  I decided better to be extra large than to be too small.  I've not been sorry.  I love that it bakes biscuits, fries bacon and will still make french fries and does not heat up my kitchen.  That's especially important in the summer.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 3, 2019
CommentsContent: So far - used to “fry” shrimp, french fries, chicken wings, bacon and veggie mix.  Everything turned out great, clean up is very easy.  My challenge is training other family members how to use it - warm up temp, timing, turning and to keep their fingers off the release button.The air fryer is quicker, doesn’t use a lot of oil (big savings on olive oil), doesn’t heat up the house (reduced energy use), easy clean up and time saving.

CommentsTitle: Surpringly lived up to the hype
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2020
CommentsContent: Easily the best purchase I've made this year. I heard all the hype about Air Fryers and was hesitant that it would be similar to the InstaPot hype (which I found to be disappointing), but this exceeded the expectations and the hype.Works amazingly for reheating leftovers or for quick lunches for kids - Frozen nuggets, pizza rolls, etc.For dinners from scratch at home, I've used it for Eggplant parmesan, Milanesa, General Tso's chicken, and sweet potato fries. All have come out great!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 18, 2020
CommentsContent: We absolutely LOVE this air fryer. It has helped so much especially in the summer months when we don't want to heat the whole house with the oven. About 9 months in the handle on the basket broke off and when I contacted customer service they provided us a replacement and were very prompt in all of their responses to us. Very pleased. From our experience, it would definitely be wise to always be checking the screws on the basket handle as they do tend to loosen. But considering how much we use it a broken handle and loose screws are minor problems. Would definitely buy again!

CommentsTitle: A kitchen appliance that I’m pretty sure you’ll use!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States April 1, 2020
CommentsContent: I’m new to air frying and have a lot to learn,I’m sure. That said, I was very pleased at how my first 3 attempts turned out (fish, potatoes, and roasted veggies). I’ve also discovered that this machine is fantastic for heating up left overs — much better texture than microwaved and not that much longer.  The basket is huge and rectangular so it can easily make enough for a small family. It’s a large device to leave on the counter,  not too heavy which is good but not flimsy either. I’m pleased that I went ahead and got one (had been thinking about for awhile)

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 24, 2020
CommentsContent: The Cosori Smart WiFi Air Fryer is the bomb dot com! It is super easy to use and the recipe book that comes with it is awesome! I love that I can control it with a free app on my phone, it's really convenient! The food is cooked perfectly and is delicious. I would recommend running it through the procedure to get rid of a plastic smell, but after using is a few times it was completely gone. I'm cooking ALL THE TIME now and making really healthy food! I purchased a separate accessory kit with a mini pizza pan, cake pan, muffin mold, kabob skewers, toast holder, etc. which makes it even more useful. Don't hesitate to buy this, you will not be disappointed!

CommentsTitle: Love this!!! Go get one and buy one for a friend!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States June 6, 2020
CommentsContent: The only thing wrong is that I didn’t own this sooner. Man I wish I had one when my kids were smaller. I love this thing!! It cooks almost anything without heating a huge oven and even cooks it better than an oven. I have cooked almost everything. Bacon, biscuits, burgers, fries, wings, muffins. Great also for reheating things like leftovers from a restaurant or whatever. My teens like it too because it’s easy. It’s fun and I hate to cook. I think it’s because it’s easy and so far everything has been so good in it. My only regret is that I didn’t by two. Lol. I seriously love this.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2020
CommentsContent: I had a Phllips XL Air fryer for 2 to 3 years now and it seemed like it was on it's  last leg. So i decied to see what Amazon had. Seeing this is the best rated air fryer decided to give it a shot with all the positive reviews. This air fryer does not disappoint. Way easier to clean my Phillips basket had a metal mesh and food would always get stuck in it. This one being non stick cermaic address this problem. And this air fryer is way mor consistent heating the food. Night and day difference.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2019
CommentsContent: This air fryer is money well spent for both your health and wallet! For $120, this air fryer is amazing and your waist will thank you. With air fryer foods, you can have a similar texture of fried foods without all the oil. Most recipes I've made in this air fryer, I haven't used more than 1-2 tbps of oil, tops. Usually I don't even use oil, just some cooking spray.I've made fries (obviously) both fresh and frozen, panko fish for fish tacos, wings, bacon, fried chicken and even roasted a full chicken! Everything comes out amazing! Crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I was skeptical to buy one of these things, but after a lot of research I finally caved and I'm so glad I finally purchased one. Don't think you can only make food in the air fryer that are normally fried. You can pretty much use this air fryer for anything you'd put in your oven.This is the second air fryer I purchased. The first one was cheaper and after I tried it out, I liked it so much I invested some more and got this Cosori. It's bigger and had some nice extra features the cheaper one didn't. It also comes with an awesome recipe book. I'm so glad I finally bought one. I've convinced my coworkers to do the same after showing them some of these pics in my review. Don't hesitate and buy this air fryer! You won't regret it!

CommentsTitle: You need to sync to your phone/burning smell
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2020
CommentsContent: So far I've only made one thing in the air fryer. I was super excited to get one after falling in love with my boyfriend's (I'm not sure was brand but was very basic... No touch screen). I was excited this one had a lot of features and had a nice sized basket. During set up I really didn't want to connect the device to my phone but I had to download an app, make an account, sync fryer to app... and finally I could start cooking. I started with turkey bacon and 2 minutes into it cooking it smelt like burning plastic.... So I'm hoping that will go away but I made sure to remove all the packaging and I washed the basket before cooking. I also feel like I had to force the basket in an out of the fryer. Was just hoping for something a little easier to use.

CommentsTitle: Another kitchen appliance !!!---BUT worth the space!!!!
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2019
CommentsContent: I know, yet another kitchen appliance gadget. But this is definitely worth the space it takes up. When not in use it tucks under the cabinet. When in us it needs to have nothing above or behind or around it. It is extremely easy to use and clean dishwasher safe). We have cooked all sorts of dishes in it. Would highly recommend this appliance

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2019
CommentsContent: We gifted my single brother a small version last year that he used many times.  This year he asked for a larger one so he could cook more/bigger items at the same time.  He absolutely loves this model.  The settings are easy to use and the cookbook has given him new dinner ideas.  Cleanup is also fast and easy - just what he needs. Now I'm waiting for our older (different brand) to die so I can get this upgraded model for us.

CommentsTitle: I would like to be able to get my money back, but the return window has closed
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I unboxed the air fryer, plugged it in, pre heated it, and got to use it once. Now, the air is not working at all. Cannot utilize functions. Very upset 😡 also,  when I first edited unboxed the air fryer, there wasn't a manual and/or recipe book inside like I was lead to believe when I purchased it. The company said they would send one, never received it. They said it was available on the internet, but that is another issue. Not a great experience to say the least

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2020
CommentsContent: Update: Never received the replacement basket. Still don't know where it is after 22 emails back and forth. Yesterday I noticed that now the nonstick coating is peeling off of the inside of the bottom basket. It's been used maybe 10 times. I have requested a refund and that has been approved, which will take at least 2 weeks, if they stay on schedule. It has been a frustrating experience dealing with the inferior quality of the device as well as poor service. At this point I can only conclude that the device is meant to be a throwaway, use it a couple of years, then toss it and buy a new one. Definitely not for me and not what I was looking for. I will update if there are any issues with the refund. By the way, your refund is a gift card, not reimbursement.It cooks great tasting food but I have a significant issue with the screws that hold the handle onto the inner basket coming loose after each use. I suspect the expansion and contraction of the metal is causing it but surely there's a better way to secure the handle since this fail point could cause injury to the user. People that love this machine are going to say so what, just tighten the screws, but that shouldn't be good enough for anybody. From what I have read, this seems to be fairly common and my daughter's machine has the same issue. I don't have high hopes that the replacement basket I requested will perform any better but I will update if it does.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 20, 2020
CommentsContent: We have used this air fryer about twice per week since our purchase in early April. I wash it on the top shelf of the dishwasher  per instructions.  This week I was taking it out of the dishwasher  and found both rusting. There was nothing wrong when they went in, but unusable now. The manufacturer better take care of this problem.

CommentsTitle: Not a bad product however the one I have had button issues from the start.
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2020
CommentsContent: I've had this almost a year now and felt I should finally drop in a review. It does a pretty good job, if not for the fact about a third of the buttons are very difficult to activate it would be a really good product. It claims to be a digital interface but from my experience it is not. It doesn't act nor feel digital and is probably the reason a lot of its buttons take many many touches/taps to get any response from. The product finally started to throw an E1error and at this point doesn't seem as if it is going to last much longer. The non stick coat is failing and overall I will say it has been a lukewarm experience overall.

CommentsTitle: Yummy results, be aware of extreme heat
CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2020
CommentsContent: Easy to use and clean. Make sure you have space around it to keep the heat away from the wall plus room to pull out basket to turn food. I sat it on a wood cutting board to prevent darkening of my formica countertop (a friend said to watch out for that) with enough room to pull out the basket and set it on the wood while working on the food.  Made keto fried chicken which was crisp and juicy.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States August 29, 2020
CommentsContent: The fryer is outstanding for cooking IF you can get the touchpad to do what you want.  Several keys on the touchpad either do not work or it takes multiple touches to get it to set.  I have given up and just cook things at the temperature and time that it has on it when it is turned on.  I would give it a five if the touchpad worked.  However, I can’t recommend this to anyone else based on my machine.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2020
CommentsContent: We ordered our Cosori in July and it had the strangest odor. We aired it out thinking that would solve the issue, but the odor persisted and permeated the food.  Luckily, despite being past the Amazon return window, Cosori had us supply them with proof of purchase and batch number and immediately sent a new one.  The new one has no odor we assume something was wrong with the batch of our original air fryer.  We are psyched to use it!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2019
CommentsContent: I love this product sooooo much.Before I purchase this, I shouldve got the smaller version because it’s really big and it’s taking up a lot of space in my kitchen.But, I cooked a steak in this air fryer once and it tasted so good.I love how cooking my food in this air fryer saved me a lot of time. When I used to cook my steak on the stove, it’ll take me about 20-40mins (depending on how cooked I want it) but it literally took me 10-15mins to cook the steak.Be aware that it does make a lot of sound when you use it, but it’s not to the point where it bothers you.Also, stay away from the air fryer when it’s being used.

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2021
CommentsContent: DO NOT BUY!!!! I purchased this product and it worked for maybe a month. Which was the exact amount of time they give to return!! So therefore I basically threw away 150$ into the trash!! Product is trash. I buy a lot of things on Amazon and they’ve always been great with returns. But this company would not even exchange the product. I called and wrote emails. They basically said too bad!!

CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States November 12, 2020
CommentsContent: I love this air fryer!I will start by saying, I don’t ever leave reviews for products unless I absolutely love them! I’m a person who does thorough research before I buy a product, and rely heavily on reviews. I saw this on Amazon day and got a great deal, so I figured I’d give it a shot (after hours of contemplation), figuring at the very least I just had a regular run of the mill air fryer that may or may not impress me.
